    <itunes:title>How To Spot Cyberstalking In Your Divorce</itunes:title>
    <title>How To Spot Cyberstalking In Your Divorce</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[What if your ex could secretly listen to your private conversations, track your every move, and even manipulate evidence against you ‚Äî all without being anywhere near you? It‚Äôs called cyberstalking, and it‚Äôs happening in divorce cases more and more. Steven Bradley, a former FBI cybercrime investigator and Amazon bestselling author, reveals how technology is being weaponized in divorce and domestic violence cases.  In this podcast episode, Steven explodes common myths about cyberstalking,...]]></itunes:summary>
    <description><![CDATA[<p>What if your ex could secretly listen to your private conversations, track your every move, and even manipulate evidence against you ‚Äî all without being anywhere near you? It‚Äôs called cyberstalking, and it‚Äôs happening in divorce cases more and more.</p><p>Steven Bradley, a former FBI cybercrime investigator and Amazon bestselling author, reveals how technology is being weaponized in divorce and domestic violence cases.¬†</p><p>In this podcast episode, Steven explodes common myths about cyberstalking, including the myth that perpetrators need to be tech experts in order to cyberstalk you. According to Steven, anyone who has basic computer skills and is willing to invest $7 for a computer program can install spyware that clones a phone and will allow your ex to read your texts, listen to you through your phone‚Äôs microphone, activate cameras, and track your location in real-time.¬†</p><p>The conversation takes an even more chilling turn when Steven discusses deep fake technology and AI manipulation.¬†</p><p>If you‚Äôve ever had the feeling that your ex is watching you, or somehow knows exactly what you‚Äôre going to do BEFORE you do it, you may not be imagining anything. You may be being cyberstalked.</p><p>Check out this whole podcast episode to discover more ‚Äì AND learn how you can protect yourself.</p><p><b>About Steven</b></p><p>Steven Bradley is an Amazon Best-Selling Author, International Trainer, Legal &amp; Technology Consultant ,and nationally recognized expert in law enforcement‚Äôs response to intimate partner violence, stalking, and technology abuse. A former FBI cybercrime investigator, he has led international trainings for over 28 years and consults with courts, law enforcement, and legal professionals. Steven now serves with Our Family Wizard, promoting safe, technology-supported communication for separated families. His work bridges the gap between investigative practice and trauma-informed approaches, helping communities respond more effectively to domestic violence and digital threats in legal settings.</p><p><b>Connect with Steven</b></p><p>You can connect with Steven on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/steven-bradley-10136022/'>Steven Bradley</a>.¬† Find out how to streamline your parenting schedule, shared expenses and communication with <a href='http://www.ourfamilywizard.com/'>Our Family Wizard</a>.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <itunes:title>Numbers Don&#39;t Lie, But People Do - Hidden Assets in Divorce</itunes:title>
    <title>Numbers Don&#39;t Lie, But People Do - Hidden Assets in Divorce</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Imagine discovering your spouse has been earning $4 million a year while you thought you were living a middle-class lifestyle.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Imagine discovering your spouse has been earning $4 million a year while you thought you were living a middle-class lifestyle. This shocking revelation is just one example of the hidden assets a divorce forensic accountant was able to find.</p><p>In this episode, Rosalia Labate, a CPA specializing in divorce analysis, forensics, and business valuations, shares how a divorce financial professional can help divorcing individuals navigate complex financial waters ‚Äì especially in high net worth divorces. Rosalia‚Äôs expertise ranges from uncovering hidden assets to demystifying business valuations.</p><p>Rosalia explains the critical difference between financial analysis, business valuation, and forensic accounting‚Äîand when you need which. She talks about the real value of gathering documentation early, how numbers tell a story, and how her deep-dive analysis helps people uncover what they own, what they spend, and what they actually need to move forward.¬†</p><p>Whether you‚Äôre trying to avoid litigation, navigate mediation, or just get a handle on your own finances, Rosalia‚Äôs practical yet strategic insights could save you from making a ton of expensive financial mistakes in your divorce.</p><p><b>About Rosalia</b></p><p>Rosalia Labate is a CPA specializing in Divorce analysis, forensics, and business valuations. She is trained in mediation and collaborative divorce. ¬† As a Certified Divorce Financial Analyst, and a forensic and business valuation expert, Rosalia M. Labate can be your trusted guide through any financial difficulty. Her practice is focused mainly on divorce matters.</p><p><b>Connect with Rosalia</b></p><p>You can connect with Rosalia on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/rosalialabatecpa/'>Rosalia Labate CPA</a> and visit her website at <a href='https://labatecpa.com/'>Rosalia Labate</a>.¬† You can email Rosalia at rosalia@labatecpa.com.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></description>
    <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Imagine discovering your spouse has been earning $4 million a year while you thought you were living a middle-class lifestyle. This shocking revelation is just one example of the hidden assets a divorce forensic accountant was able to find.</p><p>In this episode, Rosalia Labate, a CPA specializing in divorce analysis, forensics, and business valuations, shares how a divorce financial professional can help divorcing individuals navigate complex financial waters ‚Äì especially in high net worth divorces. Rosalia‚Äôs expertise ranges from uncovering hidden assets to demystifying business valuations.</p><p>Rosalia explains the critical difference between financial analysis, business valuation, and forensic accounting‚Äîand when you need which. She talks about the real value of gathering documentation early, how numbers tell a story, and how her deep-dive analysis helps people uncover what they own, what they spend, and what they actually need to move forward.¬†</p><p>Whether you‚Äôre trying to avoid litigation, navigate mediation, or just get a handle on your own finances, Rosalia‚Äôs practical yet strategic insights could save you from making a ton of expensive financial mistakes in your divorce.</p><p><b>About Rosalia</b></p><p>Rosalia Labate is a CPA specializing in Divorce analysis, forensics, and business valuations. She is trained in mediation and collaborative divorce. ¬† As a Certified Divorce Financial Analyst, and a forensic and business valuation expert, Rosalia M. Labate can be your trusted guide through any financial difficulty. Her practice is focused mainly on divorce matters.</p><p><b>Connect with Rosalia</b></p><p>You can connect with Rosalia on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/rosalialabatecpa/'>Rosalia Labate CPA</a> and visit her website at <a href='https://labatecpa.com/'>Rosalia Labate</a>.¬† You can email Rosalia at rosalia@labatecpa.com.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></content:encoded>

    <description><![CDATA[<p>When the life you&apos;ve built for decades starts to fall apart, where do you even begin to pick up the pieces? In this podcast episode, Monica, a successful professional who was married for over 30 years, opens up about the quiet unraveling of her relationship. She shares how she spent years walking on emotional eggshells before finally making the hardest decision of her life: to file for a divorce she didn&apos;t want because her marriage was falling apart.</p><p>Monica‚Äôs story begins in the ‚Äúin-between.‚Äù She was stuck, scared, and trying to save a marriage that could no longer be saved.</p><p>Monica shares what it was like to leave the only life she had ever known, how she prepared for the possibility of divorce long before she filed, and the powerful mindset shift that helped her see the process as a business decision, not an emotional breakdown.¬†</p><p>From letting go of the family home to navigating litigation with grace and clarity, Monica&apos;s story offers a grounded, honest look at how to take charge of your future‚Äîeven when your heart is still catching up to your head.¬†</p><p>Monica‚Äôs story is a testament to resilience, self-worth, and what it really looks like to heal. If you&apos;ve ever felt stuck between what was and what could be, Monica‚Äôs journey might just give you the perspective shift you need to create the life you truly want.</p><p><b>About Monica</b></p><p>Monica is a highly accomplished Program Manager bringing expertise in program design and oversight, with focus on social responsibility initiatives.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Trying to keep the house in a divorce? You might be missing the one expert who can actually make that happen.¬†</p><p>In this episode, Jeffrey Landers‚Äîreal estate veteran, mortgage broker, and Certified Divorce Financial Analyst‚Äîbreaks down the critical role a divorce lending professional can play in a divorce.¬†</p><p>With over a decade of experience, Jeff helps divorcing people navigate the financial chaos of divorce so they can afford to keep their house. In this episode, he walks us through the pitfalls that trip people up‚Äîlike relying on voluntary child support, misunderstanding joint debt, or assuming a judge-approved settlement means you‚Äôll qualify for a mortgage.¬†</p><p>Jeff explains how lender rules work in the real world, and why things like debt-to-income ratios, timelines, and the fine print of your divorce settlement agreement can make or break your refinance. He also dives into smart, proactive strategies‚Äîlike structuring settlements to improve loan eligibility, starting temporary support early, and even getting a home inspection before finalizing anything.</p><p>The conversation is packed with practical tips, cautionary tales, and eye-opening insights that most divorce lawyers don‚Äôt know to tell you.¬†</p><p>Whether you‚Äôre sure you want to keep the house in your divorce or you‚Äôre still trying to decide if that‚Äôs possible, bringing a divorce lending professional onto your divorce team is key.</p><p>If your future (and your kids‚Äô stability) depends on staying in your home, this is one conversation you can‚Äôt afford to miss.</p><p><b>About Jeffrey</b></p><p>Jeff Landers is a seasoned real estate/mortgage and divorce expert with over 40 years of combined experience. In 2010, Jeff founded Bedrock Divorce Advisors, LLC, working exclusively with women going through a financially complicated divorce.</p><p>Dealing with the marital home is almost always a major issue in any divorce. Jeff‚Äôs strong background and know-how have guided many hundreds of women all over the U.S. through the complexities of their divorce. To focus exclusively on the marital home, Jeff also founded Divorce House Sense, LLC, whose mission is to help divorcing people who want to keep their marital home.¬†</p><p>Jeff has previously written six published books with 18,000+ copies sold nationwide focusing on the financial aspects of divorce, as well as contributing articles regularly to many online publications.     <itunes:summary><![CDATA[What happens when the man who appears perfect to everyone else treats you like garbage behind closed doors?     <description><![CDATA[<p>What happens when the man who appears perfect to everyone else treats you like garbage behind closed doors? That‚Äôs what happens when you‚Äôre married to a covert narcissist.</p><p>In this painfully honest episode, Mia Hanks (not her real name) shares how ‚Äì as a young woman - she was initially drawn in by her husband‚Äôs charm, love bombing, and big promises. After they were married, though, all that changed.</p><p>Over time, Mia started to see subtle red flags‚Äîlike her husband‚Äôs lack of empathy, need for control, and deep insecurity.¬†</p><p>Mia describes how her life became centered around keeping her husband happy, even as her own health, identity, and independence crumbled. She opens up about the physical and psychological toll that the long-term abuse and isolation had on her and how she finally found the courage to leave her husband after her children grew up.</p><p>Mia also talks about her painful realization that her husband had meticulously structured their finances to ensure her complete financial dependence. He also made sure she was positioned to get the least amount of money possible in their divorce - in spite of their considerable wealth.</p><p>If you suspect you may be married to a covert narcissist this episode will empower you to break free of your current situation and start reclaiming yourself as a human. (And if you know someone else who is in this situation, please share this episode!)</p><p>As Mia so clearly says: no matter how long you‚Äôve been in it, you are never as trapped as you think.</p><p><b>About Mia¬†</b></p><p>Mia is a survivor of narcissistic abuse.¬† She was married to a covert narcissist for 29 years and in 2024 she published an award-winning memoir titled Bride-Made.¬† She is hoping that her story can help spread awareness about narcissism and help other victims find their voices.</p><p><b>Connect with Mia</b></p><p>You can follow Mia on X at <a href='https://x.com/npdandme'>NPD and Me</a> and on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/npd.andme/'>NPD and Me</a>.¬† You can also grab Mia‚Äôs award winning book <a href='https://www.amazon.com/Bride-Made-Memoir-Mia-J-Hanks/dp/B0CVC322MF/ref=tmm_pap_swatch_0?_encoding=UTF8&amp;dib_tag=se&amp;dib=eyJ2IjoiMSJ9.tLRw-EnD8qcLvZNhHdeGkLgJnioMrEuaThzSvKZNe2LhRVzJifZSkzoxkxCHg44BCGFfCip9jBXAyZBoelO754iQnr3qkIF2HGcmvBRt5p4.nDpffAadxQwtvVy-VAqMXhyXo34nu2cV0s08aRsu24A&amp;qid=1743542388&amp;sr=8-1'>Bride-Made: A Memoir.</a></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></description>
    <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>What happens when the man who appears perfect to everyone else treats you like garbage behind closed doors? That‚Äôs what happens when you‚Äôre married to a covert narcissist.</p><p>In this painfully honest episode, Mia Hanks (not her real name) shares how ‚Äì as a young woman - she was initially drawn in by her husband‚Äôs charm, love bombing, and big promises. After they were married, though, all that changed.</p><p>Over time, Mia started to see subtle red flags‚Äîlike her husband‚Äôs lack of empathy, need for control, and deep insecurity.¬†</p><p>Mia describes how her life became centered around keeping her husband happy, even as her own health, identity, and independence crumbled. She opens up about the physical and psychological toll that the long-term abuse and isolation had on her and how she finally found the courage to leave her husband after her children grew up.</p><p>Mia also talks about her painful realization that her husband had meticulously structured their finances to ensure her complete financial dependence. He also made sure she was positioned to get the least amount of money possible in their divorce - in spite of their considerable wealth.</p><p>If you suspect you may be married to a covert narcissist this episode will empower you to break free of your current situation and start reclaiming yourself as a human. (And if you know someone else who is in this situation, please share this episode!)</p><p>As Mia so clearly says: no matter how long you‚Äôve been in it, you are never as trapped as you think.</p><p><b>About Mia¬†</b></p><p>Mia is a survivor of narcissistic abuse.¬† She was married to a covert narcissist for 29 years and in 2024 she published an award-winning memoir titled Bride-Made.¬† She is hoping that her story can help spread awareness about narcissism and help other victims find their voices.</p><p><b>Connect with Mia</b></p><p>You can follow Mia on X at <a href='https://x.com/npdandme'>NPD and Me</a> and on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/npd.andme/'>NPD and Me</a>.¬† You can also grab Mia‚Äôs award winning book <a href='https://www.amazon.com/Bride-Made-Memoir-Mia-J-Hanks/dp/B0CVC322MF/ref=tmm_pap_swatch_0?_encoding=UTF8&amp;dib_tag=se&amp;dib=eyJ2IjoiMSJ9.tLRw-EnD8qcLvZNhHdeGkLgJnioMrEuaThzSvKZNe2LhRVzJifZSkzoxkxCHg44BCGFfCip9jBXAyZBoelO754iQnr3qkIF2HGcmvBRt5p4.nDpffAadxQwtvVy-VAqMXhyXo34nu2cV0s08aRsu24A&amp;qid=1743542388&amp;sr=8-1'>Bride-Made: A Memoir.</a></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></content:encoded>

It‚Äôs about who you become in the process.¬†</p><p>If you&apos;re feeling broken or stuck, this conversation will show you that you still have the power to create a life you love‚Äîeven if you have to start from scratch.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>What if the most painful moment in your marriage became the catalyst for its rebirth?¬†</p><p>In 2018 Jenny Townsend was the founder of an award-winning music academy and a successful businesswoman. She was also stressed out, burned out, and found out her husband was cheating. It was then that she realized she had a choice: Throw in the towel on her marriage and the life she‚Äôd worked so hard to build, or stay and try to heal and rebuild, not just her marriage, but herself.</p><p>In this raw and deeply honest conversation, Jenny unpacks the complex aftermath of her husband‚Äôs betrayal and the emotional toll it took on her. She also shares not only what broke her marriage, but also the intentional, step-by-step work she did to bring back to life.</p><p>Today, Jenny and her husband describe their relationship as their &quot;second marriage&quot; - stronger and more fulfilling than their first.¬†</p><p>Whether you&apos;re trying to heal after infidelity, or just wondering what it takes to save a marriage that‚Äôs on the brink of divorce, this conversation will leave you thinking about love, forgiveness, and the power of owning your story.</p><p><b>About Jenny</b></p><p>Jenny Alday Townsend is a keynote speaker, podcaster, Amazon Best Selling author, and thriving businesswoman focused on inspiring individuals to achieve balance in both their professional lives and marriage. Having experienced and triumphed over her own marital challenges, she penned the book Stroke It is a means of providing support to others facing similar struggles. Jenny is the proud proprietor of Music Compound, a renowned music academy that has garnered accolades such as Best Woman-Owned Business and Small Business of the Year. In recognition of her outstanding achievements, Jenny was honored with the Entrepreneur of the Year award in 2019.     <title>Jill Kaufman: How To Co-Parent Without The Drama</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Most parents want to protect their kids during divorce - but what do you do when your co-parent won‚Äôt meet you halfway?     <description><![CDATA[<p>Most parents want to protect their kids during divorce - but what do you do when your co-parent won‚Äôt meet you halfway? In this episode, therapist and divorce coach Jill Kaufman breaks down the real-life challenges of co-parenting, especially when emotions run high or you&apos;re dealing with a difficult ex.¬†</p><p>Drawing from her own high-conflict divorce, Jill offers a refreshingly honest look at what it takes to shift from emotional chaos to calm collaboration‚Äîor at least peaceful parallel parenting.</p><p>Jill explains why traditional co-parenting advice often falls short, especially when your ex isn‚Äôt playing fair. She walks through strategies like removing emotion from communication, using tools like the B.I.F.F. method, and knowing when not to respond at all. Her examples are specific, practical, and sometimes surprising‚Äîlike how one small act of kindness completely changed her own co-parenting dynamic.</p><p>If you&apos;ve ever wondered how to stay sane while raising kids with someone you‚Äôd rather never speak to again, this conversation is full of actionable insights. From parenting teens in two households to helping your kids build resilience when you can‚Äôt control your ex‚Äôs behavior, Jill shares grounded advice that puts the focus where it belongs‚Äîon the kids.</p><p><b>About¬† Jill</b></p><p>Jill Barnett Kaufman is a Licensed Therapist, Divorce Coach, Mediator &amp; Co-parenting Expert. After going through her own difficult divorce, she made it her life‚Äôs mission to help others not have it so tough. Her book and online course, I‚Äôm Getting Divorced, Now What? and her transformational coaching program help parents navigate the overwhelming process of divorce with less stress, more confidence and a greater sense of peace.</p><p><b>Connect with Jill</b></p><p>You can connect with Jill on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/jillkaufman/'>Jill Kaufman</a>, on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/jill.kaufman.353'>Jill Kaufman</a> and in her free Facebook Group <a href='https://www.facebook.com/groups/separationanddivorcesupportcommunity'>Separation and Divorce Support Community</a>.¬† You can follow Jill on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/divorcecoachjill/'>Divorce Coach Jill</a> and on YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@divorcecoachjill'>Divorce Coach Jill</a>.¬† To find out more about Jill‚Äôs work, visit her website at <a href='https://www.divorcecoachjill.com/'>Divorce Coach Jill</a> where you can also find out more about her coaching program, <a href='https://go.divorcecoachjill.com/thrivingprogram'>Thriving Through Divorce Coaching Program</a>.</p><p><b>Want to Know More About Parenting Coordination?</b></p><p>Check out this episode about<a href='https://karencovy.com/podcast-parenting-coordination/'> Parenting Coordination in high conflict divorce</a> with parenting coordinators Jennifer Lavin and Gail Petrich.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></description>
    <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Most parents want to protect their kids during divorce - but what do you do when your co-parent won‚Äôt meet you halfway? In this episode, therapist and divorce coach Jill Kaufman breaks down the real-life challenges of co-parenting, especially when emotions run high or you&apos;re dealing with a difficult ex.¬†</p><p>Drawing from her own high-conflict divorce, Jill offers a refreshingly honest look at what it takes to shift from emotional chaos to calm collaboration‚Äîor at least peaceful parallel parenting.</p><p>Jill explains why traditional co-parenting advice often falls short, especially when your ex isn‚Äôt playing fair. She walks through strategies like removing emotion from communication, using tools like the B.I.F.F. method, and knowing when not to respond at all. Her examples are specific, practical, and sometimes surprising‚Äîlike how one small act of kindness completely changed her own co-parenting dynamic.</p><p>If you&apos;ve ever wondered how to stay sane while raising kids with someone you‚Äôd rather never speak to again, this conversation is full of actionable insights. From parenting teens in two households to helping your kids build resilience when you can‚Äôt control your ex‚Äôs behavior, Jill shares grounded advice that puts the focus where it belongs‚Äîon the kids.</p><p><b>About¬† Jill</b></p><p>Jill Barnett Kaufman is a Licensed Therapist, Divorce Coach, Mediator &amp; Co-parenting Expert. After going through her own difficult divorce, she made it her life‚Äôs mission to help others not have it so tough. Her book and online course, I‚Äôm Getting Divorced, Now What? and her transformational coaching program help parents navigate the overwhelming process of divorce with less stress, more confidence and a greater sense of peace.</p><p><b>Connect with Jill</b></p><p>You can connect with Jill on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/jillkaufman/'>Jill Kaufman</a>, on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/jill.kaufman.353'>Jill Kaufman</a> and in her free Facebook Group <a href='https://www.facebook.com/groups/separationanddivorcesupportcommunity'>Separation and Divorce Support Community</a>.¬† You can follow Jill on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/divorcecoachjill/'>Divorce Coach Jill</a> and on YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@divorcecoachjill'>Divorce Coach Jill</a>.¬† To find out more about Jill‚Äôs work, visit her website at <a href='https://www.divorcecoachjill.com/'>Divorce Coach Jill</a> where you can also find out more about her coaching program, <a href='https://go.divorcecoachjill.com/thrivingprogram'>Thriving Through Divorce Coaching Program</a>.</p><p><b>Want to Know More About Parenting Coordination?</b></p><p>Check out this episode about<a href='https://karencovy.com/podcast-parenting-coordination/'> Parenting Coordination in high conflict divorce</a> with parenting coordinators Jennifer Lavin and Gail Petrich.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <itunes:summary><![CDATA["You don‚Äôt get a badge of courage for doing what everyone else thinks you should be doing."     <description><![CDATA[<p>&quot;You don‚Äôt get a badge of courage for doing what everyone else thinks you should be doing.&quot;</p><p>When the life you built starts to unravel, how do you find the strength to start again‚Äîespecially when you&apos;re still standing in the middle of it? In this powerful podcast episode, Natalie Fairchild shares the deeply personal story behind building her business, Pacific Perks Coffee, while simultaneously raising kids and navigating her husband‚Äôs progressive chronic illness.</p><p>Natalie courageously opens up about the emotional toll of being her husband‚Äôs caregiver, the quiet unraveling of their emotional intimacy, and the internal war that raged inside of her between loyalty and self-preservation.¬†</p><p>Natalie‚Äôs decision to ultimately end her marriage wasn‚Äôt simple‚Äîand certainly wasn‚Äôt celebrated‚Äîbut it was necessary - especially once she realized the level of codependency in her marriage. Her reflections on how she dealt with judgment, grief, and the loss of identity in the process are brutally honest and deeply relatable.</p><p>What makes Natalie‚Äôs story so compelling is what came after: the messy, nonlinear path to clarity, and the inspiring new life that not only she ‚Äì but her now ex-husband ‚Äì have built for themselves.¬†</p><p>If you or someone you know is struggling to make a hard decision to do what you know in your heart is right but what ‚Äúsociety‚Äù tells you is selfish, this is a podcast episode you‚Äôre not going to want to miss.</p><p><b>About Natalie</b></p><p>Natalie Fairchild is Founder and Chief Inspirational Officer of Pacific Perks Coffee. She grew up¬† in the Pacific Northwest. For the past 17 plus years she has been leading her company and recently Pacific Perks became a franchise. She contributes her success to surrounding herself with the right people, doing what she says she is going to do and being committed to a balanced life. She is most proud of the team and culture she has built at Pacific Perks, by creating jobs with flexibility and great pay for her employees.</p><p><b>Connect with Natalie</b></p><p>You can connect with Natalie on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/natalie-fairchild-1050b656/'>Natalie Fairchild</a> and on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/PacificPerks/'>Pacific Perks</a>.¬† You can follow Natalie on YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@pacificperkscoffee6915?app=desktop'>Pacific Perks Coffee</a> and on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/pacificperks/?hl=en'>Pacific Perks</a>.¬† To find out more about Pacific Perks Coffee visit the website Pacific Perks Coffee.¬†</p><p><b>Coming Soon</b>:¬† Stay tuned for a new podcast ‚Äì ToGet(HER)</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>What happens to our self-confidence when a marriage ends? For many, especially women, divorce not only shatters their relationship but also erodes their ability to advocate for themselves when they need it most.</p><p>In this podcast episode, Jeannette Seibly¬† a veteran leadership coach and business advisor, breaks down the misunderstood art of ‚Äúbragging‚Äù and explains why it‚Äôs crucial for rebuilding your confidence. With over three decades of experience, Jeannette reveals how learning to talk about your wins isn‚Äôt arrogant‚Äîit‚Äôs essential, especially when your self-worth has taken a hit.</p><p>Jeannette also explains how our reaction to the idea of ‚Äúbragging‚Äù comes from societal norms that condition us to minimize our success, and how that tendency to play small holds us back during critical moments like job interviews, negotiations, or dating after divorce. Jeannette&apos;s unique method of harnessing the power of ‚Äúbragging‚Äù helps people shift from feeling invisible to owning their power‚Äîwith data, not drama.</p><p><b>About¬† Jeannette¬†</b></p><p>Jeannette Seibly, an award-winning Talent Advisor, Leadership Results Coach, and Business Author, boasts over 32 years of hands-on experience. Her expertise helps leaders and bosses refine their hiring, coaching, and management practices and achieve their intended results. Along her journey, she has guided the creation of three millionaires and numerous six-figure earners, all while championing those ready to elevate their game to new heights.     <itunes:title>Emotional Intimacy: You Want Connection. He Wants Peace. Now What?</itunes:title>
    <title>Emotional Intimacy: You Want Connection. He Wants Peace. Now What?</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Most people want a strong partnership‚Äîbut what does it actually take to build one that‚Äôs equal, respectful, and emotionally connected? In this conversation, relationship coach Sharon Costanzo breaks down the hidden dynamics that keep couples stuck.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Most people want a strong partnership‚Äîbut what does it actually take to build one that‚Äôs equal, respectful, and emotionally connected? In this conversation, relationship coach Sharon Costanzo breaks down the hidden dynamics that keep couples stuck. Drawing from her work with high-achieving women, Sharon explains how unconscious habits and social conditioning can block true collaboration in marriage‚Äîand what it really takes to break those hidden patterns.</p><p>Throughout the conversation, Sharon shares candid insights about how to voice your needs without pushing your partner away, how to handle defensiveness and misunderstanding, and why assuming good intent can completely change the tone of a tough conversation.¬†</p><p>As the discussion goes deeper, Sharon gets into the messy reality of navigating conflict, resentment, and unmet expectations in long-term relationships. She talks about accountability, emotional fidelity, and how to figure out whether your marriage can still meet your core needs.¬†</p><p>Whether you&apos;re trying to repair a struggling relationship or just make a good one better, this conversation challenges the idea that love should be effortless‚Äîand makes a strong case that real intimacy requires courage, skill, and ongoing negotiation.</p><p><b>About Sharon</b></p><p>Sharon Costanzo is a relationship coach and the founder of Respected &amp; Connected, where she helps high-achieving women create balanced, meaningful partnerships without over functioning or burning out. With a focus on navigating gender dynamics and fostering equity in relationships, Sharon empowers her clients to advocate for their needs with confidence and compassion. Through her private coaching, &apos;The Better Marriage Blueprint,&apos; and other resources, she teaches practical strategies to build deeper intimacy and collaboration.</p><p><b>Connect with Sharon¬†</b></p><p>You can connect with Sharon on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/sharon-costanzo-ms-a4b49059/'>Sharon Costanzo</a> and on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/sharon.d.costanzo'>Sharon D Costanzo</a> and you can follow her on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/respected_and_connected'>Respected and Connected</a>.¬† To find out more about Sharon‚Äôs work visit her website at <a href='https://www.respectedandconnected.com/'>Respected and Connected.</a></p><p><b>Bonus Offer</b></p><p>Sharon is offering a free guide called the <a href='https://www.respectedandconnected.com/playbook'>Partnership Playbook: five simple steps to share the load, deepen your bond, and create a thriving partnership - without blame or guilt!</a>¬†</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></description>
    <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Most people want a strong partnership‚Äîbut what does it actually take to build one that‚Äôs equal, respectful, and emotionally connected? In this conversation, relationship coach Sharon Costanzo breaks down the hidden dynamics that keep couples stuck. Drawing from her work with high-achieving women, Sharon explains how unconscious habits and social conditioning can block true collaboration in marriage‚Äîand what it really takes to break those hidden patterns.</p><p>Throughout the conversation, Sharon shares candid insights about how to voice your needs without pushing your partner away, how to handle defensiveness and misunderstanding, and why assuming good intent can completely change the tone of a tough conversation.¬†</p><p>As the discussion goes deeper, Sharon gets into the messy reality of navigating conflict, resentment, and unmet expectations in long-term relationships. She talks about accountability, emotional fidelity, and how to figure out whether your marriage can still meet your core needs.¬†</p><p>Whether you&apos;re trying to repair a struggling relationship or just make a good one better, this conversation challenges the idea that love should be effortless‚Äîand makes a strong case that real intimacy requires courage, skill, and ongoing negotiation.</p><p><b>About Sharon</b></p><p>Sharon Costanzo is a relationship coach and the founder of Respected &amp; Connected, where she helps high-achieving women create balanced, meaningful partnerships without over functioning or burning out. With a focus on navigating gender dynamics and fostering equity in relationships, Sharon empowers her clients to advocate for their needs with confidence and compassion. Through her private coaching, &apos;The Better Marriage Blueprint,&apos; and other resources, she teaches practical strategies to build deeper intimacy and collaboration.</p><p><b>Connect with Sharon¬†</b></p><p>You can connect with Sharon on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/sharon-costanzo-ms-a4b49059/'>Sharon Costanzo</a> and on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/sharon.d.costanzo'>Sharon D Costanzo</a> and you can follow her on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/respected_and_connected'>Respected and Connected</a>.¬† To find out more about Sharon‚Äôs work visit her website at <a href='https://www.respectedandconnected.com/'>Respected and Connected.</a></p><p><b>Bonus Offer</b></p><p>Sharon is offering a free guide called the <a href='https://www.respectedandconnected.com/playbook'>Partnership Playbook: five simple steps to share the load, deepen your bond, and create a thriving partnership - without blame or guilt!</a>¬†</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>When you&apos;re trying to have a serious conversation but it keeps going sideways, it‚Äôs not always what‚Äôs being said that‚Äôs the problem. More often than not it‚Äôs about how you‚Äôre listening. In this podcast episode, communication expert and professional listener Deb Porter breaks down what it really means to feel heard and how most of us have never been taught to truly listen.¬†</p><p>With a background in pastoral counseling and a business built around deep, empathetic listening, Deb shares her journey through caregiving, divorce, and ministry ‚Äì as well was the lessons she learned along the way. Deb powerfully explains why she believes real listening ‚Äì listening that picks up on both the message and the emotion behind it -¬† is the missing ingredient in so many personal and professional relationships.</p><p>Deb also introduces her simple but powerful CORE Framework that helps people stay grounded and present in tough conversations. She explains how emotional regulation and clear intentions can change the way we connect with others, even in high-stakes moments like parenting conflicts or discussing divorce.</p><p>Whether you&apos;re talking with your spouse, your team, or your kids, Deb‚Äôs approach gives you the tools to create more meaningful conversations and stronger relationships.</p><p><b>About Deb</b></p><p>With a Master&apos;s specializing in Care &amp; Counseling and experience in critical caregiving and divorce, Deb founded HOLD to provide the kind of support she once needed. As a professional listener and communication expert, she helps individuals find clarity through confidential listening sessions and teaches effective communication skills through courses and business training. Deb‚Äôs work focuses on fostering connection, empathy, and understanding‚Äîhelping people feel truly heard in both personal and professional settings.</p><p><b>Connect with Deb</b></p><p>You can connect with Deb on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/deblhporter/'>Deb Porter</a> and on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/hearingoutlifedrama'>Hearing Out Life Drama</a>.¬† You can follow Deb on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/hearingoutlifedrama/'>Hearing Out Life Drama</a> and on her YouTube channel at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/c/HOLDListens'>Hold Listens</a>.¬† To find out more about Deb‚Äôs work please visit her website at <a href='http://www.hearingoutlifedrama.com/'>Hearing Out Life Drama</a>.     <itunes:title>Spouse Pushing Your Buttons? Transform Negative Emotions Now</itunes:title>
    <title>Spouse Pushing Your Buttons? Transform Negative Emotions Now</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Have you ever wondered why even small disagreements can explode into intense emotional battles? In this podcast episode, Dr. Greg Stewart, a counselor and executive coach, explores why negative emotions often become inflated, causing us to react disproportionately in our relationships.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Have you ever wondered why even small disagreements can explode into intense emotional battles? In this podcast episode, Dr. Greg Stewart, a counselor and executive coach, explores why negative emotions often become inflated, causing us to react disproportionately in our relationships.¬†</p><p>Drawing from personal experiences, including his own struggles and extensive academic background, Dr. Stewart reveals how understanding the deeper sources of our insecurities can transform our emotional responses and strengthen our connections.</p><p>Throughout the episode, we discuss the phenomenon of &quot;emotional inflation,&quot; in which small triggers evoke intense reactions because of unresolved insecurities. By learning to identify these triggers and understanding the deeper narrative they often signify, you can gain control over your emotional responses.</p><p>If you‚Äôre struggling in an emotionally volatile relationship, this episode will empower you to recognize emotional patterns, overcome destructive cycles, and create lasting, positive change.</p><p><b>About Dr. Greg Stewart</b></p><p>Dr. Greg Stewart lives in Rockwall, TX and is currently a full-time telehealth counselor, executive coach, and consultant. He has a BA in Organizational Leadership (Cornerstone University), a Master of Divinity (Grand Rapids Theological Seminary), a MA in Counseling (GRTS), and a PhD in Counselor Education and Supervision (Regent U). His dissertation was The Relationship of Emotional Intelligence to Job Satisfaction and Organizational Commitment. He is the author of I3: Unlock the Inner Strength Behind Your Negative Emotions, and I3 for Couples: Facing Our Negative Emotions to Build Intimacy in Marriage. He is currently working on his third book, The Leadership Quotient, which will be available Fall of 2025.</p><p><b>Connect with Dr. Greg Stewart</b></p><p>You can connect with Dr. Greg on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/authordrgregstewart'>Dr. Greg Stewart</a> and on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/drgregstewart/'>Dr. Greg Stewart</a>.     <description><![CDATA[<p>What if you could create an amazing marriage with the precision and effectiveness of an engineer? That&apos;s exactly what Gabriela Embon, a certified relationship coach and former engineer, helps couples do. Gabriela combines engineering strategy with deep emotional insights in a transformative relationship strategy, empowering couples to build legendary marriages through structured, actionable frameworks.</p><p>In her book, <em>Becoming a Power Couple: Four Pillars to Engineer Legendary Marriages </em>Gabriela helps couples reconnect, rekindle love, and establish meaningful rituals that sustain their bond. Gabriela highlights the importance of emotional attunement and proactive habits, making relationship-building a deliberate and strategic process.</p><p>Most importantly, Gabriela reassures couples that it&apos;s never too late to course-correct, even when a marriage is in crisis. Her unique blend of practical advice and emotional intelligence provides both hope and a clear path forward for anyone seeking genuine love and lasting connection.</p><p><b>About Gabriela</b></p><p>Certified coach and author Gabriela Embon believes that a fulfilling adult life hinges on two essential components: an ideal career and a thriving primary relationship. In the last 2 decades as a coach, Gabriela has dedicated herself to helping couples build fulfilling and enduring relationships. Gabriela utilizes the analytical and problem-solving skills from her engineering background, and applies them to the intricacies of human relationships. By combining the precision of engineering with the emotional depth of human behaviour, she empowers couples to transform their relationships, and become a Power Couple.</p><p><b>Connect with Gabriela</b></p><p>You can connect with Gabriela on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/gabrielaembon/'>Gabriela Embon</a> and Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/gabriela.embon'>Gabriela Embon</a>.¬† You can also follow her on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/gabrielaembon'>Gabriela Embon</a> and YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@coachingacademynet/featured'>Coaching Academy</a>.¬† To find out more about Gabriela‚Äôs work visit her website at <a href='https://gabrielaembon.com/'>Gabriela Embon</a>.</p><p><b>Bonus:</b></p><p>Download the prologue of her book ‚ÄúBecoming a Power Couple - 4 Pillars to Engineer Legendary Marriages&quot; <a href='https://gabrielaembon.com/prologue-becoming-a-power-couple/'>here</a>.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. In the last 2 decades as a coach, Gabriela has dedicated herself to helping couples build fulfilling and enduring relationships. Gabriela utilizes the analytical and problem-solving skills from her engineering background, and applies them to the intricacies of human relationships. By combining the precision of engineering with the emotional depth of human behaviour, she empowers couples to transform their relationships, and become a Power Couple.</p><p><b>Connect with Gabriela</b></p><p>You can connect with Gabriela on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/gabrielaembon/'>Gabriela Embon</a> and Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/gabriela.embon'>Gabriela Embon</a>.¬† You can also follow her on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/gabrielaembon'>Gabriela Embon</a> and YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@coachingacademynet/featured'>Coaching Academy</a>.¬† To find out more about Gabriela‚Äôs work visit her website at <a href='https://gabrielaembon.com/'>Gabriela Embon</a>.</p><p><b>Bonus:</b></p><p>Download the prologue of her book ‚ÄúBecoming a Power Couple - 4 Pillars to Engineer Legendary Marriages&quot; <a href='https://gabrielaembon.com/prologue-becoming-a-power-couple/'>here</a>.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></content:encoded>

    <description><![CDATA[<p>Life often throws curveballs that leave us feeling overwhelmed or trapped - especially during challenging times like divorce. But it doesn&apos;t have to stay that way. Dr. Carrie Johansson, a psychologist and author affectionately known as &quot;The Sensible Psychologist,&quot; introduces a powerful yet simple framework that will shift you out of the &quot;Drama Triangle&quot; so you can reclaim your life.¬†</p><p>Throughout this podcast episode, Dr. Johansson reveals practical tools that allow you to honestly assess your situation without judgment and finally break free from the cycle of avoidance that‚Äôs keeping you stuck. She also highlights the crucial mindset shift that will help you stop waiting for motivation and move forward into action.</p><p>Dr. Johansson also challenges conventional wisdom about relationships, suggesting that collaboration - NOT compromise - leads to healthier partnerships. By changing predictable conflict patterns and accepting that some disagreements may never be fully resolved, couples can move from resentment to understanding, creating relationships that feel less like work and more like joy.</p><p>Dr. Johansson‚Äôs straightforward yet compassionate approach helps you discover your &quot;next best move&quot; in any situation, guiding you toward the outcomes you truly desire.</p><p><b>About Dr. Johansson</b></p><p>Dr Carrie Johansson is a psychologist turned speaker and author. Fondly known as The Sensible Psychologist, she works with teams, corporate audiences and dedicated individuals, to build resilience and help them skillfully navigate life‚Äôs inevitable ups and downs. On a personal note, Dr. Carrie works her own program to create a life she really enjoys. One of her favorite pastimes is baking muffins, ask her for your favorite flavor and she‚Äôll make them for you!</p><p><b>Connect with Dr. Johansson</b></p><p>Connect with Dr. Johansson on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/drcarriejohansson'>Dr. Carrie Johansson</a> and LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/selfhelponthego/'>Self Help on the Go</a> and follow her on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=dr.+carrie+johansson'>YouTube</a>.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Ever feel like no matter how hard you try, life just keeps throwing more and more challenges at you? Psychologist Faust Ruggiero has spent over 35 years guiding clients through personal transformation by way of action. In his empowering ‚ÄúFix Yourself‚Äù book series, Faust shares the keys to addressing anxiety, depression, anger, addiction, and life&apos;s countless hurdles through practical, action-based steps that anyone can follow.</p><p>Faust believes information alone isn&apos;t enough‚Äîreal change happens when you put practical knowledge into action. That&apos;s why each book in his Fix Yourself Empowerment Series features short, accessible chapters paired with clear, measurable action steps.¬†</p><p>If you&apos;re tired of repeating unproductive behavior patterns or staying stuck in unhappy relationships, Faust&apos;s approach offers a new way to help yourself break free of what&apos;s no longer working for you. By helping you define your struggles, reclaim your energy, and master personal accountability, Faust equips you to confidently overcome life&apos;s toughest challenges.¬†</p><p><b>About Faust</b></p><p>Faust Ruggiero is a psychologist who has been in private practice for over thirty-five years. Before entering private practice, he worked in clinics for deaf children, prisons, nursing homes, substance abuse centers, inpatient facilities, and is a consultant for major national and international corporations. He is a published research author and a professional clinical trainer.¬†</p><p>In the summer of 2016, he began to develop The Fix Yourself Empowerment Series based on the Process Life Program to help readers address difficult situations in their lives. The series currently includes The Fix Yourself Handbook, The Fix Your Anxiety Handbook, The Fix Your Depression Handbook, The Fix Your Anger Handbook and the new The Fix Your Addiction Handbook that was just released!</p><p><b>Connect with Faust</b></p><p>You can connect with Faust on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/FaustInspire/'>Faust Inspire</a> and follow him on X at <a href='https://x.com/faustinspire'>Faust Inspire</a> and on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/faustinspire/'>Faust Inspire</a>.¬† To learn more about Faust‚Äôs work visit his website at <a href='http://www.faustruggiero.com/'>Faust Ruggiero</a> where you can also find his <a href='https://www.faustruggiero.com/buy_book2.html'>The Empowerment Series ‚Äì Handbooks</a>.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>When your marriage isn‚Äôt going well, it‚Äôs easy to believe divorce is your only option. But what if the answer isn‚Äôt leaving, but breathing new life into your marriage?</p><p>Cristie Cerniglia, a certified relationship coach, shares her hard-earned wisdom on how women can shift their approach to love and marriage‚Äîwithout devaluing themselves or waiting for their husbands to change. Having transformed her own 30-year marriage, Cristie helps women rediscover the romance and joy in their relationships, even when their spouse seems to be disengaged and their marriage feels like it&apos;s beyond repair.</p><p>In this podcast episode, Cristie reveals the small but powerful shifts that changed everything in her marriage. She explains why many women unknowingly push their partners away and how a simple mindset shift can bring them closer. She shares how embracing authentic femininity can be empowering and can create a magnetic pull that reinvigorates your marriage.</p><p>If you‚Äôve ever felt like you‚Äôre doing everything in your marriage and still not getting what you need from your partner, Cristie‚Äôs insights offers a hopeful, practical path forward.</p><p><b>About Cristie</b></p><p>Cristie Cerniglia is a ridiculously happy wife after 30 years of marriage. Mom of 4 and Kiki to 3, she is passionate about helping women rewind their relationships back to the fun and romance of dating (with or without their husband&apos;s efforts)!¬† Cristie is a certified Laura Doyle Relationship Coach - with a passion for inspiring and coaching women back in to magnetic marriages.</p><p>When following Cristie‚Äôs map to a magnetic marriage you can expect to learn six practical skills you can apply from day one that will change your perspectives, your responses and ultimately your marriage.</p><p><b>Connect with Cristie</b></p><p>You can connect with Cristie on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=61552187966981&amp;sk=about'>Relationships With A Map</a> and follow her on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/relationshipswithamap/'>Relationships With A Map</a> and on YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@relationshipswithamap'>Relationships With A Map</a>.¬† You can find out more about Cristie‚Äôs work by visiting her website at <a href='http://www.relationshipswithamap.com/'>Relationships With A Map</a>.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Divorce and menopause. Are they just two random events in a woman‚Äôs life? Or is there a connection between them?</p><p>In this podcast episode certified health coach and menopause specialist Denise Stegall explores how unaddressed menopausal changes can silently erode relationships. That‚Äôs especially true when couples stop communicating about intimate challenges like diminishing libido or emotional upheaval.¬†</p><p>Throughout the conversation, Denise tackles misconceptions about menopause, emphasizing that it&apos;s not a one-size-fits-all experience. She shares practical strategies, from tracking symptoms and optimizing hormones to managing mood swings, weight changes, and libido.¬†</p><p>All in all, while menopause may not directly cause divorce, when its symptoms go unrecognized and untreated, it can certainly contribute to it.</p><p>Whether you‚Äôre male or female, this candid conversation about a phenomenon that every woman will face will give you a depth of understanding that will help in your relationships with any woman. ¬†</p><p><b>About Denise</b></p><p>Denise Stegall is a healthy lifestyle coach, international best-selling author, and culinary expert with over 25 years of experience in nutrition, mindset, and coaching. Armed with a professional plant-based certification, she empowers high-achieving women to navigate menopause and embrace vibrant, joyful living. Denise‚Äôs personalized approach blends nourishing whole foods, mental fitness, and overcoming self-doubt to create sustainable well-being. Her mission is to help women move better, feel better, and live better, making every moment of life rich with energy, purpose, and vitality.</p><p><b>Connect with Denise</b></p><p>You can connect with Denise on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/healthylivingwithdenisestegall/'>Healthy Living with Denise Stegall</a> and on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/denise.stegall.18'>Denise Stegall</a> and follow her on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/healthylivingwdenise/'>Healthy Living With Denise</a> and YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@HealthyLivingWithDenise'>Healthy Living With Denise</a>.¬† To learn more about Denise‚Äôs work visit her website <a href='https://denisestegall.com/'>Denise Stegall</a> and take her quiz Unlock the Key To Balance.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <itunes:title>Narcissistic Alienation Of Adult Children: When Love Turns To Loss</itunes:title>
    <title>Narcissistic Alienation Of Adult Children: When Love Turns To Loss</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Imagine discovering that your once-loving adult child has suddenly become a stranger, cutting you off from their life and your grandchildren over seemingly trivial incidents like giving them a strawberry or a cup of water. Tracy Malone, an international divorce and narcissist abuse survival coach, reveals a disturbing trend of narcissistic alienation of adult children.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Imagine discovering that your once-loving adult child has suddenly become a stranger, cutting you off from their life and your grandchildren over seemingly trivial incidents like giving them a strawberry or a cup of water. Tracy Malone, an international divorce and narcissist abuse survival coach, reveals a disturbing trend of narcissistic alienation of adult children.¬† This alienation occurs when an adult child&apos;s narcissistic partner systematically isolates them from their parents, siblings, and other family members.</p><p>The narcissist‚Äôs tactics usually follow a calculated pattern, starting with love-bombing the family before marriage, then gradually introducing false allegations and twisted interpretations of normal interactions to drive wedges between parents and their adult child. This psychological manipulation can lead to complete estrangement or seriously limited contact.</p><p>What‚Äôs worse, the narcissist often ‚Äúsplits‚Äù the parents, choosing one who is identified as ‚Äúbad,‚Äù while the other is still allowed contact with their adult child. That strategy¬† can then create devastating conflict in the parents‚Äô marriage.</p><p>If you&apos;re navigating the intricacies of parental estrangement or seeking ways to protect your loved ones from narcissistic behavior, this episode offers essential insights and practical survival strategies.</p><p><b>About Tracy</b></p><p>Tracy Malone is an International divorce coach, narcissist abuse survival coach, author, speaker, educator, victim, and surTHRIVER of narcissistic abuse.¬† Tracy is also the author of Divorcing Your Narcissist: You Can&apos;t make This Shit up!¬† And the founder of Narcissist Abuse Support.com.</p><p><b>Connect with Tracy</b></p><p>You can connect with Tracy on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/tracyamalone/'>Tracy Malone</a> and Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/groups/188681268196044'>Narcissist Abuse Support Group</a>.¬† You can follow Tracy on YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/c/TracyAMalone'>Tracy Malone</a>, Twitter at <a href='https://twitter.com/TracyAMalone'>Tracy Malone</a> and on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/tracyamalone/'>Tracy A Malone</a>.¬† You can find out more about Tracy‚Äôs work and find support with narcissist abuse on Tracy‚Äôs website <a href='https://narcissistabusesupport.com/'>Narcissist Abuse Support</a> and buy her book <a href='https://www.amazon.com/Divorcing-Your-Narcissist-Cant-Make/dp/173650780X/ref=tmm_pap_swatch_0?_encoding=UTF8&amp;qid=1636575558&amp;sr=1-3'>Divorcing Your Narcissist:¬† You Can‚Äôtake This Shit Up!</a></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <itunes:title>First Responder Divorce: The Hidden Crisis That Costs Us All</itunes:title>
    <title>First Responder Divorce: The Hidden Crisis That Costs Us All</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Here's a secret that most employers and government agencies don‚Äôt know. An employee‚Äôs divorce costs the company or government agency that the employee works for far more than it costs the employee to go through it. That‚Äôs especially true in first responder divorce. Divorcing employees experience a loss of productivity, increased absences, increased distractions, and a higher turnover rate than non-divorcing employees. Since first responders experience divorce at a much higher rate than the ge...]]></itunes:summary>
    <description><![CDATA[<p>Here&apos;s a secret that most employers and government agencies don‚Äôt know. An employee‚Äôs divorce costs the company or government agency that the employee works for far more than it costs the employee to go through it. That‚Äôs especially true in first responder divorce.</p><p>Divorcing employees experience a loss of productivity, increased absences, increased distractions, and a higher turnover rate than non-divorcing employees. Since first responders experience divorce at a much higher rate than the general public, this is even more of a problem for them.</p><p>Vicky Townsend, a trailblazer in the divorce industry, set out to change all that.</p><p>Vicky has created a groundbreaking program that supports employees - particularly first responders - during the tumultuous divorce process. Employees in these programs get access to concierge-level divorce coaching, mediation services, marriage counseling resources, and specialized support for complex situations like religious divorces or high-conflict cases.</p><p>The support they receive not only relieves the employee‚Äôs anxiety, but it also reduces the financial cost of divorce ‚Äì both for the employee and the employer.</p><p>Vicky is currently focusing this program on first responders whose job-related stress contributes to higher divorce rates and the need for more nuanced divorced guidance.</p><p>If you or anyone you know is a first responder, or works for a forward-thinking company, this episode is one that you‚Äôll not only want to listen to, but you‚Äôll want your boss to listen to it as well.</p><p><b>About Vicky</b></p><p>Vicky Townsend is a trailblazing entrepreneur and advocate, dedicated to transforming the divorce process into a kinder, more affordable experience. As the founder of the National Association of Divorce Professionals, Divorce Right, and Fairwell, she has spent over two decades championing solutions that protect families from the financial and emotional toll of divorce. Her recent efforts focus on supporting first responders and military personnel during this challenging life transition. With unwavering commitment, Vicky continues to innovate and lead the charge for a more compassionate divorce industry.</p><p><b>Connect with Vicky</b></p><p>You can connect with Vicky on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/vickytownsend/'>Vicky Townsend</a> and on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/VickyTownsendVT'>Vicky Townsend</a> and follow Vicky on YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@divorcerightwithvickytowns2886/videos'>Divorce Right HR Solutions for Divorce in the Workplace</a>. To find out how to work with Vicky visit her websites:</p><p>For employers: <a href='https://divorcerightinc.com/'>Divorce Right</a>¬†</p><p>For individuals: <a href='http://www.fairwell.com/'>Fairwell</a></p><p>Email: <a href='mailto:Vicky@farewell.com'>Vicky@fairwell.com</a></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. An employee‚Äôs divorce costs the company or government agency that the employee works for far more than it costs the employee to go through it. That‚Äôs especially true in first responder divorce.</p><p>Divorcing employees experience a loss of productivity, increased absences, increased distractions, and a higher turnover rate than non-divorcing employees. Since first responders experience divorce at a much higher rate than the general public, this is even more of a problem for them.</p><p>Vicky Townsend, a trailblazer in the divorce industry, set out to change all that.</p><p>Vicky has created a groundbreaking program that supports employees - particularly first responders - during the tumultuous divorce process.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Conventional wisdom says that you shouldn‚Äôt leave your marriage until it has completely broken down. But what if that‚Äôs not true? What if leaving while you and your spouse still care about each other is the key to having a good divorce?</p><p>When her marriage was floundering, Karen McNenny found herself paralyzed by fear. She didn‚Äôt want to give up on her marriage if it could be saved. But she didn‚Äôt want to wait until she and her ex hated each other before she left.</p><p>That‚Äôs when she discovered a life-changing truth: leaving while there&apos;s still love can lead to a healthier post-divorce relationship than waiting until things completely fall apart.</p><p>Karen has now created the &quot;Good Divorce Experience.&quot; It&apos;s a process that isn‚Äôt about winning or losing, but about creating a healthier dynamic for everyone.¬†</p><p>Using her &quot;Good Divorce Process&quot; Karen guides couples to transform what&apos;s typically seen as a legal battle into a thoughtful family transition. She works with both partners simultaneously, helping them navigate everything from telling their children about their divorce to creating detailed parenting schedules, all while charging a flat monthly fee to ensure accessibility and open communication.</p><p>If you‚Äôre looking for a kinder and gentler way to divorce and you and your spouse don‚Äôt hate each other already, the ‚ÄúGood Divorce Process‚Äù may be just what you need to end your marriage with love.</p><p><b>About Karen¬†</b></p><p>Karen McNenny is working to change the way families navigate divorce. Divorcing families are starving for better outcomes with less debt, destruction and despair. Through her signature Good Divorce Experience‚Ñ¢, Karen utilizes her training as a mediator and divorce coach to guide couples through the legal process of GETTING divorced. More importantly, as a trained therapist and co-parenting specialist, she teaches them HOW TO BE DIVORCED once the ink is dry. The marriage may be over, but where children are involved, the relationship is forever. As a leading voice in the field of human behavior and relationships, Karen ultimately sees herself as a social activist, working towards world peace, one family at a time.</p><p><b>Connect with Karen</b></p><p>You can connect with Karen on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/gooddivorcecoach'>Karen McNenny The Good Divorce Coach</a> and on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/gooddivorcecoach/'>Karen McNenny ‚Äì The Good Divorce Coach</a>.¬† Follow Karen on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/gooddivorcecoach/'>Good Divorce Coach</a> and on YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@gooddivorcecoach'>Good Divorce Coach</a>.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Have you ever felt deeply misunderstood in relationships, yearning for emotional connection and lasting love but unsure how to create either one? That‚Äôs exactly what Valerie Greene, relationship mentor and author of <em>The Commitment Roadmap</em>, tackles in this podcast episode.</p><p>Growing up in an intellectual household where her parents often dismissed her feelings, Valerie learned to suppress her naturally empathic nature and to operate from her head rather than her heart. When her first marriage fell apart, Valerie started studying various emotional healing modalities in order to reconnect herself with her feelings. In doing so she learned to express her needs without seeming needy and to attract the emotionally available husband to whom she‚Äôs currently married.¬†</p><p>Valerie now helps other women to transform their relationships from emotional disconnection to deep intimacy.</p><p>In her &quot;MANifest Lasting Love&quot; program she teaches a five-step formula for expressing feelings and needs in ways that inspire rather than alienate potential partners. Through her unique approach to relationships, she guides clients to break free from the cycle of attracting emotionally unavailable partners and instead create the deep, lasting relationships they seek.</p><p>Whether you&apos;re single, dating, or trying to reignite passion in a long-term relationship, Valerie provides actionable insights into identifying emotional patterns, communicating effectively, and creating the lasting love you long for.<br/><br/><b>About Valerie<br/></b>Valerie Greene is a unique relationship mentor, author, and speaker who helps women to inspire their man to fulfill their deepest needs and desires. A highly successful alternative to relationship therapy, Valerie helps women and couples create a secure emotional CONNECTION--not just problem-solving or communication skills.¬†</p><p>Valerie holds numerous certifications in coaching, NLP, and emotional healing modalities.     <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Have you ever felt deeply misunderstood in relationships, yearning for emotional connection and lasting love but unsure how to create either one? Through her unique approach to relationships, she guides clients to break free from the cycle of attracting emotionally unavailable partners and instead create the deep, lasting relationships they seek.</p><p>Whether you&apos;re single, dating, or trying to reignite passion in a long-term relationship, Valerie provides actionable insights into identifying emotional patterns, communicating effectively, and creating the lasting love you long for.<br/><br/><b>About Valerie<br/></b>Valerie Greene is a unique relationship mentor, author, and speaker who helps women to inspire their man to fulfill their deepest needs and desires. A highly successful alternative to relationship therapy, Valerie helps women and couples create a secure emotional CONNECTION--not just problem-solving or communication skills.¬†</p><p>Valerie holds numerous certifications in coaching, NLP, and emotional healing modalities. She leads workshops, retreats, and online courses for women and couples, and is the creator of the 12-week Man-ifest Lasting Love coaching program and the author of the book ‚ÄúThe Commitment Roadmap‚Äù which teaches women how to inspire their man to commit to a lifetime of lasting love.¬†</p><p><b>Connect with Valerie<br/></b>You can connect with Valerie on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/valerie-greene/'>Valerie Green</a> and on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/coachvaleriegreene'>Coach Valerie Greene</a>.¬† And follow Valerie on YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCV5fnakewbzMZ2yGU-eChqQ'>Valerie Greene</a>, on X at <a href='https://x.com/CoachValGreene'>Coach Val Greene</a> and on Instagram at <a href='https://x.com/CoachValGreene'>Val Greene</a>.¬† To find out more about Valerie‚Äôs work visit her website at <a href='https://coachvaleriegreene.com/'>Coach Valerie Greene</a>.<br/><br/><b>¬†Free E-Guide <br/></b><a href='https://coachvaleriegreene.com/eguide/'>Man-ifest Lasting Love: ‚ÄúHow to Easily Inspire Him to Fulfill Your Deepest Desires!‚Äù</a>¬†</p><p>This guide by relationship coach Valerie Greene unveils the SIMPLE proven system to being irresistible to men, so you can inspire his devotional love, and you feel honored, cherished, and adored.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>What if you could turn the chaos of post-divorce dating in mid-life into a journey of self-discovery and empowerment? Jonathon Aslay, one of America‚Äôs top mid-life dating coaches, did exactly that.</p><p>After losing his 19-year-old son Connor, Jonathon embarked on an unexpected journey that transformed his understanding of love, relationships, and human connection. While grieving this profound loss, Jonathon discovered that the biggest challenge facing most singles isn&apos;t finding the right partner - it&apos;s learning to truly love themselves.</p><p>Jonathon is now on a mission to help singles cultivate more meaningful relationships by building their own self-love and emotional health. His insights are drawn from years of guiding others and his own experiences navigating the dating world post-divorce.</p><p>Jonathon candidly reflects on the trials of online dating and the deeper emotional wounds many people bring into relationships. He explains why dating profiles often fall short and reveals the subtle ways self-awareness can create more authentic connections.¬†</p><p>This conversation isn‚Äôt just about dating; it‚Äôs a profound exploration of forgiveness, self-compassion, and growth, coupled with practical, actionable steps for healing and growth.<br/><br/><b>About Jonathon<br/></b>Jonathon Aslay is a dating and relationship coach who focuses on helping his clients discover a deeper, self-sustaining happiness. He realized that the process of dating reveals the most common emotional health issue faced by many singles seeking a partner: a distressing lack of self-worth, self-regard, and self-love.</p><p>Today, he is on a mission of encouraging both men and women to fully love themselves with a new book, &quot;What The Heck Is Self-Love Anyway?&quot;‚Äîpacked with fun, engaging spiritual and personal growth practices‚Äîand his dynamic Mid-Life Love Mastery mentorship program, that inspires hundreds of people daily, around the world.¬†</p><p><b>Connect with Jonathon<br/></b>You can connect with Jonathon on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/jaslay/'>Jonathon Aslay</a> and on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/jonathon.aslay'>Jonathon Aslay.</a>¬† You can follow him on YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@JonathonAslay'>Jonathon Aslay</a>, on X at <a href='https://x.com/jonathonaslay'>Jonathon Aslay</a> and on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/jonathonaslay/'>Jonathon Aslay</a>.¬† To find out more about Jonathon‚Äôs work visit his website at <a href='http://www.jonathonaslay.com/'>Jonathon Aslay</a>.¬†</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <title>Beyond the Bedroom: How to Create Relationship Intimacy</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Relationship intimacy is complicated.
