    <description><![CDATA[<p>Relationship intimacy is complicated.</p><p>In this podcast episode, Dr. Jenn Kennedy, a clinical sexologist and licensed marriage and family therapist, unpacks the complexities of relationship intimacy, diving deeply into the challenges couples face when navigating sex and desire.¬†</p><p>Dr. Kennedy breaks down the common struggle of desire discrepancy‚Äîwhen partners have mismatched levels of sexual interest‚Äîand explains the emotional, biological, and relational factors that often drive these differences. She candidly reveals why most therapists aren‚Äôt adequately trained to handle issues around sexuality and how this impacts the relationships of the couples those therapists work with.</p><p>With humor and wisdom, Dr. Kennedy offers actionable strategies that will help couples reconnect, emphasizing the power of newness and intentionality to revitalize intimacy.¬†</p><p>Whether it‚Äôs learning to plan creatively or rethinking what sex means, Dr. Kennedy‚Äôs advice is refreshingly accessible and empowering.</p><p>This episode isn‚Äôt just about relationships‚Äîit‚Äôs about redefining intimacy and discovering how to create a more connected, fulfilling partnership.<br/><br/><b>About Dr. Kennedy<br/></b>Dr. Jenn Kennedy is a clinical sexologist and licensed marriage and family therapist based in Santa Barbara. In her private practice, Dr. Jenn sees couples and individuals in the areas of relationships, sex, addiction and LGBT. In 2019, she founded her clinical group practice, Riviera Therapy, and under this umbrella, she supervises up-and-coming clinicians. In 2023, Dr. Jenn launched The Pleasure Project, which is dedicated to helping us all have a better sex life. Through this venture, Dr. Jenn hosts a podcast called The Pleasure Project with Dr. Jenn Kennedy and she offers small group intensives for women and couples called The Pleasure Circle. Dr. Jenn has been quoted in Redbook, Reader‚Äôs Digest, Forbes Health, DailyOm, Shondaland, Parade, Allure, Yahoo!life and others. She is often tapped to discuss intimacy and sexuality for therapists and physicians.</p><p><b>Connect with Dr. Kennedy<br/></b>You can connect with Dr. Kennedy on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/jennkennedy/'>Dr. Jenn Kennedy</a> and Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/RivieraTherapy'>Riviera Therapy</a>.¬† You can follow Dr. Kennedy on YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@drjennkennedy'>Dr. Jenn Kennedy</a>, on Instagram at Dr Jenn Kennedy and on her Podcast <a href='https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/jenn-kennedy'>Pleasure Project:¬† Sex and Relationships</a>.¬† To find out how to work with Dr. Kennedy visit her website at <a href='https://pleasureproject.us/'>Pleasure Project</a>.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <itunes:title>How to Break Free from Toxic Relationships with Leah Guy</itunes:title>
    <title>How to Break Free from Toxic Relationships with Leah Guy</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Everyone knows the emotional pain of feeling stuck. But what if the key to getting unstuck lies in understanding your own energy patterns?     <description><![CDATA[<p>Everyone knows the emotional pain of feeling stuck. But what if the key to getting unstuck lies in understanding your own energy patterns? In this podcast episode, spiritual teacher and healing artist Leah Guy shares her journey from trauma survivor to transformational guide, revealing how she helps people break free from toxic relationships and rediscover their authentic selves.</p><p>Drawing from over two decades of experience working with clients, Leah challenges common misconceptions about narcissistic relationships and codependency. Rather than focusing solely on the narcissist‚Äôs behavior, Leah dives deeply into BOTH parties‚Äô behavior, since breaking those patterns is the key to making lasting change.</p><p>Leah emphasizes how important it is for the non-narcissistic partner to examine his/her own behavior patterns, energy imbalances, and childhood wounds that may be causing them to attract and maintain difficult relationships.</p><p>Leah&apos;s practical approach combines energy healing with concrete techniques for building healthy boundaries, developing self-confidence, and recognizing relationship &quot;green flags&quot; - like emotional availability and acting from desire rather than need. Through her work, clients have transformed challenging relationships, found fulfilling careers, and even overcome fertility struggles by addressing their energetic blocks.</p><p>If you‚Äôre struggling in a high-conflict relationship, this podcast episode may hold the key that will totally transform your relationships and your life.<br/><br/><b>About Leah<br/></b>Leah Guy is a spiritual teacher, speaker and intuitive healing artist. She&apos;s the author of three books including Overcoming Toxic Emotions, currently published in four languages, as well as the one-woman show, The Light Night of the Soul. Leah uses her personal triumphs over sexual abuse, addiction, anxiety and eating disorders, along with more than two decades of experience in private practice working with clients and organizations, helping people transform their lives. Leah inspires and teaches people how to access their fullest potential with practical techniques, guided wisdom, and entertaining concepts. Her courses and podcast have reached hundreds of thousands of people worldwide. ¬†</p><p><b>Connect with Leah</b><br/>You can connect with Leah on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/leahthemodernsage'>Leah The Modern Sage</a> and follow her on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/leahthemodernsage/'>leahthemodernsage</a>.¬† You can catch her podcast <a href='https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/the-modern-sage-podcast/id1559606903'>The Modern Sage</a> and watch her YouTube channel at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/user/agirlnamedguy'>A Girl Named Guy</a>.¬† To find out more about how to work with Leah visit her website at <a href='https://leahguy.com/'>Leah Guy</a>.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></description>
    <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Everyone knows the emotional pain of feeling stuck. But what if the key to getting unstuck lies in understanding your own energy patterns? In this podcast episode, spiritual teacher and healing artist Leah Guy shares her journey from trauma survivor to transformational guide, revealing how she helps people break free from toxic relationships and rediscover their authentic selves.</p><p>Drawing from over two decades of experience working with clients, Leah challenges common misconceptions about narcissistic relationships and codependency. Rather than focusing solely on the narcissist‚Äôs behavior, Leah dives deeply into BOTH parties‚Äô behavior, since breaking those patterns is the key to making lasting change.</p><p>Leah emphasizes how important it is for the non-narcissistic partner to examine his/her own behavior patterns, energy imbalances, and childhood wounds that may be causing them to attract and maintain difficult relationships.</p><p>Leah&apos;s practical approach combines energy healing with concrete techniques for building healthy boundaries, developing self-confidence, and recognizing relationship &quot;green flags&quot; - like emotional availability and acting from desire rather than need. Through her work, clients have transformed challenging relationships, found fulfilling careers, and even overcome fertility struggles by addressing their energetic blocks.</p><p>If you‚Äôre struggling in a high-conflict relationship, this podcast episode may hold the key that will totally transform your relationships and your life.<br/><br/><b>About Leah<br/></b>Leah Guy is a spiritual teacher, speaker and intuitive healing artist. She&apos;s the author of three books including Overcoming Toxic Emotions, currently published in four languages, as well as the one-woman show, The Light Night of the Soul. Leah uses her personal triumphs over sexual abuse, addiction, anxiety and eating disorders, along with more than two decades of experience in private practice working with clients and organizations, helping people transform their lives. Leah inspires and teaches people how to access their fullest potential with practical techniques, guided wisdom, and entertaining concepts. Her courses and podcast have reached hundreds of thousands of people worldwide. ¬†</p><p><b>Connect with Leah</b><br/>You can connect with Leah on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/leahthemodernsage'>Leah The Modern Sage</a> and follow her on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/leahthemodernsage/'>leahthemodernsage</a>.¬† You can catch her podcast <a href='https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/the-modern-sage-podcast/id1559606903'>The Modern Sage</a> and watch her YouTube channel at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/user/agirlnamedguy'>A Girl Named Guy</a>.¬† To find out more about how to work with Leah visit her website at <a href='https://leahguy.com/'>Leah Guy</a>.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></content:encoded>

    <itunes:title>How to Create Peace Through Co-Parenting Counseling</itunes:title>
    <title>How to Create Peace Through Co-Parenting Counseling</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[When your marriage crumbles, figuring out how to effectively parent with your ex can feel like navigating a minefield. Co-parenting counseling, an approach that helps divorced couples prioritize their children's needs over their own complicated emotions, can help.  In this podcast episode licensed professional counselor Kelley Hopkins-Alvarez explains how. Co-parenting counselors are licensed mental health professionals who provide expert recommendations and guidance to help parents comm...]]></itunes:summary>
    <description><![CDATA[<p>When your marriage crumbles, figuring out how to effectively parent with your ex can feel like navigating a minefield. Co-parenting counseling, an approach that helps divorced couples prioritize their children&apos;s needs over their own complicated emotions, can help.¬†</p><p>In this podcast episode licensed professional counselor Kelley Hopkins-Alvarez explains how.</p><p>Co-parenting counselors are licensed mental health professionals who provide expert recommendations and guidance to help parents communicate better and make child-focused decisions. ¬†</p><p>Unlike court-appointed parenting coordinators, co-parenting counselors don‚Äôt have the authority to adjudicate disputes or enforce parenting agreements. They do, however, have the skills and ability to help parents create a functional new family dynamic where both parents can learn to work together for their children&apos;s wellbeing.</p><p>If you‚Äôre searching for practical strategies for navigating common co-parenting dilemmas, such as setting boundaries, managing emotions, and creating actionable goals that prioritize children‚Äôs well-being, this episode may provide the answers you seek. Co-parenting counseling can help you transform your contentious parental dynamics into a productive partnership, helping you and your spouse align on critical parenting decisions.</p><p>If you or someone you know is experiencing parenting challenges, this podcast episode just might change everything for you.<br/><br/><b>About Kelley<br/></b>Kelley Hopkins-Alvarez, LPC, is a Licensed Professional Counselor in private practice in Ridgefield, Connecticut, specializing in assisting couples at relationship crossroads, particularly when one party is uncertain about the marriage&apos;s future. She offers Couples Therapy, Affair Recovery, Sex Therapy, Discernment Counseling, Healing Separation Support, and Co-Parenting Counseling. Kelley also provides non-adversarial divorce support to divorcing partners, helping them navigate communication impasses to make important decisions during and after the divorce process. Focused on child wellbeing, she aids co-parents in developing a new relationship centered on their kids‚Äô needs. Kelley is among a select group of mental health providers trained in mediation and collaborative divorce, offering cooperative and efficient options.</p><p><b>Connect with Kelley</b><br/>You can connect with Kelley on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/kelleyhopkinsalvarez/'>Kelley Hopkins-Alvarez</a> and on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KHAcounseling'>Kelley Hopkins-Alvarez: Manifesting Positive Outcomes</a> and follow Kelley on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/kelleyhopkinsalvarezlpc?igsh=c210ZGp2M2E3emRj&amp;utm_source=qr'>KelleyHopkinsAlvarezLPC</a>. To learn more about Kelley‚Äôs work visit her website at <a href='https://www.kelleyhopkinsalvarez.com/'>Kelley Hopkins-Alvarez</a> and her YouTube channel at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@kelleyhopkinsalvarezlpc'>Kelley Hopkins-Alvarez, LPC</a>.</p><p><b>Additional Resources:<br/></b><a href='https://gooddivorcect.com/'>The Connecticut Council for Non-Adversarial Divorce</a><br/><a href='https://www.ourfamilywizard.com/'>Our Family Wizard</a></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>When your marriage crumbles, figuring out how to effectively parent with your ex can feel like navigating a minefield. Co-parenting counseling, an approach that helps divorced couples prioritize their children&apos;s needs over their own complicated emotions, can help.¬†</p><p>In this podcast episode licensed professional counselor Kelley Hopkins-Alvarez explains how.</p><p>Co-parenting counselors are licensed mental health professionals who provide expert recommendations and guidance to help parents communicate better and make child-focused decisions. ¬†</p><p>Unlike court-appointed parenting coordinators, co-parenting counselors don‚Äôt have the authority to adjudicate disputes or enforce parenting agreements.     <itunes:title>Mitchell Gordon: How to Navigate a Divorce and Addiction</itunes:title>
    <title>Mitchell Gordon: How to Navigate a Divorce and Addiction</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[When your spouse's addiction threatens to destroy not just your marriage but your whole family's future, you need expert guidance to protect yourself and your loved ones. Attorney Mitchell Gordon brings over 23 years of specialized experience helping clients navigate the complexities that occur when addiction intersects with divorce, offering strategic solutions that safeguard both families and finances.     <description><![CDATA[<p>When your spouse&apos;s addiction threatens to destroy not just your marriage but your whole family&apos;s future, you need expert guidance to protect yourself and your loved ones. Attorney Mitchell Gordon brings over 23 years of specialized experience helping clients navigate the complexities that occur when addiction intersects with divorce, offering strategic solutions that safeguard both families and finances.</p><p>Drawing from his extensive experience with cases involving alcohol, drugs, gambling, and other addictions, Mitch emphasizes that the key to navigating a divorce and addiction is to treat the addiction as a disease rather than a moral failing.¬†</p><p>Mitch‚Äôs approach focuses on implementing practical protections - from supervised visitation and breathalyzer requirements for parenting time, to innovative solutions for high-functioning professionals who need specialized treatment options that won&apos;t derail their careers.</p><p>Mitch also provides insight into sophisticated strategies for protecting assets and securing support payments in cases involving addiction. He demonstrates how modern technology and data collection devices including <a href='https://www.soberlink.com/'>Soberlink</a> can help prove addiction patterns. Finally he offers insights into structuring settlements that can protect both the immediate and long-term interests of the non-addicted spouse.</p><p>If you or someone you know is dealing with addiction and divorce, this is a ‚ÄúCan‚Äôt Miss‚Äù episode.<br/><br/><b>About Mitchell<br/></b>Mitchell works exclusively in the area of family law. He has significant experience dealing with both parenting-related and financial litigation. Mitchell approaches his cases with the goal of problem solving through the understanding that each client has a unique set of circumstances. Mitchell works closely with his clients throughout the legal process to find reasonable and practical solutions. In addition to his litigation experience, Mr. Gordon has expertise conducting settlement conferences, drafting marital settlement agreements, parenting agreements, and pre and post-nuptial agreements. Furthermore, he is a skilled appellate advocate, having litigated numerous family law cases at the Appellate Court level.¬†</p><p><b>Connect with Mitchell<br/></b>You can connect with Mitchell on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/mitchell-b-gordon-9904626/'>Mitchell B Gordon</a> and find more information regarding the services he provides on his website <a href='https://bradfordandgordon.com/'>Bradford &amp; Gordon, LLC</a>¬†</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <itunes:title>How Financial Advocacy Can Get You a Better Divorce Settlement</itunes:title>
    <title>How Financial Advocacy Can Get You a Better Divorce Settlement</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Navigating the financial maze of divorce can feel overwhelming - until you discover the transformative power of strategic financial advocacy.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Navigating the financial maze of divorce can feel overwhelming - until you discover the transformative power of strategic financial advocacy.</p><p>Certified Divorce Financial Analyst Rhonda Noordyk has created a strategic approach to finance that goes beyond traditional divorce financial planning and into the realm of financial advocacy. Rhonda goes beyond the numbers to actually advocate for her clients, asking tough questions during their mediation or negotiation that helps them uncover details they might otherwise overlook.</p><p>In this podcast episode, Rhonda explains what it means to be a &quot;financial advocate&quot; and why her role is critical in high-stakes divorce negotiations.¬†</p><p>From questioning the validity of income calculations to identifying gaps in transparency, Rhonda dives into the strategies she uses to level the playing field for her clients.¬†</p><p>Whether it‚Äôs challenging business valuations, reviewing support numbers, or guiding clients through mediation, Rhonda‚Äôs insights shine a light on how strategy‚Äînot guesswork‚Äîcan create better outcomes in your divorce.<br/><br/><b>About Rhonda</b></p><p>Rhonda Noordyk, CDFA¬Æ is a well-respected divorce financial strategist. She is known internationally for her work in pioneering a path for women to navigate through the financial aspects of the divorce process. As a strategist, Rhonda helps her clients determine their next best financial move.</p><p><b>Connect with Rhonda</b></p><p>You can connect with Rhonda on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/rhondanoordyk/'>Rhonda Noordyk</a>, on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/rhonda.noordyk'>Rhonda Noordyk</a> and follow her on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/rhondanoordyk/'>Rhonda Noordyk</a>.¬† To learn more about Rhonda‚Äôs work visit her website at <a href='http://wfwcdivorce.com/'>Rhonda Noordyk Financial Divorce Advocate</a> and grab a copy of Rhonda‚Äôs book <a href='https://www.amazon.com/Bold-Beginnings-Journey-Financial-Confidence/dp/B0DGMCB8M6/karenccom-20'>Bold Beginnings: A Journey of Divorce and Financial Confidence.</a></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>What if the most difficult conversations in life could not only give you answers but they could shine a light on a clear path forward?¬†</p><p>This special episode brings together the best insights from our guests in 2024. You‚Äôll hear about how to tackle complex relationship challenges like divorcing a narcissist, navigating sexless marriages, and implementing creative solutions like bird nesting for families in transition. This is a curated mix of powerful interviews that address not just the legal and logistical aspects of these struggles but also the emotional and psychological hurdles that keep people stuck.</p><p>Through expert advice and deeply personal stories, you‚Äôll hear practical strategies for managing high-conflict dynamics, understanding toxic relationship cycles, and finding healthier ways to communicate and co-parent. Whether it‚Äôs uncovering patterns of abuse, building boundaries, or learning how to use mediation to save time, money, and your sanity, these conversations are full of eye-opening moments that can change the way you approach tough decisions.</p><p>The episode is a roadmap for anyone looking to break free from old cycles and emerge stronger‚Äîlegally, emotionally, and relationally. With topics ranging from gaslighting to financial transparency in divorce, you‚Äôll come away with tools, insights, and even a bit of hope that even the hardest decisions can lead to unexpected transformation.<br/><br/>This is truly the BEST of Off the Fence 2024.<br/><br/><b>About Tracy Malone<br/></b>Tracy Malone is an International divorce coach and surTHRIVER of narcissistic abuse and the author of Divorcing Your Narcissist: You Can&apos;t make This Shit up! and the founder of Narcissist Abuse Support.com.¬† Connect with Tracy on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/tracyamalone/'>Tracy Malone</a> and Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/groups/188681268196044'>Narcissist Abuse Support Group</a>. <br/><b>About Kathleen Brigham<br/></b>Kathleen created Brigham Advising after going through her own divorce and finding it difficult to map a productive path between tough talking lawyers, well-meaning therapists and supportive but uneasy friends and family.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Navigating the holidays when you‚Äôre going through a divorce ‚Äì or have recently gone through a divorce ‚Äì can really suck. Money will likely be tighter, you may not see your kids as much, and the holiday traditions you once cherished are likely to be gone forever.</p><p>But just because your holidays will be undeniably different, that doesn‚Äôt mean they have to be miserable.</p><p>In this podcast episode, divorce expert Jackie Pilossoph‚Äîcreator of <em>Divorced Girl Smiling</em>‚Äîshares deeply relatable stories and actionable tips for surviving the holidays, even if you‚Äôre feeling sad, alone, or overwhelmed. Jackie opens up about her own experience of spending her first Christmas without her kids, offering insights on how to honor your emotions while finding ways to reclaim joy during these tough times.</p><p>If you‚Äôre alone today ‚Äì or on any major holiday ‚Äì Jackie‚Äôs creative and practical ideas can help you feel better right now, even if you didn‚Äôt plan ahead. You‚Äôll discover how taking even small steps can shift your mindset and improve your mood, even when you think that‚Äôs impossible.</p><p>Don‚Äôt struggle through the holiday season! Take a break. Listen to this episode. You‚Äôll feel better.<br/><br/>[<b>SPOILER ALERT: </b>This episode just might make you feel SO good that you even forget how miserable you just were!]<br/><br/><b>About Jackie</b><br/>Jackie Pilossoph is the creator and Editor-in-chief of Divorced Girl Smiling, a media company comprised of a website, podcast, mobile app, and professional resources. Jackie holds a Masters degree in Broadcast Journalism and is a former television news reporter and features reporter and writer for the Chicago Tribune.<br/><br/><b>Where to Connect with Jackie</b><br/>You can connect with Jackie on Facebook at Divorced Girl Smiling or in her Facebook Group, The Divorced Girl Smiling Group. She is on LinkedIn as Divorced Girl Smiling.     <itunes:title>When Your Childhood Whispers: How Childhood Wounds Run Your Life </itunes:title>
    <title>When Your Childhood Whispers: How Childhood Wounds Run Your Life </title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Ever wonder why you and your spouse seem to have the same fight over and over again? Or why the way your spouse treats you reminds you of how your mother/father/brother/sister treated you? Or why ‚Äì if you‚Äôre already divorced and are dating again ‚Äì you seem to pick the same kind of romantic partner over ‚Ä¶ and over ‚Ä¶ and over again?     <description><![CDATA[<p>Ever wonder why you and your spouse seem to have the same fight over and over again? Or why the way your spouse treats you reminds you of how your mother/father/brother/sister treated you? Or why ‚Äì if you‚Äôre already divorced and are dating again ‚Äì you seem to pick the same kind of romantic partner over ‚Ä¶ and over ‚Ä¶ and over again?</p><p>The answer to these questions and more often lies buried deeply in your past.</p><p>In this week‚Äôs podcast episode, Tammy Cox, a transformational coach, reveals how even seemingly minor emotional experiences can create deep-seated beliefs that unconsciously drive our adult behaviors and relationship patterns.¬†</p><p>Those internalized beliefs ‚Äì beliefs such as feeling unlovable or unimportant - create invisible emotional blueprints that repeat throughout our lives, influencing everything from our self-perception to our closest relationships.</p><p>Thankfully, by learning to recognize our emotional triggers and exploring their origins, we can uncover and neutralize our childhood wounds and create more fulfilling adult relationships.</p><p>If you‚Äôve ever suffered from self-doubt or feelings of unworthiness, this podcast episode will show you how to shift your belief system and start choosing beliefs that empower you. In that way you can start to break dysfunctional relationship patterns and step into true emotional freedom.</p><p><b>About Tammy<br/></b>Tammy Cox is a dedicated Transformational Coach with a passion for helping women transform their lives and relationships. With a unique focus on inner child healing, Tammy uncovers the root causes of relationship breakdowns, guiding her clients on a deeply transformative journey toward rekindling emotional connection and love. Tammy&apos;s personal life journey was marked by significant childhood wounds, bringing her to a crossroads where she faced two choices: surrender to despair or embark on a path of healing. She chose the latter, committing to an inspiring voyage of self-discovery and personal growth, which shaped her into the transformational coach she is today.</p><p><b>Connect with Tammy<br/></b>You can connect with Tammy on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/tammy-cox-884b7a30'>Tammy Cox</a> and on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/tammy.cox.543'>Tammy Cox</a>. You can follow Tammy on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/tammyncox7'>Tammy Cox</a> and X on <a href='https://x.com/tamncox'>Tamncox</a>.¬† To find out all about Tammy visit her Linktr at <a href='https://linktr.ee/tammycox'>Tammy Cox</a>.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></description>

He reveals secrets about the &quot;oxytocin track,&quot; the ‚ÄúCoolidge effect,‚Äù and the often-overlooked orgasm cycle.¬† Matt also shares how simple changes in intimacy habits can reignite passion and strengthen bonds in long-term relationships.</p><p>Matt doesn‚Äôt shy away from discussing taboo sexual topics in a quest to help couples transform their relationships, rediscover their passion, and build greater intimacy, regardless of their current struggles or physical constraints.</p><p>If you‚Äôre looking for holistic approaches to sexual health, and solutions to challenges like low libido, erectile dysfunction, and hormone imbalances, this a must-listen-to podcast episode.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Unresolved emotions and insecure attachment styles can silently shape our relationships and lives‚Äîbut what if you could break free? In this second part of a two part series, Bev Mitelman, a certified attachment practitioner and founder of <em>Securely Loved</em>, explains how deeply rooted attachment patterns influence everything from emotional regulation to the way we connect with others.¬†</p><p>The conversation goes beyond just theory, though. Using practical examples, Bev highlights how attachment styles govern the way we interact with our partner especially the cycle of approach-avoid that often traps couples in an endless cycle of ‚ÄúI want you/I need space.‚Äù</p><p>Using cutting-edge techniques to reprogram the subconscious mind, Bev demonstrates how clients can heal core wounds, build emotional resilience, and foster secure attachment with those they love.¬†</p><p>Whether you‚Äôre struggling in your marriage or seeking to deepen your other relationships, this conversation reminds us that true transformation is possible.<br/><br/><b>About Bev</b><br/>Prior to becoming a Certified Attachment Practitioner and founding Securely Loved, Bev was an Executive Leader, University Lecturer and published author, having obtained her Masters&apos; Degree in 2006. She has dedicated her entire career (25+ years) working with adults in the realm of personal growth and professional development.</p><p>Bev specializes in attachment theory, as it relates to dating and relationships, LGBT+ communities, sexuality, childhood trauma, complex family dynamics, narcissistic abuse, and respectful parenting. She believes that radical honesty is the way to authentically connect with people, in a world where more and more of us are feeling isolated and disconnected.</p><p><b>Connect with Bev<br/></b>You can connect with Bev on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/company/securely-loved/'>Securely Loved</a> and on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=61551898715971'>Securely Loved</a>.¬† You can follow Bev on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/securely_loved/'>Securely_loved</a> and on YouTube <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@SecurelyLoved'>@SecurelyLoved</a>.¬† To find out more about Bev‚Äôs work visit her website at <a href='http://www.securelyloved.com/'>Securely Loved</a> and book a 20 minute consult¬†<a href='http://www.securelyloved.com/bookings'>here</a>.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Ever wonder why you chose the spouse that you did? Or why you and your spouse seem to be locked in the same dance ‚Äì pushing each other‚Äôs buttons and arguing over the same things you‚Äôve argued about 1000 times before?</p><p>In this podcast episode, Bev Mitelman, a certified attachment practitioner and founder of Securely Loved, discusses the profound impact our attachment style has on all of our future relationships.</p><p>Bev explains how our early relationships with our primary caregivers create lifelong patterns for how we give and receive love‚Äîand why understanding these patterns is key to building better connections. Relying on the work of Dr. Gabor Mat√©, Bev explores and explains our attachment styles, core wounds, and the pivotal choice each of us makes between maintaining an insecure attachment style that we may have picked up during our childhood and consciously growing into a secure attachment style that will help us create the healthy relationships we crave.</p><p>If you feel like it‚Äôs ‚ÄúGroundhog Day‚Äù in your intimate relationships, and you long to create a more secure and well-balanced bond, this podcast episode is for you.<br/><br/><b>About Bev</b><br/>Prior to becoming a Certified Attachment Practitioner and founding Securely Loved, Bev was an Executive Leader, University Lecturer and published author, having obtained her Masters&apos; Degree in 2006. She has dedicated her entire career (25+ years) working with adults in the realm of personal growth and professional development.</p><p>Bev specializes in attachment theory, as it relates to dating and relationships, LGBT+ communities, sexuality, childhood trauma, complex family dynamics, narcissistic abuse, and respectful parenting.     <itunes:title>Dana Cox&#39;s Bold Leap: Life After a 33-Year Marriage</itunes:title>
    <title>Dana Cox&#39;s Bold Leap: Life After a 33-Year Marriage</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[What drives someone to redefine their life after decades of marriage? How can you live through some of life‚Äôs biggest challenges ‚Äì like the loss of a child, the loss of a job and the loss of a marriage, and not only survive but thrive afterwards?     <description><![CDATA[<p>What drives someone to redefine their life after decades of marriage? How can you live through some of life‚Äôs biggest challenges ‚Äì like the loss of a child, the loss of a job and the loss of a marriage, and not only survive but thrive afterwards?</p><p>In this podcast episode Dana Cox shares her transformative journey of personal growth and resilience after deciding to end her 33-year marriage. She openly shares how she strategically navigated the divorce process, not just to protect herself financially but also to preserve an amicable relationship with her ex-husband, which was crucial for their six children and three grandchildren.¬†</p><p>With candid honesty, Dana recounts the physical, emotional, and mental transformation that followed her decision to prioritize her well-being, peace of mind, and happiness. Her transformation was founded in a powerful mindset shift that caused her to take full responsibility for her part in the ending of her marriage, and to focus on becoming the person she needed to be to create the life she wanted.</p><p>Shortly after her divorce, Dana lost her corporate job. But instead of letting that loss bring her down, she simply pivoted and created her own coaching business. Now she empowers other women to prioritize their personal values and follow their hearts too.</p><p>If you need an uplifting story of growth, resilience and hope in the face of adversity, this week‚Äôs podcast episode is for you.<br/><br/><b>About Dana<br/></b>Dana L. Cox is an international speaker, author, and the powerhouse behind FIX Coaching &amp; Consulting. With over two decades of leadership experience, she empowers ambitious women to achieve extraordinary success without sacrificing their personal lives. Her approach integrates career goals with life aspirations, creating harmony and resilience for her clients. Dana‚Äôs work also drives organizations to streamline operations and foster bold, transformative leadership.</p><p><b>Connect with Dana<br/></b>You can connect with Dana on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/danacoxmba/'>Dana L Cox</a>.¬† To find out more about Dana and the services she offers visit her website at <a href='www.danalcox.com'>www.danalcox.com</a>.</p><p><b>Coming Soon</b></p><ul><li>2-day Deep Dive Intensive &quot;Success Unchained: Ditch Burnout &amp; Mom Guilt&quot;¬†</li><li>Online course; Book: The F.I.X. - Focused &amp; Intentional eXecution: 7 Steps for Climbing the Corporate Ladder Without Neglecting Your Health or Sacrificing Your Family and new online course launch.</li></ul><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>What drives someone to redefine their life after decades of marriage? How can you live through some of life‚Äôs biggest challenges ‚Äì like the loss of a child, the loss of a job and the loss of a marriage, and not only survive but thrive afterwards?</p><p>In this podcast episode Dana Cox shares her transformative journey of personal growth and resilience after deciding to end her 33-year marriage. She openly shares how she strategically navigated the divorce process, not just to protect herself financially but also to preserve an amicable relationship with her ex-husband, which was crucial for their six children and three grandchildren.¬†</p><p>With candid honesty, Dana recounts the physical, emotional, and mental transformation that followed her decision to prioritize her well-being, peace of mind, and happiness. Her transformation was founded in a powerful mindset shift that caused her to take full responsibility for her part in the ending of her marriage, and to focus on becoming the person she needed to be to create the life she wanted.</p><p>Shortly after her divorce, Dana lost her corporate job. But instead of letting that loss bring her down, she simply pivoted and created her own coaching business. Now she empowers other women to prioritize their personal values and follow their hearts too.</p><p>If you need an uplifting story of growth, resilience and hope in the face of adversity, this week‚Äôs podcast episode is for you.<br/><br/><b>About Dana<br/></b>Dana L.     <title>Phyllis Leavitt: How to Handle Conflict Without Creating More Pain </title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[How amazing would your marriage, your family, and your community be if you had the tools to transform conflict into connection?     <description><![CDATA[<p>How amazing would your marriage, your family, and your community be if you had the tools to transform conflict into connection?¬†</p><p>In this podcast episode, psychotherapist and author Phyllis Leavitt dives deeply into the complex topic of conflict resolution and decision-making within personal relationships, families, and communities. She breaks down the dynamics of both healthy and unhealthy family relationships and talks about strategies you can use to improve your own ability to resolve conflicts in a healthier way.</p><p>Beyond healing our individual relationships, Phyllis also reflects on America‚Äôs current cultural divide, noting the way we take responsibility and resolve conflicts in our personal relationships can influence society as a whole.¬†</p><p>Phyllis shares valuable insights from her book &quot;America in Therapy,&quot; and urges listeners to approach conflict on all levels with empathy and a willingness to listen and understand which will both promote peace and foster healthier relationships.</p><p>In an era of escalating social division and family conflict, Phyllis emphasizes how the skills we use to heal our closest relationships can transform our larger societal wounds.<br/><br/><b>About Phyllis<br/></b>Phyllis has been a psychotherapist for 34 years and is the author of three books-- A Light in the Darkness, Into the Fire, and America in Therapy: A New Approach to Hope and Healing for a Nation in Crisis. Her focus is on healing our families on all levels-- family of origin all the way to the macrocosm of the Family of America, for the sake of bringing us back into healthy cooperation and connection and mitigating the forces of escalating divisiveness and violence so many are suffering from today.</p><p><b>Connect with Phyllis<br/></b>You can connect with Phyllis on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/phyllis-leavitt-630179255/'>Phyllis Leavitt</a>, on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/phyllis.leavitt'>Phyllis Leavitt</a>.¬† You can follow her on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/phyllis_e_leavitt/'>phyllis_e_leavitt</a>, on X at <a href='https://x.com/PhyllisLeavitt2'>@PhyllisLeavitt2</a> and on YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCOdxqvDK9N421AZ5TTxqUgQ'>Phyllis Leavitt Podcasts</a>.¬† To find out more about how to work with Phyllis visit her website at <a href='https://www.phyllisleavitt.com/'>Phyllis Leavitt</a> and email Phyllis at phyllis@phyllislevitt.com.</p><p>Newly released book:¬† <a href='https://www.amazon.com/America-Therapy-Approach-Healing-Nation/dp/1636983367'>America In Therapy </a>¬†</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>When divorce attorney and bestselling author Raiford Palmer sits down for a conversation, he doesn‚Äôt hold back.¬†</p><p>In this candid and thought-provoking episode, Raif draws from nearly three decades of legal experience to share not only his legal insights in divorce, but also his own journey through divorce. That journey reshaped his legal practice, helping him empathize with clients on a deeper level.</p><p>Throughout this conversation, Raif stresses the critical role knowledge and understanding the emotional and financial rollercoaster of divorce plays in navigating divorce effectively. He also shares insider insights on the way divorce really works and the tremendous benefits of alternative dispute resolution.</p><p>Raif discusses how to apply a cost-benefit analysis that will keep you from making some of the biggest <a href='https://karencovy.com/21-divorce-mistakes'>divorce mistakes</a> that so many people unwittingly make. He also scrutinizes the misconceptions surrounding legal processes, the potential risks versus rewards of trials, and the strategic approaches to avoiding court battles. ¬†</p><p>If you‚Äôre thinking about or facing divorce, this episode is a treasure-trove of practical wisdom that will guide you through your divorce with more control and less conflict and expense.¬† <br/><br/><b>About Raiford<br/></b>Raiford Dalton Palmer is an experienced Illinois divorce attorney and the bestselling author of &quot;<a href='https://www.amazon.com/Just-Want-This-Done-Successful-ebook/dp/B096MZSYFN'><em>I Just Want This Done: How Smart, Successful People Get Divorced Without Losing Their Kids, Money, and Minds</em></a>,&quot; named the Best Family Law Book of All Time by BookAuthority. Raiford has been featured in prominent media outlets including The Associated Press, The Los Angeles Times, Forbes, Newsweek, US News, the New York Post, SiriusXM Radio, and WGN Radio AM 720.</p><p>With nearly 30 years of experience as a lawyer and mediator, Raiford is the CEO of STG Divorce Law, P.C., a law firm focusing solely on matrimonial law in the Chicago area. He is a Fellow in the Illinois Chapter of The American Academy of Matrimonial Lawyers (AAML).</p><p>Raif is married to his law partner and AAML Fellow Juli Gumina, and they have a blended family of two sons and two daughters.</p><p><b>Connect with Raiford<br/></b>You can connect with Raiford on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/raifordpalmer/'>Raiford Palmer</a>, on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/raiford.palmer'>Raiford Palmer</a> and on Instagram and X¬† <a href='https://x.com/raifordpalmer'>@Raiford Palmer</a>.¬† To learn more about Raif‚Äôs work visit his website at STG Law Firm and visit his YouTube channel at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZDEDIRwh-UgJT_PvW6bf5A'>STG Divorce Law</a> and listen to his podcast at <a href='https://www.ijustwantthisdonepod.com/'>I Just Want This Done Podcast</a>.¬† To easily get the best selling book &quot;<em>I Just Want This Done: How Smart, Successful People Get Divorced Without Losing Their Kids, Money, and Minds</em>&quot; visit <a href='https://www.ijustwantthisdone.com/'>I just Want This Done</a>.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <itunes:summary><![CDATA[What would you do if your personal safety was at risk? Do you even know what you would do?     <description><![CDATA[<p>What would you do if your personal safety was at risk? Do you even know what you would do?</p><p>This podcast episode takes a deep dive into practical safety strategies with Catherine Trimboli, a seasoned law enforcement professional turned personal protection advocate.¬†</p><p>Catherine shares how she empowers high-level women to feel secure through situational awareness, safety planning, and discrete security services. With her background as a law enforcement captain with 30 years of experience Catherine is particularly well-poised to share practical advice and real-world tips on everything from avoiding dangerous encounters to safeguarding yourself when traveling, and more.</p><p>She also shares how you can empower your children through safety education, without making them feel so bold that they put themselves in harm‚Äôs way.¬†</p><p>From maintaining privacy about your whereabouts to implementing strategies for safe social interactions, Catherine‚Äôs advice is a blueprint for safeguarding peace of mind no matter who or where you are.<br/><br/><b>About Catherine<br/></b>Catherine Trimboli - Retired Boss Lady / Personal Protector Concierge. As a retired Law Enforcement Captain with over 30 years of experience, Catherine is now channeling her expertise into launching a personal protection business for your peace of mind. Her focus is on providing discreet, high-level security services tailored to women and children. With a deep understanding and commitment to confidentiality and personalized safety planning, she offers practical solutions to help individuals feel empowered, safe, and secure in their daily lives. As a driven professional with a servant-leadership approach, she leads with purpose, and passion, always striving to uplift and inspire those around her.     <description><![CDATA[<p>How do you decide <a href='https://karencovy.com/who-gets-the-house-in-a-divorce/'>whether to keep the house in your divorce</a>?</p><p>With your home typically being one of the biggest assets you have, it‚Äôs not a simple question. It also has tremendous implications for your future, both from a financial, as well as from an emotional standpoint.</p><p>In this podcast episode, real estate expert Maci Chance shares her own journey through divorce and how it led her to specialize in helping women navigate the often-complicated decisions surrounding whether to keep their home in a divorce ‚Ä¶ or not.</p><p>Maci‚Äôs practical advice and real-life stories provide critical guidance on a myriad of real estate issues in divorce, including decluttering, staging, and smart pricing tactics. Her strengths lie in her ability to transform a process typically filled with fear, uncertainty and monumental challenge to one full of courage, ease and abundant opportunity.</p><p><b>Connect with Maci<br/></b>You can connect with Maci on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/macichance/'>Maci Chance</a>, on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/macichancerealtor/'>Maci Chance Realtor</a> and follow Maci on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/macichancerealtor'>Maci Chance Realtor</a>. ¬† To learn more about Maci‚Äôs work visit her website at <a href='http://www.macichance.com/'>Maci Chance</a> where you can also download your copy of 5 Questions to Ask Yourself When Deciding Where to Live After Divorce.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Love and intimacy can be complicated, especially when sexual challenges arise in a marriage. In this podcast episode Janelle Orion, an Ivy League-educated life coach, opens up about her unique path from a deeply committed relationship to a sexless marriage to a &quot;divorce in love.&quot;¬†</p><p>In this candid conversation, Janelle shares how she married for the first time at age 45 and faced unexpected challenges when her husband no longer wanted to have sex with her. Through therapy, Tantra, and personal growth, Janelle embarked on a quest to better understand, not only what was happening in her marriage, but to understand her own desires and boundaries as well.</p><p>Janelle&apos;s insights into navigating intimacy and having a sexless marriage with someone you deeply love are both profoundly practical and deeply personal.¬†</p><p>With her background in non-traditional relationship dynamics, including polyamory and open relationships, Janelle brings a fresh perspective on navigating love, communication, and self-discovery. Her personal journey from marital struggles to &quot;divorcing in love&quot; offers a unique perspective on relationships, personal growth, and unconventional divorce solutions.<br/><br/><b>About Janelle<br/></b>As an Ivy-League educated personal growth junkie, entrepreneur and pleasure activator, Janelle knows how to hold space--and the occasional butt plug--for others‚Äô spiritual awakening. Catalysts for her becoming include plant medicines, polyamory and getting married and divorced ‚Äúin love.‚Äù She has been to Burning Man nine times, all seven continents and now lives in the Goddess Temple. With her open heart and radical acceptance, she coaches people to feel wildly alive and gives you permission to live one step closer to your truth.</p><p><b>Connect with Janelle <br/></b>You can connect with Janelle on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/janelleorion/'>Janelle Orion</a>, on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=61558572755509'>Janelle Orion</a>, follow Janelle on X at <a href='https://twitter.com/feelwildlyalive'>Feel Wildly Alive</a> and on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/feelwildlyalive'>Feel Wildly Alive</a>.¬† To find out more about Janelle‚Äôs work visit her website at <a href='https://www.feelwildlyalive.com/'>Feel Wildly Alive</a> and catch her podcast <a href='https://www.permissiontobehuman.live/'>Permission to be Human</a>.</p><p><b>Books referenced on the show:</b></p><p><a href='https://www.amazon.com/Art-Receiving-Giving-Wheel-Consent/dp/1643883089'>The Art of Giving and Receiving</a> by Betty Martin, D.C.<br/><a href='https://www.amazon.com/Come-You-Are-Surprising-Transform/dp/1476762090/ref=sr_1_2?crid=GSXVEQZC0YZP&amp;dib=eyJ2IjoiMSJ9.MUU7P500f-I-uEetnuNKfPXAWFy0Gc1T7MH0K-SCIWiqG5WBY4jNatsZ6QSSB59gUYDescT42eFlDxy2c7M4H3Qw5_U9Sbkn3Y5ifG6W2-QngJ1JW0d2PDt-ALwkTHE891SbLTv4SUezOGgdFV9-wrGMxUSYsaz79EiL0j5xEH21qYa8EJsAFRyoo-60X4Eza14Jmf6i8mFHF1E4FbVRT77V8jDdiJ6RLI__W86lx_8.IP5ucdQNqaw4fmKehBj8d1bkndHnjz8uoTqBYHC0v0o&amp;dib_tag=se&amp;keywords=come+as+you+are+by+emily+nagoski%2C+ph.d&amp;qid=1728441411&amp;s=books&amp;sprefix=Come+as+%2Cstripbooks%2C108&amp;sr=1-2'>Come as You Are</a> by Emily Nagasaki, Ph. Her personal journey from marital struggles to &quot;divorcing in love&quot; offers a unique perspective on relationships, personal growth, and unconventional divorce solutions.<br/><br/><b>About Janelle<br/></b>As an Ivy-League educated personal growth junkie, entrepreneur and pleasure activator, Janelle knows how to hold space--and the occasional butt plug--for others‚Äô spiritual awakening. With her open heart and radical acceptance, she coaches people to feel wildly alive and gives you permission to live one step closer to your truth.</p><p><b>Connect with Janelle <br/></b>You can connect with Janelle on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/janelleorion/'>Janelle Orion</a>, on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=61558572755509'>Janelle Orion</a>, follow Janelle on X at <a href='https://twitter.com/feelwildlyalive'>Feel Wildly Alive</a> and on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/feelwildlyalive'>Feel Wildly Alive</a>.¬† To find out more about Janelle‚Äôs work visit her website at <a href='https://www.feelwildlyalive.com/'>Feel Wildly Alive</a> and catch her podcast <a href='https://www.permissiontobehuman.live/'>Permission to be Human</a>.</p><p><b>Books referenced on the show:</b></p><p><a href='https://www.amazon.com/Art-Receiving-Giving-Wheel-Consent/dp/1643883089'>The Art of Giving and Receiving</a> by Betty Martin, D.C.<br/><a href='https://www.amazon.com/Come-You-Are-Surprising-Transform/dp/1476762090/ref=sr_1_2?crid=GSXVEQZC0YZP&amp;dib=eyJ2IjoiMSJ9.MUU7P500f-I-uEetnuNKfPXAWFy0Gc1T7MH0K-SCIWiqG5WBY4jNatsZ6QSSB59gUYDescT42eFlDxy2c7M4H3Qw5_U9Sbkn3Y5ifG6W2-QngJ1JW0d2PDt-ALwkTHE891SbLTv4SUezOGgdFV9-wrGMxUSYsaz79EiL0j5xEH21qYa8EJsAFRyoo-60X4Eza14Jmf6i8mFHF1E4FbVRT77V8jDdiJ6RLI__W86lx_8.IP5ucdQNqaw4fmKehBj8d1bkndHnjz8uoTqBYHC0v0o&amp;dib_tag=se&amp;keywords=come+as+you+are+by+emily+nagoski%2C+ph.d&amp;qid=1728441411&amp;s=books&amp;sprefix=Come+as+%2Cstripbooks%2C108&amp;sr=1-2'>Come as You Are</a> by Emily Nagasaki, Ph.     <description><![CDATA[<p>What if there was a simple way that you could save time and money in your divorce while also securing your post-divorce financial future too? By creating a divorce financial plan you can do exactly that.</p><p>Amy Colton, a wealth advisor, mediator, and the founder of Your Divorce Made Simple LLC, shares her unique approach to <a href='https://karencovy.com/divorce-financial-planning'>divorce financial planning</a> that helps divorcing couples streamline the divorce process without compromising their financial future. Amy guides her clients to make sound financial decisions by creating and using a comprehensive ‚Äúdivorce financial plan.‚Äù<br/><br/>Amy has combined her extensive financial expertise with solid mediation skills and a passion for helping those going through divorce.¬† She now helps couples create amicable, cost-effective divorce resolutions that ALSO protect their financial nest egg for the future.</p><p>In this podcast episode, we cover a range of financial topics including grey divorce, social security, and understanding the tax implications of a divorce financial settlement.</p><p>If you are nervous about your financial future post-divorce, tune in to this episode to discover what you need to know to create financial security for yourself starting now.<br/><br/><b>About Amy<br/></b>Amy is a Wealth Advisor with Forefront Wealth Advisors and has devoted her practice to educating and supporting women, especially ones that have gone through major life transitions. She is also the founder Your Divorce Made Simple LLC, where she combines the role of Certified Divorce Financial Analyst (CDFA¬Æ) and Family Law Mediator helping couples and individuals achieve win-win outcomes during the divorce process.</p><p><b>Connect with Amy<br/></b>You can connect with Amy on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/amy-colton-mba-cdfa-30094b158/'>Amy Colton</a> and on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/amy.colton.77'>Amy Colton</a> and follow Amy on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/amy.colton.77/'>Amy Colton.</a>¬† To find out more about how to protect your assets in a divorce and how to work with Amy, visit her website at <a href='https://yourdivorcemadesimple.com/'>Your Divorce Made Simple</a>.<br/><br/>Watch for Amy‚Äôs new book coming soon.     <itunes:title>How to Decide Whether to Divorce Using Discernment Therapy</itunes:title>
    <title>How to Decide Whether to Divorce Using Discernment Therapy</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[What do you do when you‚Äôre leaning towards getting a divorce and your spouse wants to work on your marriage? That‚Äôs the question we dive into today in this discussion with Dr. Ginny Wright, a seasoned clinical psychologist who is certified in discernment therapy (a/k/a discernment counseling.) Dr. Wright works with couples who are on the brink of divorce to cut through the fog of indecision and come to a decision about their marriage with clarity and confidence. She uses a process developed b...]]></itunes:summary>
    <description><![CDATA[<p>What do you do when you‚Äôre leaning towards getting a divorce and your spouse wants to work on your marriage? That‚Äôs the question we dive into today in this discussion with Dr. Ginny Wright, a seasoned clinical psychologist who is certified in discernment therapy (a/k/a <a href='https://karencovy.com/discernment-counseling'>discernment counseling</a>.)</p><p>Dr. Wright works with couples who are on the brink of divorce to cut through the fog of indecision and come to a decision about their marriage with clarity and confidence. She uses a process developed by Bill Doherty called discernment counseling or discernment therapy. It is a specialized, short-term form of therapy that‚Äôs specially made for couples on the brink of divorce.¬†</p><p>Traditional marriage counseling presumes a couple wants to save their marriage. Divorce lawyers assume that a couple (or at least one spouse!) wants a divorce. Discernment therapy bridges the gap between those two choices and helps a couple reach clarity about what they each really want so that they can take the path that&apos;s most appropriate for them.</p><p>If you‚Äôre leaning toward divorce while your spouse wants to save your marriage (or vice versa) this podcast episode will provide you with a valuable tool for working through your ambivalence and coming to a decision about your marriage that you feel good about.</p><p>To discover more, tune in to this podcast episode and check out this article on<a href='https://karencovy.com/discernment-counseling/'> discernment counseling</a>.<br/><br/><b>About Dr. Ginny<br/></b>Dr. Ginny Wright is a clinical psychologist and certified discernment counselor. She has been in private practice for over 30 years, seeing children, adults, couples and families. Much of her current work is focused on providing discernment counseling services to couples on the brink of divorce, as well as trainings, workshops and professional consultation services to other discernment professionals.</p><p><b>Connect with Dr. Ginny<br/></b>You can connect with Dr. Ginny on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/ginny-wright-lapporte-210aa01/'>Ginny Wright Lapporte</a> and on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=61557859078480'>LWA Discernment Counseling</a>.¬† To learn more about Discernment Counseling and how to work with Dr. Ginny visit <a href='http://www.lwadiscernment.com/'>LWA Discernment Counseling</a>.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></description>
    <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>What do you do when you‚Äôre leaning towards getting a divorce and your spouse wants to work on your marriage? That‚Äôs the question we dive into today in this discussion with Dr. Ginny Wright, a seasoned clinical psychologist who is certified in discernment therapy (a/k/a <a href='https://karencovy.com/discernment-counseling'>discernment counseling</a>.)</p><p>Dr. Wright works with couples who are on the brink of divorce to cut through the fog of indecision and come to a decision about their marriage with clarity and confidence. She uses a process developed by Bill Doherty called discernment counseling or discernment therapy. It is a specialized, short-term form of therapy that‚Äôs specially made for couples on the brink of divorce.¬†</p><p>Traditional marriage counseling presumes a couple wants to save their marriage. Divorce lawyers assume that a couple (or at least one spouse!) wants a divorce. Discernment therapy bridges the gap between those two choices and helps a couple reach clarity about what they each really want so that they can take the path that&apos;s most appropriate for them.</p><p>If you‚Äôre leaning toward divorce while your spouse wants to save your marriage (or vice versa) this podcast episode will provide you with a valuable tool for working through your ambivalence and coming to a decision about your marriage that you feel good about.</p><p>To discover more, tune in to this podcast episode and check out this article on<a href='https://karencovy.com/discernment-counseling/'> discernment counseling</a>.<br/><br/><b>About Dr. Ginny<br/></b>Dr. Ginny Wright is a clinical psychologist and certified discernment counselor.     <itunes:title>Parenting Marriages Unpacked with Susan Gadoua</itunes:title>
    <title>Parenting Marriages Unpacked with Susan Gadoua</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[What happens when a marriage is no longer working, but the couple wants to stay together for the kids? Is there a way that they can continue to co-parent together, pursue romantic relationships outside of their marriage, but also avoid getting a divorce until their kids are grown? According to therapist and author Susan Pease Gadoua the answer is ‚ÄúYes.‚Äù Through her work with couples, Susan developed the revolutionary concept of a "parenting marriage" - a compassionate alternative that allows ...]]></itunes:summary>
    <description><![CDATA[<p>What happens when a marriage is no longer working, but the couple wants to stay together for the kids? Is there a way that they can continue to co-parent together, pursue romantic relationships outside of their marriage, but also avoid getting a divorce until their kids are grown?</p><p>According to therapist and author Susan Pease Gadoua the answer is ‚ÄúYes.‚Äù</p><p>Through her work with couples, Susan developed the revolutionary concept of a &quot;parenting marriage&quot; - a compassionate alternative that allows parents to prioritize their children&apos;s well-being while redefining their relationship. This innovative type of relationship enables couples to live separately under one roof and maintain their family‚Äôs stability while also pursuing their own individual happiness.</p><p>While a parenting marriage is not appropriate for every couple, it provides a workable alternative to the traditional &quot;stay together or divorce&quot; dilemma. A parenting marriage can also provide a &quot;soft landing&quot; into divorce or a long-term solution for couples committed to raising their children together.¬†</p><p>This podcast episode challenges the conventional notions of marriage and family. Susan‚Äôs insights invite us to reconsider what family can look like in the modern world, and how we can truly put children&apos;s needs at the forefront of relationship decisions.<br/><br/><b>About Susan<br/></b>Susan Pease Gadoua is a therapist in the SF Bay Area and the founder of the Parenting Marriage concept. She works with couples &quot;on the brink&quot; and runs several women&apos;s divorce support groups.¬†</p><p>As a child of divorced parents, Susan knows first-hand how disruptive an unhappy marriage and subsequent marital dissolution can be.¬† Susan&apos;s personal experience, combined with years of working with couples in distress ‚Äì both in striving to save their marriage or transition out of it ‚Äì led her to become passionate about offering support to people at perhaps one of the most crucial junctures in their lives.¬†</p><p>Susan founded The Changing Marriage Institute and coined the term, ‚ÄúParenting Marriage‚Äù which is now a concept that is known throughout the world.</p><p><b>Connect with Susan<br/></b>You can connect with Susan on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/susanpeasegadoua/'>Susan Pease Gadoua</a> and on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/parentingmarriage'>Parenting Marriage</a> and follow Susan on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/changingmarriage/'>Changing Marriage</a>.¬† For more information about Susan‚Äôs work visit <a href='https://www.parentingmarriage.com/'>Parenting Marriage</a>.¬† The best way to get in touch with Susan is through email at Susan@changingmarriage.com.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></description>
    <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>What happens when a marriage is no longer working, but the couple wants to stay together for the kids? Is there a way that they can continue to co-parent together, pursue romantic relationships outside of their marriage, but also avoid getting a divorce until their kids are grown?</p><p>According to therapist and author Susan Pease Gadoua the answer is ‚ÄúYes.‚Äù</p><p>Through her work with couples, Susan developed the revolutionary concept of a &quot;parenting marriage&quot; - a compassionate alternative that allows parents to prioritize their children&apos;s well-being while redefining their relationship. This innovative type of relationship enables couples to live separately under one roof and maintain their family‚Äôs stability while also pursuing their own individual happiness.</p><p>While a parenting marriage is not appropriate for every couple, it provides a workable alternative to the traditional &quot;stay together or divorce&quot; dilemma. A parenting marriage can also provide a &quot;soft landing&quot; into divorce or a long-term solution for couples committed to raising their children together.¬†</p><p>This podcast episode challenges the conventional notions of marriage and family. Susan‚Äôs insights invite us to reconsider what family can look like in the modern world, and how we can truly put children&apos;s needs at the forefront of relationship decisions.<br/><br/><b>About Susan<br/></b>Susan Pease Gadoua is a therapist in the SF Bay Area and the founder of the Parenting Marriage concept. She works with couples &quot;on the brink&quot; and runs several women&apos;s divorce support groups.¬†</p><p>As a child of divorced parents, Susan knows first-hand how disruptive an unhappy marriage and subsequent marital dissolution can be.¬† Susan&apos;s personal experience, combined with years of working with couples in distress ‚Äì both in striving to save their marriage or transition out of it ‚Äì led her to become passionate about offering support to people at perhaps one of the most crucial junctures in their lives.¬†</p><p>Susan founded The Changing Marriage Institute and coined the term, ‚ÄúParenting Marriage‚Äù which is now a concept that is known throughout the world.</p><p><b>Connect with Susan<br/></b>You can connect with Susan on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/susanpeasegadoua/'>Susan Pease Gadoua</a> and on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/parentingmarriage'>Parenting Marriage</a> and follow Susan on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/changingmarriage/'>Changing Marriage</a>.¬† For more information about Susan‚Äôs work visit <a href='https://www.parentingmarriage.com/'>Parenting Marriage</a>.¬† The best way to get in touch with Susan is through email at Susan@changingmarriage.com.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></content:encoded>

    <description><![CDATA[<p>Ever wondered how to truly support your children through the emotional whirlwind of divorce? Family law attorney and children‚Äôs book author, Misty Hardison from the Rosen Law Firm in North Carolina, knows.¬†</p><p>As a family law attorney, Misty has seen how children often struggle to express their feelings and concerns during their parents‚Äô divorce, particularly when they feel caught in the middle between their parents.</p><p>Misty‚Äôs experiences prompted her to write ‚Äú<a href='https://www.amazon.com/Jakes-Fridays-Misty-Woodard-Hardison/dp/B0C1HVPC8B?dib=eyJ2IjoiMSJ9.et2CeAicS---klBt2Aj4VgoVrpoaAMtBm90gfM6UykvNT5X44riBCDahK62idQS04LPrQURH4n9MsgSMITPnGA2c9onlFweK4Hrmt1SSW4pieRxkk_DVTreWuvtVvELMCkU6EUl-XgRatoGLnZn4Mx9dnv17W3MLbI0JBl-qMlKwwhg56orGLr3etunA7mdBnDXj0Tro1KK7lXaN57HE0qPtMIFnAiarHqFai0JimsY.EyM5U1EtttoCsUhVGfJ50Ve9a-HPlywkQ5xBLWKoh6M&amp;dib_tag=se&amp;keywords=jake%27s+fridays&amp;qid=1723061345&amp;sr=8-1&amp;linkCode=sl1&amp;tag=karenccom-20&amp;linkId=8ce2744b0ff3b0fd58064115d1c65dfa&amp;language=en_US&amp;ref_=as_li_ss_tl'>Jake&apos;s Fridays</a>&quot; a children&apos;s book which aims to facilitate discussions between parents and children about the changes that come with divorce. The book addresses common worries kids may experience in divorce but struggle to express.</p><p>In this podcast episode we also discuss how high-conflict cases affect kids. We talk about how important it is for parents to keep their child‚Äôs perspective in mind as they go through the divorce process since children have no voice in that process themselves. We also talk about parenting coordinators and the role they can play in keeping the peace between warring parents.¬†</p><p>If you‚Äôre a parent going through a divorce, the insights Misty shares in this episode can give you valuable insight into the way that you can minimize the impact your divorce may have on your children, and how you can truly put your children first.<br/><br/><b>About Misty<br/></b>Misty went from practicing law in a small town in North Carolina to NC‚Äôs biggest city of Charlotte, and then all the way to New York City. But now, she‚Äôs back in North Carolina at Rosen practicing family law, which is where her heart truly is.</p><p>Misty‚Äôs main claim to fame is as a children‚Äôs book author. She has a third book coming out soon and has written two other books: <em>Why Did You Leave Us, We Loved You So</em>?¬† and <em>Jake‚Äôs Fridays</em>.</p><p>Misty loves the Tarheels and Mexican food, her favorite place on earth is Atlantic Beach, but nothing captures her heart like her two sons.</p><p><b>Connect with Misty<br/></b>You can connect with Misty on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/company/rosen-law-firm/'>Rosen Law Firm</a>, on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/RosenLaw'>Rosen Law</a> and follow Misty on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/rosenlawfirm'>Rosen Law Firm</a>.     <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Ever wondered how to truly support your children through the emotional whirlwind of divorce? Family law attorney and children‚Äôs book author, Misty Hardison from the Rosen Law Firm in North Carolina, knows.¬†</p><p>As a family law attorney, Misty has seen how children often struggle to express their feelings and concerns during their parents‚Äô divorce, particularly when they feel caught in the middle between their parents.</p><p>Misty‚Äôs experiences prompted her to write ‚Äú<a href='https://www.amazon.com/Jakes-Fridays-Misty-Woodard-Hardison/dp/B0C1HVPC8B?dib=eyJ2IjoiMSJ9.et2CeAicS---klBt2Aj4VgoVrpoaAMtBm90gfM6UykvNT5X44riBCDahK62idQS04LPrQURH4n9MsgSMITPnGA2c9onlFweK4Hrmt1SSW4pieRxkk_DVTreWuvtVvELMCkU6EUl-XgRatoGLnZn4Mx9dnv17W3MLbI0JBl-qMlKwwhg56orGLr3etunA7mdBnDXj0Tro1KK7lXaN57HE0qPtMIFnAiarHqFai0JimsY.EyM5U1EtttoCsUhVGfJ50Ve9a-HPlywkQ5xBLWKoh6M&amp;dib_tag=se&amp;keywords=jake%27s+fridays&amp;qid=1723061345&amp;sr=8-1&amp;linkCode=sl1&amp;tag=karenccom-20&amp;linkId=8ce2744b0ff3b0fd58064115d1c65dfa&amp;language=en_US&amp;ref_=as_li_ss_tl'>Jake&apos;s Fridays</a>&quot; a children&apos;s book which aims to facilitate discussions between parents and children about the changes that come with divorce.     <itunes:summary><![CDATA[What if getting divorced didn't have to be a painful, expensive, and drawn-out battle?     <description><![CDATA[<p>What if getting divorced didn&apos;t have to be a painful, expensive, and drawn-out battle? According to Cary Jacobson, founder and CEO of Jacobson Family Law, it doesn‚Äôt have to be.</p><p>Cary&apos;s firm takes a radically different approach to divorce than most divorce lawyers. They only handle non-litigated cases, focusing on mediation and Collaborative Divorce to keep the drama and costs down. They also offer flat-fee packages instead of billing by the hour - giving their clients peace of mind and control over their divorce costs.</p><p>Cary reveals how establishing clear expectations and utilizing advanced technology helps her firm streamline case management, reduce overhead, and improve efficiency. That, in turn, allows Cary&apos;s team to be more responsive to their clients while maintaining a better work-life balance for themselves.¬†</p><p>Cary&apos;s methods challenge long-held assumptions about divorce and offer hope for more amicable separations.</p><p>In this conversation, you‚Äôll also get a sneak peek into Keri&apos;s upcoming book, &quot;Divorce Decoded: A Manifesto for Women,&quot; designed to guide women through each stage of divorce with a focus on the advantages of mediation.<br/><br/><b>About Cary<br/></b>Cary Jacobson, Esquire is the founder and CEO of Jacobson Family Law. Cary has been practicing law for over a decade, having successfully represented clients in all facets of family law proceedings in Maryland.</p><p>Through her experience litigating family law matters, Cary has found that the conflict associated with litigation often tears a family apart making it toxic for children and their parents. However, as a certified mediator and collaborative divorce attorney, Cary has also seen how these forms of alternative dispute resolution can lead to and foster successful co-parenting arrangements.¬†</p><p><b>Connect with Cary<br/></b>You can connect with Cary on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/caryjacobson/'>Cary C Jacobson</a> and on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/jacobsonfamilylaw'>Jacobson Family Law</a>.¬† You can follow Cary on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/jacobsonfamilylaw/'>Jacobson Family Law</a> and YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@jacobsonfamilylaw'>Jacobson Family Law</a>.
