    <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>What if getting divorced didn&apos;t have to be a painful, expensive, and drawn-out battle? According to Cary Jacobson, founder and CEO of Jacobson Family Law, it doesn‚Äôt have to be.</p><p>Cary&apos;s firm takes a radically different approach to divorce than most divorce lawyers. They only handle non-litigated cases, focusing on mediation and Collaborative Divorce to keep the drama and costs down. They also offer flat-fee packages instead of billing by the hour - giving their clients peace of mind and control over their divorce costs.</p><p>Cary reveals how establishing clear expectations and utilizing advanced technology helps her firm streamline case management, reduce overhead, and improve efficiency. That, in turn, allows Cary&apos;s team to be more responsive to their clients while maintaining a better work-life balance for themselves.¬†</p><p>Cary&apos;s methods challenge long-held assumptions about divorce and offer hope for more amicable separations.</p><p>In this conversation, you‚Äôll also get a sneak peek into Keri&apos;s upcoming book, &quot;Divorce Decoded: A Manifesto for Women,&quot; designed to guide women through each stage of divorce with a focus on the advantages of mediation.<br/><br/><b>About Cary<br/></b>Cary Jacobson, Esquire is the founder and CEO of Jacobson Family Law. Cary has been practicing law for over a decade, having successfully represented clients in all facets of family law proceedings in Maryland.</p><p>Through her experience litigating family law matters, Cary has found that the conflict associated with litigation often tears a family apart making it toxic for children and their parents. However, as a certified mediator and collaborative divorce attorney, Cary has also seen how these forms of alternative dispute resolution can lead to and foster successful co-parenting arrangements.¬†</p><p><b>Connect with Cary<br/></b>You can connect with Cary on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/caryjacobson/'>Cary C Jacobson</a> and on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/jacobsonfamilylaw'>Jacobson Family Law</a>.¬† You can follow Cary on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/jacobsonfamilylaw/'>Jacobson Family Law</a> and YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@jacobsonfamilylaw'>Jacobson Family Law</a>.     <title>Candace Dellacona: Protecting Wealth Without Worry in the Sandwich Generation </title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[How do you protect your family's wealth and legacy while juggling the responsibilities of the "sandwich generation"?     <description><![CDATA[<p>How do you protect your family&apos;s wealth and legacy while juggling the responsibilities of the &quot;sandwich generation&quot;? In this episode, high-powered estate planning attorney Candace Dellacona shares her extensive expertise in estate planning, asset protection, elder law, and special needs advocacy to help answer some of the most pressing questions about managing the emotional and financial pressures that come with being ‚Äústuck in the middle.‚Äù</p><p>Candace explains how proper estate planning can be used to safeguard your assets and protect your wealth. From advanced directives to trusts, we discuss the various instruments clients can use to ensure financial security and proper asset management. We talk candidly about the role trustees play in protecting athletes, high-income earners, and beneficiaries from poor financial decisions, particularly as they age.</p><p>We also discuss how couples with significant wealth can create a &quot;legacy marriage&quot; to ensure their financial stability and have wealth to pass on to their family once they‚Äôre gone.</p><p>Whether you&apos;re planning for your future, trying to restructure your marriage, or helping an aging loved one maintain financial security, this conversation is packed with actionable advice that can help you navigate these tough decisions with confidence.<br/><b><br/>About Candace</b><br/>Candace Dellacona is a Principal and Shareholder at Offit and Kurman Law Office where she works in the firm‚Äôs Estates and Trusts practice group. Candace is considered ‚Äúa family‚Äôs lawyer,‚Äù however you may define family.¬†</p><p>She works closely with multiple generations of family members to protect what they have throughout every phase of their lives. Candace constructs wills, trusts and medical directives that address each client‚Äôs unique goals, whether they are starting adult life or experiencing a significant event such as a change in marital status, welcoming a child, diagnosis of illness or death of a loved one.</p><p>Candace focuses her law practice on Estate Planning, Asset Protection Planning, Elder Law, Estate Administration, Special Needs Planning and Advocacy.<br/><br/><b>Connect with Candace</b><br/>You can connect with Candace on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/candacedellacona/'>Candace Dellacona</a> and Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/TheSandwichGenerationSurvivalGuide'>The Sandwich Generation Survival Guide</a>.¬† Listen to <a href='https://offitkurman.com/offit-kurman-podcast/the-sandwich-generation-survival-guide/'>The Sandwich Generation Survival Guide Podcast</a> and learn more about <a href='https://offitkurman.com/'>Offit Kurman, Attorneys at Law</a>.¬† You can also email Candace at candacedellacona@offitkurman.com.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Ever felt overwhelmed by clutter and chaos? Or maybe your spouse loves to be surrounded by ‚Äústuff‚Äù and you don‚Äôt - and it‚Äôs causing big problems in your marriage.</p><p>Gayle Gruenberg is a Certified Professional Organizer who helps people create systems to simplify their lives. In this fascinating interview, Gayle shares insights from her 21-year career transforming spaces and minds through organization.</p><p>From tackling hoarding issues to facilitating difficult decisions during divorce, Gayle&apos;s approach goes far beyond just tidying up. She delves into the psychology behind clutter, using empathy and tactile techniques to help clients process emotions that are tied to their possessions. Gayle&apos;s expertise extends to virtual organizing, downsizing assistance, and even life management for those struggling with ADHD.</p><p>While organizing physical spaces is a key part of her work, Gayle also helps clients organize their time and schedules. Using tools like analog time timers, she teaches strategies for visualizing and managing time more effectively.¬†</p><p>Whether you‚Äôre dealing with overflowing closets or overbooked calendars, Gayle&apos;s holistic approach aims to bring calm and clarity to all aspects of her clients&apos; lives.<br/><br/><b>About Gayle<br/></b>Gayle is the Chief Executive Organizer of Let‚Äôs Get Organized, LLC, in Northern New Jersey.     <description><![CDATA[<p>What do you do when getting married means you‚Äôll instantly become BOTH a spouse and a step-parent? She explains how step-parents can get the right support, and emphasizes the transformative power of finding your voice within the family unit.¬†</p><p>If you or someone you know is considering getting married, remarried, becoming a step-parent, or blending families, this podcast episode is a &quot;Must Listen to&quot; episode. It can help you create a supportive space for your children while also balancing their needs with your own happiness.<br/><br/><b>About Maria<br/></b>Maria knows from experience that stepparenting isn‚Äôt something you pick up from scrolling the internet or crowdsourcing your friends. She believes that forging a relationship with your stepchild means learning to find your voice as well as hearing theirs. As the daughter of divorced immigrant parents and a stepparent herself, Maria understands blended families&apos; communication and connection challenges and the vital importance of healing pain and preventing further harm by establishing innovative parenting support systems.     <itunes:title>Protect Your Assets And Safeguard Your Wealth With Lindsey Paige Markus</itunes:title>
    <title>Protect Your Assets And Safeguard Your Wealth With Lindsey Paige Markus</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[The two things everyone will face one day are death and taxes. Estate planning attorney Lindsey Paige Markus helps her clients plan for what will happen at their death and protect as much of their wealth from unnecessary taxes as possible.  As a trusted advisor and bestselling author, Lindsey demystifies the world of trusts, asset protection, and tax planning, revealing how proper estate planning can safeguard your legacy and provide for your loved ones. In this episode, Lindsey explains...]]></itunes:summary>
    <description><![CDATA[<p>The two things everyone will face one day are death and taxes. Estate planning attorney Lindsey Paige Markus helps her clients plan for what will happen at their death and protect as much of their wealth from unnecessary taxes as possible.¬† As a trusted advisor and bestselling author, Lindsey demystifies the world of trusts, asset protection, and tax planning, revealing how proper estate planning can safeguard your legacy and provide for your loved ones.</p><p>In this episode, Lindsey explains how estate planning goes far beyond just having a will. She discusses the power of trusts to protect assets from creditors and ex-spouses, as well as their ability to minimize tax liabilities. With major changes to estate tax laws on the horizon, Lindsey stresses the urgency for high-net-worth individuals to act now. She explores how certain kinds of trusts can be used strategically to protect wealth, even in complex situations like divorce.¬†</p><p>Lindsey also explains how proper estate planning can help couples who don‚Äôt want to divorce, but also don‚Äôt want to continue living in a traditional marriage, restructure their marriage in a way that preserves their wealth for their children. In this type of ‚Äúlegacy marriage‚Äù couples can continue to achieve their financial goals AND create a different kind of relationship that allows them to stay ‚Äúmarried‚Äù but live life on their terms.<br/><br/><b>About Lindsey<br/></b>Lindsey heads Chuhak &amp; Tecson‚Äôs 25-attorney Estate Planning &amp; Asset Protection group and works closely with business owners and families to plan their estates, protect assets, transfer wealth and reduce tax liabilities. Lindsey is the author of <a href='https://www.amazon.com/Gift-Future-Conversations-Estate-Planning/dp/057832508X/ref=sr_1_1?crid=3KKHM16KZW5O6&amp;dib=eyJ2IjoiMSJ9.1gzj_Z3fxQ4gRxRdOrKQRUeJYI9RFgAiBMfd4bTuHCABYWtvz8jgU2JcZD1cuh5YLowZsetEQ3lLdjn_zXWanpQYIuq2PCd2ZWRO02Q2LFi__sl72uLgE9tCXWwNnbL8EthE8wVz4JUm2h0dXnLjoXGWCRnUzDBiBnNfNJkbe3sAwbWVIk9zgt7DLhBl2lUtNwj-8qIV2Cffz52BxMqUzmecJtpxhe7iJZ2Jx6vkrU4.0wkp-H-7maHFYY8P7yRjWOCUfk3txF_JkPI8-DgfqwA&amp;dib_tag=se&amp;keywords=a+gift+for+the+future&amp;qid=1714333214&amp;sprefix=a+gift+for+the+future%2Caps%2C83&amp;sr=8-1'>A Gift For The Future ‚Äì Conversations About Estate Planning</a> which takes readers on a journey through the world of estate planning. In her easy-to-follow writing style that eschews legalese and needless jargon without sacrificing sophistication or thoroughness, Lindsey provides the ins and outs of every estate planning tool, from simple to advanced. She interweaves the family story of Jack and Diane, to guide readers through estate planning needs from the time they decide to marry through the birth of children, business growth, divorce and the complex formation of new families and relationships.</p><p><b>Connect with Lindsey<br/></b>Connect with Lindsey on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/lindsey-markus-a279237/'>Lindsey Markus</a> and on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/lindsey.p.markus'>Lindsey Paige Markus</a>. Visit her website at <a href='https://lindseymarkus.com/'>Lindsey Markus</a> and learn more about Lindsey‚Äôs book at <a href='https://www.agiftforthefuture.com/'>A Gift For The Future</a>. ¬†</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></description>
    <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>The two things everyone will face one day are death and taxes. Estate planning attorney Lindsey Paige Markus helps her clients plan for what will happen at their death and protect as much of their wealth from unnecessary taxes as possible.¬† As a trusted advisor and bestselling author, Lindsey demystifies the world of trusts, asset protection, and tax planning, revealing how proper estate planning can safeguard your legacy and provide for your loved ones.</p><p>In this episode, Lindsey explains how estate planning goes far beyond just having a will. She discusses the power of trusts to protect assets from creditors and ex-spouses, as well as their ability to minimize tax liabilities. With major changes to estate tax laws on the horizon, Lindsey stresses the urgency for high-net-worth individuals to act now. She explores how certain kinds of trusts can be used strategically to protect wealth, even in complex situations like divorce.¬†</p><p>Lindsey also explains how proper estate planning can help couples who don‚Äôt want to divorce, but also don‚Äôt want to continue living in a traditional marriage, restructure their marriage in a way that preserves their wealth for their children. In this type of ‚Äúlegacy marriage‚Äù couples can continue to achieve their financial goals AND create a different kind of relationship that allows them to stay ‚Äúmarried‚Äù but live life on their terms.<br/><br/><b>About Lindsey<br/></b>Lindsey heads Chuhak &amp; Tecson‚Äôs 25-attorney Estate Planning &amp; Asset Protection group and works closely with business owners and families to plan their estates, protect assets, transfer wealth and reduce tax liabilities.     <description><![CDATA[<p>With today‚Äôs interest rates and the low inventory of available housing, buying a new home isn‚Äôt nearly as ‚Äúdo-able‚Äù today as it was a few years ago. Homes are being sold before they‚Äôre technically even on the market. Bidding wars are common.</p><p>Couples now find themselves facing hard decisions about how they‚Äôll both be able to find housing post-divorce. This is particularly a problem when a couple wants to live in a certain school district for their kids, or when they are trying to buy a home for one of them that‚Äôs close to the house they currently have.</p><p>Phillip LaGiglia, the Senior Vice President at North Shore Savings, who has been through his own difficult divorce, has a passion for guiding divorcing homeowners towards financial stability, especially for families with children. As a seasoned mortgage professional, Phil knows how important it is to get mortgage professionals involved early in the divorce process.¬†</p><p>Too often, divorcing couples make agreements about the house before they know whether the agreements they‚Äôve made are financially feasible or not. They can also get caught in a bind when they need the money from the sale of their marital home in order to buy a new home.</p><p>To eliminate this problem, Phil&apos;s company has pioneered an innovative &quot;Buy Now, Sell Later&quot; loan program that allows divorcing homeowners to purchase a new property without first having to sell their current home - removing a major financial stumbling block in their divorce.</p><p>This podcast episode can provide a wealth of information for divorcing couples (especially divorcing parents) who are ‚Äì and want to continue to be ‚Äì homeowners. <br/><br/><b>About Philip</b></p><p>Philip LaGiglia is a seasoned executive who for the last 30+ years has successfully built from start up, grew, and stabilized numerous mortgage lending platforms within the mortgage and banking industries. Phil promotes within his management style a culture that focuses on Faith, Family, and Business being the order of priority for each employee to support a balanced life style that breeds overall success for all staff members in every aspect of life. A firm believer in identifying purpose and applying a plan around that purpose, Phil is a driven leader who leads by example knowing any success is achieved by the efforts of all.</p><p><b>Connect with Philip</b></p><p>You can connect with Philip on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/philip-lagiglia-8988986/'>Philip LaGiglia</a> and at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/company/oak-leaf-community-mortgage/'>Oak Leaf Community Mortgage</a>.¬† Also on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/philip.lagiglia/'>Philip LaGiglia</a> and <a href='https://www.facebook.com/oakleafcommunitymortgage/'>Oak Leaf Community Mortgage</a>.¬† To learn more about the services Philip offers visit <a href='https://www.myoakleaf.com/'>Oak Leaf Community Mortgage</a>.¬† To contact Philip directly visit <a href='https://www.myoakleaf.com/connect-with-phil/'>Connect with Phil</a> or call 630-936-3245.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>With today‚Äôs interest rates and the low inventory of available housing, buying a new home isn‚Äôt nearly as ‚Äúdo-able‚Äù today as it was a few years ago. Homes are being sold before they‚Äôre technically even on the market. Bidding wars are common.</p><p>Couples now find themselves facing hard decisions about how they‚Äôll both be able to find housing post-divorce.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Wangari Kamau, the founder of Soma Global Consulting, is no stranger to life&apos;s challenges. From standing up against unequal pay to enduring a complicated international divorce after a nearly 30-year marriage, she has weathered many storms. Yet through it all, she found the resilience to not just survive, but thrive.<br/><br/>Her journey led her to develop powerful methods for nurturing mind, body and spirit during life&apos;s toughest transitions. Wangari now guides others, especially women over 50, to craft personalized self-care &quot;templates&quot; incorporating techniques like mindfulness, meditation, gentle movement and connecting with supportive communities. She also leads highly sought-after wellness retreats to Kenya where she immerses participants in restorative practices and cultural experiences.</p><p>Whether you&apos;re navigating divorce, redefining your identity after a major career shift, or simply seeking more balance in life, Wangari&apos;s wisdom will help. With compassion and an ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been-there-myself understanding,‚Äù she teaches practical ways to emerge from life‚Äôs difficulties stronger and more self-assured than ever before.¬†</p><p>If you‚Äôre facing a tough life transition, this episode was made for you.<br/><br/><b>About Wangari<br/></b>Wangari‚Äôs passion for working on wellness awareness came from two life-altering events, moments of profound upheaval that nudged her toward the path of healing and self-discovery. The first event was when she found the courage to raise my voice against unequal pay, facing intense backlash and dehumanizing treatment, which left me navigating the vast and intimidating ocean of emotional trauma alone. The second event was the end of my almost 30-year marriage, which left me standing at the precipice of my 50s, tasked with redefining my identity beyond what had always anchored me. From these earth-shattering experiences, I learned to piece together a new version of myself, stronger and more resilient.</p><p><b>Connect with Wangari<br/></b>You can connect with Wangari on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/wangari-kamau-gphr/'>Wangari Kamau</a> and follow her on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/allwell50plus/'>allwell50plus</a>.¬† You can learn more about the services and events that Wangari has to offer, visit her website at <a href='https://tembeyawellnessretreats.com/about/'>Tembeya Wellness Retreats</a>.¬† Wangari invites you to attend her <a href='https://tembeyawellnessretreats.com/kenya/'>Meditation Safari Retreat </a>to Kenya, primarily for Women above 50 from September 24 to October 3, 2024.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <title>Embracing Your Inner Compass: The Power of Intuitive Decision-Making with Fran Gallaher</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Have you ever experienced a moment when your gut feeling guided you to make a decision that logic couldn't explain?     <description><![CDATA[<p>Have you ever experienced a moment when your gut feeling guided you to make a decision that logic couldn&apos;t explain? Sit tight as I, Karen Covey, joined by Fran Gallaher, an intuitive leadership coach, explore the misunderstood yet fascinating world of intuition in decision-making. We unravel the intricate relationship between intuition, emotions, and logic, and why honoring your inner voice can be a powerful compass in navigating life&apos;s myriad choices.<br/><br/>From the mysterious instincts of animals to the silent whispers of our own hearts, this episode is brimming with stories that celebrate the wisdom of our subconscious. You&apos;ll hear about how my trusty dog Basil&apos;s instinctual behavior saved us during a storm, and how a spontaneous dessert choice led to unexpected joy at a women&apos;s retreat. Fran and I also provide actionable advice for those standing at life&apos;s crossroads, contemplating significant changes. We tackle the complex dance of aligning heart, mind, and gut in making choices that resonate with our true selves, especially within the realm of relationships.<br/><br/>Closing the conversation, we discuss the importance of being attuned to the signals our body sends us, especially during transitions in our personal lives. Every relationship is unique, and there&apos;s no universal remedy to marital challenges. Whether it&apos;s revitalizing a partnership or mustering the courage to walk away, we emphasize the vitality of listening to your body and prioritizing your well-being. Join us for this enlightening journey to more authentic and intuitive living, and may you find the courage to trust your own inner wisdom.<br/><b><br/>About Fran<br/></b>Fran Gallaher is an Intuitive Leadership Coach who helps leaders tune into, develop and use their intuition to inform their decisions to guide their work as a leader, from within as well as without.¬† Fran helps her clients understand that emotional intelligence and intuition‚Äîwhether you call it your gut feeling, your Spidey sense, or just that thing you feel or sense or simply know‚Äîis going to be required of a new generation of leaders.¬†</p><p>¬†As a child Fran saw and heard non-physical beings who offered her solace, guidance and protection. Fran says, they are with me now as they work with me to offer my clients a way forward out of confusion and frustration while they learn to trust themselves and their inner wisdom, experience increasing clarity, and she helps them embody the confidence and authority of their own true nature.</p><p><b>Connect with Fran<br/></b>You can connect with Fran on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/frangallaher/'>Fran Gallaher</a> or on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/reallyflourish/'>Really Flourish</a>.¬† You can also follow Fran on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/reallyflourish/'>Really</a> Flourish and check out Fran‚Äôs YouTube channel at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCF1CwIjAGpsHgm3kncOvkkw'>Fran Gallaher</a>.¬† To find out more about how to work with Fran visit her website at <a href='https://www.reallyflourish.com/'>Really Flourish</a>.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <itunes:title>Katy Mickelson: Can Pre and Post Nups Make Stronger Marriages?</itunes:title>
    <title>Katy Mickelson: Can Pre and Post Nups Make Stronger Marriages?</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Pre-Nups and Post-Nups are generally regarded as being manipulative and unromantic. But what if you could use prenups and postnups to make your marriage stronger? In this podcast episode, family law attorney Katy Mickelson pulls back the curtain on prenuptial and postnuptial agreements.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Pre-Nups and Post-Nups are generally regarded as being manipulative and unromantic. But what if you could use prenups and postnups to make your marriage stronger?</p><p>In this podcast episode, family law attorney Katy Mickelson pulls back the curtain on prenuptial and postnuptial agreements. She explains what they can and cannot cover, what they require, and how to create agreements that work. [HINT: This is NOT the place to go DIY!] She also dives deeply into who needs these agreements, and when entering into them not only makes sense but can actually help you save your marriage.</p><p>This episode is rich with practical advice, demystifying the belief that prenups and postnups are exclusively for the ultra-wealthy. Instead, we reveal their relevance to a wide range of individuals. Katy also highlights how these legal tools can provide a foundation of clarity and security for any marriage.<br/><br/><b>About Katy<br/></b>Katy is an Equity Partner at Beermann LLP where she practices exclusively in the area of family law. Katy provides guidance on a variety of complex family law related matters, from drafting and negotiating prenuptial agreements to protect wealth and assets to representing clients with significant means in divorce and parentage proceedings. Katy&apos;s typical clients are thought leaders, c-suite executives, industry rainmakers, and professionals with a preference for thoughtful and impactful strategy over ad hoc representation. Katy is a trial lawyer, but prioritizes settlement via mediation or negotiation if at all possible.¬†</p><p><b>Connect with Katy<br/></b>You can connect with Katy on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/katy-mickelson/'>Katy Mickelson</a> or on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/katymickelson/'>Katy Mickelson</a>.¬† You can also follow Katy on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/chicagodivorceattorney/'>Chicago Divorce Attorney</a> and check out Katy‚Äôs YouTube channel at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@chicagodivorceattorneykm'>@chicagodivorceattorneykm</a>.¬† To find out more about Beermann LLP please visit their website at <a href='https://www.beermannlaw.com/'>Beermann LLP</a>¬†or their Facebook page at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/BeermannLLP/'>Beermann LLP</a>.¬† You can also email Katy at khmickelson@beermannlaw.com or call at 847-681-9600.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Pre-Nups and Post-Nups are generally regarded as being manipulative and unromantic. But what if you could use prenups and postnups to make your marriage stronger?</p><p>In this podcast episode, family law attorney Katy Mickelson pulls back the curtain on prenuptial and postnuptial agreements. She explains what they can and cannot cover, what they require, and how to create agreements that work. [HINT: This is NOT the place to go DIY!] She also dives deeply into who needs these agreements, and when entering into them not only makes sense but can actually help you save your marriage.</p><p>This episode is rich with practical advice, demystifying the belief that prenups and postnups are exclusively for the ultra-wealthy. Katy also highlights how these legal tools can provide a foundation of clarity and security for any marriage.<br/><br/><b>About Katy<br/></b>Katy is an Equity Partner at Beermann LLP where she practices exclusively in the area of family law. Katy&apos;s typical clients are thought leaders, c-suite executives, industry rainmakers, and professionals with a preference for thoughtful and impactful strategy over ad hoc representation.     <title>How to Use EFT to Unlock Your Subconscious Blocks with Theresa Lear Levine</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Have you ever felt locked in a cycle of stress that you just can't seem to break free from?     <description><![CDATA[<p>Have you ever felt locked in a cycle of stress that you just can&apos;t seem to break free from? In this episode, Theresa Lear Levine shares a technique that could be your key to emotional liberation.¬†</p><p>As an EFT master practitioner and hypnotherapist, Theresa brings to light the transformative potential of Emotional Freedom Techniques (EFT) - a method that combines ancient Chinese acupressure and modern psychology to tap into our body&apos;s energy meridians.¬†</p><p>Research has shown that EFT has a profound effect on anxiety and physical ailments. It can also help individuals navigate life&apos;s transitions with a sense of empowerment.<br/>¬†<br/>¬†In the course of this discussion, Theresa peels back the layers of EFT tapping for emotional healing, demystifying the process and its impact. We explore how this technique can neutralize the emotional aftermath of traumatic experiences and lead to pathways of positive change, all while embracing negative emotions to foster authentic well-being. By asking &quot;what would it take,&quot; Theresa uncovers how we can engage our subconscious to manage emotions, especially during pivotal events like divorce.<br/><br/>Whether you&apos;re plagued by stress, overwhelm, or worry tapping offers a practical approach to overcoming your blocks and cultivating a sense of love, acceptance, and peace.<br/><br/><b>About Theresa</b><br/>Theresa&apos;s battles with past traumas, high-functioning anxiety, and ADHD trapped her in a recurring Groundhog Day of dis-ease, distraction, and dissatisfaction. A transformative pivot came when exhaustion, insomnia, and the struggle to be present in her own abundantly blessed life broke her down. ¬†</p><p>Driven to embrace life&apos;s potential and achieve aligned success, Theresa delved into decoding her nervous system, the law of attraction, and the subconscious mind. Through Emotional Freedom Techniques, Hypnotherapy, and a fresh perspective on energy and manifestation, Theresa swiftly shed negative emotions and expanded her consciousness. This restoration brought back calm, clarity, and confidence that became a foundation of success.¬†</p><p>Theresa‚Äôs Internationally best-selling book, &quot;<b>Becoming More Me: Tapping into Success - Subconscious Secrets of an ADHD Entrepreneurial Mom&quot;</b> , was born out of her passion to help other like-minded women on their quest to ditch anxiety, limiting beliefs, and past trauma.¬† <br/><br/><b>Connect with Theresa</b><br/>The best way to connect with Theresa is through Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/theresalearlevine'>theresalearlevine</a> or LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/theresalearlevine/'>Theresa Lear Levine</a>.¬† You can find out more about Theresa&apos;s services on her website at Theresa Lear Levine and explore her videos on her YouTube channel at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@theresalearlevine'>Theresa Lear Levine</a>.¬† You can also listen to Theresa&apos;s podcast <a href='https://becomingmoreme.com/'>Becoming More Me</a> and she welcomes you into her free community where she shares valuable resources and coaching at<a href='https://www.skool.com/becoming-more-me-community/about'> Becoming More Me Community</a>.<br/><br/><b>Watch now!</b><br/>You can also watch a tapping session with Karen and Theresa <a href='https://youtu.be/Dsm8A9dB9W0'></a></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Have you ever felt locked in a cycle of stress that you just can&apos;t seem to break free from? In this episode, Theresa Lear Levine shares a technique that could be your key to emotional liberation.¬†</p><p>As an EFT master practitioner and hypnotherapist, Theresa brings to light the transformative potential of Emotional Freedom Techniques (EFT) - a method that combines ancient Chinese acupressure and modern psychology to tap into our body&apos;s energy meridians.¬†</p><p>Research has shown that EFT has a profound effect on anxiety and physical ailments. It can also help individuals navigate life&apos;s transitions with a sense of empowerment.<br/>¬†<br/>¬†In the course of this discussion, Theresa peels back the layers of EFT tapping for emotional healing, demystifying the process and its impact. We explore how this technique can neutralize the emotional aftermath of traumatic experiences and lead to pathways of positive change, all while embracing negative emotions to foster authentic well-being.     <title>How to Find the Right Divorce Attorney: Ian Steinberg The Anti-Shark</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Think divorce lawyers intentionally stir the pot and create conflict to line their own pockets? Ian Steinberg is different.  As a top New York family law attorney Ian is on a mission to help people through one of life's most challenging transitions.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Think divorce lawyers intentionally stir the pot and create conflict to line their own pockets? Ian Steinberg is different.<br/><br/>As a top New York family law attorney Ian is on a mission to help people through one of life&apos;s most challenging transitions. Unlike some other divorce lawyers, Ian advocates for a team approach where divorce lawyers, divorce coaches, financial advisors and others collaborate to help clients achieve their goals as efficiently as possible.</p><p>He offers pragmatic advice on how clients can be effective team members themselves by maintaining organization, defining priorities, and working with their lawyer to achieve the result they want.<br/><br/></p><p>With nuanced wisdom honed from years of experience in litigation, mediation, and Collaborative Divorce, Ian makes a compelling case for divorcing spouses to take the driver&apos;s seat in their own divorce. His focus on reasonable, cost-effective resolutions demonstrates that the right divorce attorney can be a compassionate guide during turmoil rather than merely another adversary.¬†<br/><br/></p><p>For anyone who&apos;s looking to hire a divorce lawyer who can be reasonable, effective AND efficient,¬† Ian&apos;s perspective is a must-listen.<br/><br/></p><p><b>About Ian</b></p><p>Ian is a matrimonial and family law attorney with Berkman Bottger Newman &amp; Schein, LLP. His practice focuses on the litigation, mediation, negotiation, and settlement of complex high net worth matrimonial and family law cases. Ian also specializes in negotiating and drafting prenuptial and postnuptial agreements. Ian is formally trained in mediation and regularly mediates divorce and family law matters. Ian has also been trained in collaborative law and regularly represents clients who wish to engage in such a process.¬†<br/><br/></p><p><b>Connect with Ian</b></p><p>You can connect with Ian on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/iancraigsteinberg/'>Ian Craig Steinberg</a> or on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/BerkmanBottgerNewmanScheinLLP'>Berkman Bottger Newman &amp; Schein, LLP.</a>¬† To work with Ian and find out more about the law firm, visit their website at <a href='https://www.berkbot.com/attorneys/ian-steinberg/'>Berkman Bottger Newman &amp; Schein, LLP</a> or email Ian at isteinberg@berkbot.com¬†</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></description>

    <description><![CDATA[<p>How do you stay standing when life throws its toughest punches? Divorce coach and therapist Jenny Stevens has been through it all ... and mostly all at once!¬†</p><p>In this powerful episode, Jenny recounts how she survived divorce, cancer, the death of her mother, and then the death of her ex-husband, all within a few years. Jenny&apos;s life experiences sparked a profound realization - we cannot control what life brings, but we can control how we respond.¬†<br/><br/></p><p>With candor and practicality, Jenny outlines the habits and mindset shifts that empowered her to navigate this perfect storm with grace. You&apos;ll learn how to identify and reframe negative self-talk, design a morning routine that primes you for a positive day, and intentionally cultivate moments of joy amidst struggle.<br/><br/></p><p>Whether grappling with a difficult life transition or simply seeking to live with more purpose, Jenny&apos;s hard-won insights will inspire you.¬† Her contagious perspective reminds us that our circumstances don&apos;t define us - our decisions do.¬†<br/><br/></p><p><b>¬†About Jenny</b></p><p>Jenny is a licensed clinical counselor turned personal, professional, and divorce coach. Jenny specializes in helping people move through change positively.¬† Jenny is honest and approachable.¬† Her training as a professional counselor will challenge you to find purpose, take action, and keep your commitments - first and foremost to yourself! - in order to make positive changes in your life.<br/><br/></p><p>Jenny also supports adolescents going through the major change of becoming adults. She helps people - adults and adolescents alike - to face their fears,¬† create a plan, and then embrace life&apos;s changes with grace. In the process, Jenny also provides her clients with the support they need to make that change positively.<br/><br/></p><p>If you are seeking an energetic expert to manage change with positivity and personal experience, Jenny is your gal!<br/><br/></p><p><b>Connect with Jenny</b></p><p>You can connect with Jenny on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/jenny-stevens-1278404/'>Jenny Stevens</a> or on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/jennystevenscoach/'>Jenny Stevens Coach</a>. ¬† To find out how to work with Jenny visit her website at <a href='https://jennystevenscoach.com/'>Jenny Stevens Coach</a> and follow Jenny on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/jennystevens_coach/'>Jenny Stevens_Coach</a>.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <itunes:title>Chelsea Gajewski: How To Keep Anxiety From Derailing Divorce</itunes:title>
    <title>Chelsea Gajewski: How To Keep Anxiety From Derailing Divorce</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Anxiety, depression, and other mental health challenges often strain a marriage to the breaking point. Yet divorcing someone who struggles with mental health issues is fraught with its own challenges. Family law attorney Chelsea Gajewski works at the intersection of family law and mental health.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Anxiety, depression, and other mental health challenges often strain a marriage to the breaking point. Yet divorcing someone who struggles with mental health issues is fraught with its own challenges.</p><p>Family law attorney Chelsea Gajewski works at the intersection of family law and mental health.¬†<br/><br/>In this podcast episode, Chelsea explains how different divorce processes can make a difference in a divorce case in which mental health issues are involved. She candidly discusses the role professionals like parenting coordinators and guardians ad litem can have in helping families address mental health concerns in divorce.<br/><br/></p><p>If you or someone you know is dealing with a divorce where one (or both!) spouses suffers from anxiety, depression, or other mental health issues, this podcast episode can provide tools and strategies that will make their divorce journey easier.<br/><br/><b>About Chelsea</b></p><p>Chelsea is the Managing Attorney at Sodoma Law Belmont, where she leads a team of Family Law attorneys who serve the Gaston County, North Carolina community. Her legal practice focuses on custody, child support, alimony, equitable distribution and other family law related matters. Chelsea serves many different organizations including as the Chair of the Membership Committee for the Family Law Section of the North Carolina Bar Association (NCBA) and is a passionate advocate for children&apos;s rights as well an active member of the Gaston community and local Bar. Chelsea has received many accolades including Legal Elite and Super Lawyers Rising Star for consecutive years.</p><p>¬†<br/><b>Connect with Chelsea</b></p><p>You can connect with Chelsea on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/company/sodoma-law/'>Sodoma Law</a> or on Facebook at Sodoma Law.¬† You can follow Chelsea on her YouTube channel at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCi51C8Ks0u6xISNhixNKoMg'>Sodoma Law</a> and on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/thesodomaway/?hl=en'>The Sodoma Way</a>.¬† To find out how to work with Chelsea visit her at <a href='https://www.sodomalaw.com/'>Sodoma Law</a> website or email her at CGajewski@sodomalaw.com.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <itunes:title>Harnessing Intuition for Better Decision-Making with Veronica Drake</itunes:title>
    <title>Harnessing Intuition for Better Decision-Making with Veronica Drake</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Have you ever felt a gentle whisper in your soul, urging you to take a leap of faith that doesn‚Äôt seem logical in the moment?     <description><![CDATA[<p>Have you ever felt a gentle whisper in your soul, urging you to take a leap of faith that doesn‚Äôt seem logical in the moment? Veronica Drake, an intuitive coach, helps midlife female entrepreneurs reconnect with their inner voice so that they can make better decisions and find creative solutions to their business and personal problems.¬†</p><p>In this podcast episode, Veronica shares the story of her own leap of faith from a stable corporate gig to a path less traveled, guided by the whispers of intuition. Veronica unveils the intricate dance between intellect and intuition, shedding light on the societal conditioning that may have muted our intuitive senses.¬†<br/><br/></p><p>Veronica explains how to become attuned to the subtle signs of expansion and contraction that reveal our intuitive voice. She also describes how to use that voice in making daily choices, and shares actionable tips to rekindle the connection to our intuition, paving the way for personal and professional growth.<br/><br/><b>About Veronica</b></p><p>Veronica¬† helps creative, ambitious women entrepreneurs break through the barriers standing between them and the next level income. Veronica is NOT your ordinary business coach.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Are anger issues hijacking your relationships?     <description><![CDATA[<p>Understanding and navigating the financial end of divorce is one of the biggest challenges many divorcing people face. That financial portrait lays out different asset division scenarios that can be used in mediation, litigation, or other divorce proceedings.     <title>Locked in Battle with Your Ex? Karen Knab&#39;s Secrets to Winning at Conflict</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Karen Knab is not your average executive coach - she's a master at transforming conflict into constructive dialogue.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Karen Knab is not your average executive coach - she&apos;s a master at transforming conflict into constructive dialogue. Whether navigating the choppy waters of family drama or the boardroom&apos;s fierce currents, Karen&apos;s expertise helps you take back control and resolve your arguments with your ex, your kids, or your boss, more amicably.</p><p>Karen has cracked the code on managing the emotions that sabotage clear communication. Through her riveting stories and step-by-step strategies, you&apos;ll discover how to hit the pause button when you‚Äôre mired in a heated discussion so you can steer the conversation toward common ground.<br/><br/></p><p>From power struggles with your teenage son, to butting heads with a difficult colleague, to arguing with your ex, Karen&apos;s four-question formula will help you defuse even thorny conflicts with ease.<br/><br/><b>About Karen</b></p><p>Karen Knab is an executive leadership coach and conflict resolution expert. Her coaching focuses on turning ANY business owner into a confident and assertive leader, whether they lead people directly, or indirectly as solopreneurs. She also provides targeted conflict resolution services within leadership teams and business partnerships. She is also a former Marriage and Family Therapist and has walked through the divorce process with many clients.<br/><br/></p><p><b>Connect with Karen</b></p><p>You can connect with Karen on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karen-knab/'>Karen Knab</a> or on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/karen.knab'>Karen Knab</a>.¬† You can learn more about working with Karen on her website <a href='https://karenknab.com/'>Karen Knab</a> and book a complimentary discovery call <a href='https://calendly.com/knabconsulting/discovery-call'>here</a>.<br/><br/></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <title>Andrea Vacca on How to Use Collaborative Divorce to Reduce Drama</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Divorce doesn't have to be a battleground. Attorney Andrea Vacca has cracked the code on keeping families out of court and preserving their well-being throughout the divorce process.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Divorce doesn&apos;t have to be a battleground. Attorney Andrea Vacca has cracked the code on keeping families out of court and preserving their well-being throughout the divorce process. As a trailblazer in Collaborative Divorce and other alternative dispute resolution processes, Andrea‚Äôs approach is redefining what&apos;s possible when a marriage ends.</p><p>The traditional divorce litigation path is adversarial by nature, pitting spouses against each other in a zero-sum game. But Andrea has pioneered a paradigm shift - one where she and her team are committed to keeping their clients out of court.<br/><br/></p><p>This podcast episode provides an in-depth discussion of Collaborative Divorce and how the team approach it uses provides clients with more support while also dialing down the drama in their divorce. Our conversation provides a sneak peek into a more enlightened way of navigating one of life&apos;s most challenging crossroads.<br/><br/><b>About Andrea</b></p><p>Andrea Vacca is the founder of Vacca Family Law Group in New York City, a boutique law firm focused on non-adversarial divorce and family law matters. With a background in traditional divorce litigation, Andrea now exclusively helps clients find amicable divorce solutions outside of court.¬†<br/><br/></p><p>She is a widely recognized collaborative divorce attorney and mediator, former President of the New York Association of Collaborative Professionals, author of the book &quot;Divorce Without Court: A More Peaceful Solution&quot;, and creator and host of &quot;A Better Divorce Podcast&quot;. Andrea also holds a Certificate in Positive Psychology and regularly applies Positive Psychology principles to help her clients navigate divorce.<br/><br/></p><p><b>Connect with Andrea</b></p><p>You can connect with Andrea on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/AndreaVacca/'>Andrea Vacca</a> or on Facebook at<a href='http://Facebook.com/VaccaFamilyLaw'> Vacca Family Law</a>.¬† You can follow Andrea on her YouTube channel at<a href='https://www.youtube.com/@andreavaccanewyork'> Andrea Vacca New York Collaborative Divorce Lawyer</a> and on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/vacca_familylaw/'>Vacca_FamilyLaw</a>.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Erik Feig is an attorney, a mediator, and the father of three neurodivergent children.¬† Navigating through the COVID-19 pandemic with his own complex family inspired him to leave the practice of law and create a mediation practice focused on helping other families with neurodiverse children navigate conflict more effectively.</p><p>In this podcast episode, Erik explains ‚Äì both from personal experience as well as professional expertise - the tremendous amount of extra coordination and energy that families with neurodivergent kids require.¬† It‚Äôs not unusual for parents in such families to experience conflict in how to best manage the extra challenges they face.<br/><br/></p><p>Erik helps parents mediate those inevitable conflicts ‚Äì both in the context of divorce and in intact families.¬† He facilitates discussions to bridge divides and helps parents cooperate to meet their kids&apos; needs in a way that causes minimal disruption.</p><p>If you know any parents who have a neurodiverse child and are experiencing conflict in their family, this episode will open their eyes to new and effective ways to resolve that conflict and get the help and support they need.<br/><br/><b>About Erik</b></p><p>Erik Feig, a dedicated parent, mediator, and Certified Co-Parenting Specialist, specializes in supporting neurodivergent and special needs families. At Feig Mediation Group, he helps parents and families navigate important issues and decisions with empathy and understanding, whether they are separating, divorcing, or co-parenting after divorce. Drawing from his own journey as a parent in a neurodivergent family, he brings both personal experience and professional expertise to support other families with additional needs. He doesn‚Äôt just help parents find common ground, he helps them build bridges for a more hopeful and aligned future, benefiting both parents and children.<br/><br/></p><p><b>Connect with Erik</b></p><p>You can connect with Erik on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/erik-m-feig/'>Erik Feig</a> or on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/FeigMediationGroup'>Feig Mediation Group</a>.¬† You can learn more about working with Erik on the <a href='https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVC1GNypV9FRsS_mxVwF-Ew'>Feig Mediation Group</a> YouTube Channel or on the <a href='https://feigmediationgroup.com/'>Feig Mediation Group</a> website.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Lesa Koski - a lawyer turned mediator - has a passion for helping couples divorce differently and suffer less. In her work as a mediator, Lesa has identified 7 common dilemmas divorcing women face. <br/><br/>Those dilemmas range from finances to housing and from parenting to loneliness.¬† To deal with all of these dilemmas, Lesa encourages her clients to educate themselves about their options and about how the divorce process works.¬† She explains how mediation can be superior to litigation, and how it can be the first step in empowering someone to live a happier, healthier, and more empowered life after divorce.<br/><br/>While divorce is never easy, with the right mindset, education, and approach, divorce can be used as an opportunity for growth rather than simply as a sinkhole of pain.<br/><br/><b>About Lesa<br/></b>Lesa is a wife, a mama, a grandma and an animal lover. She feels blessed to be serving people from her barn office and is obsessed with learning and communication. Lesa is an attorney turned mediator with over 20 years of experience. She has a strong desire to help people through difficult situations. The burning desire to reach more people led to the creation of her podcast Doing Divorce Different!¬† Lesa is certified as a Life Coach by Self Made U.¬† As a Divorce Mediator,¬† Lesa walks clients through the divorce process with as much ease as possible. She offers one on one sessions and Divorce DIY Online Courses for a less expensive option where she will guide you through modules on¬† MN Divorce Paperwork and a Parenting Plan that can be used in any state.¬† <br/><br/><b>Connect with Lesa<br/></b>You can connect with Lesa on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/lesakoski/'>Lesa Koski</a>, Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/mediationspecialists1/'>Koski Law and Mediation, PLLC</a>, YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjgHhtPmlomgfqwmSrQ1Flw'>Lesa Koski Elder Law, Family Law and Mediation</a>.¬† Follow Lesa on X at <a href='https://twitter.com/i/flow/login?redirect_after_login=%2FLesaKoski'>Lesa Koski</a>, on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/koskilaw/'>koskilaw</a> and listen to her podcast <a href='https://www.lesakoski.com/podcasts/doing-divorce-differenta-podcast-guide-to-doing-divorce-differently'>Doing Divorce Different!</a> To learn more about working with Lesa and to access her DIY Online Course visit her website at <a href='https://www.lesakoski.com/'>Lesa Koski</a> and you can book a one on one session with Lesa <a href='https://calendly.com/lesa-koski/divorce-mediation-consultation-1?month=2024-03'>here</a>.¬† ¬†<br/><br/>Lesa is hosting Decoding Divorce Workshop in MN on April 25th from 9-1, for women who want to confidently navigate the legal and emotional aspects of divorce and beyond.¬† And to learn how to unlock confidence through divorce and navigate legal and emotional terrain.¬† To learn more about this event, email Lesa at <a href='mailto:lesa.koski@gmail.com'>lesa.koski@gmail.com</a>.</p><p>Lesa Koski &amp; You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></description>
    <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Lesa Koski - a lawyer turned mediator - has a passion for helping couples divorce differently and suffer less. In her work as a mediator, Lesa has identified 7 common dilemmas divorcing women face. <br/><br/>Those dilemmas range from finances to housing and from parenting to loneliness.¬† To deal with all of these dilemmas, Lesa encourages her clients to educate themselves about their options and about how the divorce process works.¬† She explains how mediation can be superior to litigation, and how it can be the first step in empowering someone to live a happier, healthier, and more empowered life after divorce.<br/><br/>While divorce is never easy, with the right mindset, education, and approach, divorce can be used as an opportunity for growth rather than simply as a sinkhole of pain.<br/><br/><b>About Lesa<br/></b>Lesa is a wife, a mama, a grandma and an animal lover. She feels blessed to be serving people from her barn office and is obsessed with learning and communication. Lesa is an attorney turned mediator with over 20 years of experience. She has a strong desire to help people through difficult situations. The burning desire to reach more people led to the creation of her podcast Doing Divorce Different!¬† Lesa is certified as a Life Coach by Self Made U.¬† As a Divorce Mediator,¬† Lesa walks clients through the divorce process with as much ease as possible. She offers one on one sessions and Divorce DIY Online Courses for a less expensive option where she will guide you through modules on¬† MN Divorce Paperwork and a Parenting Plan that can be used in any state.¬† <br/><br/><b>Connect with Lesa<br/></b>You can connect with Lesa on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/lesakoski/'>Lesa Koski</a>, Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/mediationspecialists1/'>Koski Law and Mediation, PLLC</a>, YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjgHhtPmlomgfqwmSrQ1Flw'>Lesa Koski Elder Law, Family Law and Mediation</a>.¬† Follow Lesa on X at <a href='https://twitter.com/i/flow/login?redirect_after_login=%2FLesaKoski'>Lesa Koski</a>, on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/koskilaw/'>koskilaw</a> and listen to her podcast <a href='https://www.lesakoski.com/podcasts/doing-divorce-differenta-podcast-guide-to-doing-divorce-differently'>Doing Divorce Different!</a> To learn more about working with Lesa and to access her DIY Online Course visit her website at <a href='https://www.lesakoski.com/'>Lesa Koski</a> and you can book a one on one session with Lesa <a href='https://calendly.com/lesa-koski/divorce-mediation-consultation-1?month=2024-03'>here</a>.¬† ¬†<br/><br/>Lesa is hosting Decoding Divorce Workshop in MN on April 25th from 9-1, for women who want to confidently navigate the legal and emotional aspects of divorce and beyond.¬† And to learn how to unlock confidence through divorce and navigate legal and emotional terrain.¬† To learn more about this event, email Lesa at <a href='mailto:lesa.koski@gmail.com'>lesa.koski@gmail.com</a>.</p><p>Lesa Koski &amp;     <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Amy Lin was married for 20 months. Her divorce took 3 years.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Amy Lin was married for 20 months. Her divorce took 3 years. Most of that time was spent wrangling through the arcane, time-consuming, and inefficient &quot;discovery process&quot; in the legal system. <br/><br/>After her divorce was over, Amy decided to create a software platform to make the financial discovery process more efficient and affordable so that no one had to suffer through what she suffered through in her divorce.¬† That&apos;s why she created Anew.<br/><br/>Anew simplifies and streamlines financial discovery in divorce cases. It provides couples with an overview of their net worth and contains income/expense reports, balance sheets, and tools to help couples calculate home equity splits.¬† All of this is designed to¬† make the divorce process less complicated, less painful, and more transparent.<br/><br/>If your divorce seems to be stalled out in the legal discovery process, this podcast episode is for you. <br/><br/><b>About Amy<br/></b>Amy is the Founder and CEO of Anew, a tech platform making family law more efficient and affordable for everyday Americans. Anew simplifies the complex legal process into a guided experience paired with financial analysis, form filing services and on-demand consultations with vetted experts. Before founding Anew, Amy spent 13 years building teams and products from 0 to 1 in financial services and healthcare. She also went through a 3-year divorce, which put her through the firsthand experience of the pain points in family law.</p><p><b>Connect with Amy<br/></b>You can connect with Amy on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/groups/1276087393044966/'>Divorce Finance</a>.¬† To learn more about Anew, visit Amy‚Äôs website <a href='https://www.loveanew.co/'>Anew</a> and for a limited time click on <a href='https://www.loveanew.co/accessdivorce'>Anew&apos;s Beta Product</a> to gain free access.¬†</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Amy Lin was married for 20 months. Her divorce took 3 years. Most of that time was spent wrangling through the arcane, time-consuming, and inefficient &quot;discovery process&quot; in the legal system. <br/><br/>After her divorce was over, Amy decided to create a software platform to make the financial discovery process more efficient and affordable so that no one had to suffer through what she suffered through in her divorce.¬† That&apos;s why she created Anew.<br/><br/>Anew simplifies and streamlines financial discovery in divorce cases. It provides couples with an overview of their net worth and contains income/expense reports, balance sheets, and tools to help couples calculate home equity splits.¬† All of this is designed to¬† make the divorce process less complicated, less painful, and more transparent.<br/><br/>If your divorce seems to be stalled out in the legal discovery process, this podcast episode is for you. <br/><br/><b>About Amy<br/></b>Amy is the Founder and CEO of Anew, a tech platform making family law more efficient and affordable for everyday Americans.     <title>Michael Cohen on Creating Better Outcomes Through Divorce Mediation</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[When divorce looms, people usually focus on the assets and finances first. But to divorce mediator Michael Cohen, the kids should always come first.     <description><![CDATA[<p>When divorce looms, people usually focus on the assets and finances first. But to divorce mediator Michael Cohen, the kids should always come first.</p><p>Michael&apos;s own contentious divorce fueled his metamorphosis from corporate executive to passionate divorce mediator. As a mediator, Michael helps parents create co-parenting agreements centered on their kids&apos; emotional health.¬†<br/><br/></p><p>In this podcast episode, we dig deeply into the way that the adversarial process fundamentally clashes with preserving family bonds. Litigation pits spouses against each other with dueling attorneys battling over assets. Mediation offers a paradigm shift - bringing both parties together with a neutral facilitator to find mutually agreeable resolutions to their divorce issues.<br/><br/></p><p>If you‚Äôre interested in mediating your divorce you‚Äôll discover a wealth of practical information in this episode, including:</p><p>1.¬† ¬† ¬†The average cost of mediation versus litigation;</p><p>2.¬† ¬† ¬†The opportunities afforded by digital mediation;</p><p>3.¬† ¬† ¬†The way that mediation can preserve family connections, even in a divorce;</p><p>‚Ä¶ and more.</p><p>¬†If you‚Äôre even thinking about using mediation in your divorce, this podcast episode will provide you with a wealth of information and practical tips.<br/><br/><b>About Michael</b></p><p>Michael is a former corporate executive who went through a litigated divorce and vowed to transition his career to divorce mediation as a result. He saw firsthand the impact of a litigated divorce on his own children, and he vowed to help other families get through a divorce in a more amicable way, with good co-parents, so the family could remain connected as a family, just in a different way. Michael has his CPA and is very adept at helping couples with the financial decisions they need to make during and after their divorce, but his passion is working with parents and helping them to divorce while building a strong co-parent relationship. Michael cares, is passionate about helping others, understands what they are going through, and is driven to help them divorce in a healthy way at a significantly lower cost than litigation.<br/><br/></p><p>¬†<b>Connect with Michael</b></p><p>You can connect with Michael on LinkedIn at <a href='http://www.linkedin.com/in/michaelsmediation'>Michael‚Äôs Mediation</a> at Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/MichaelsMediation/'>Michael‚Äôs Mediation</a> and follow Michael on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/michaelsmediation/'>Michaels‚Äô Mediation</a>. You can learn more about how divorce mediation services for you and your family visit Michael‚Äôs website at <a href='https://michaelsmediation.com/'>Michael‚Äôs Mediation</a>.<br/><br/>To listen to the episode on Kathleen Brigham&apos;s Unique Bird-Nesting Life<a href='https://karencovy.com/podcast-kathleen-brigham-bird-nesting/'> click here</a>.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>When divorce looms, people usually focus on the assets and finances first. But to divorce mediator Michael Cohen, the kids should always come first.</p><p>Michael&apos;s own contentious divorce fueled his metamorphosis from corporate executive to passionate divorce mediator. As a mediator, Michael helps parents create co-parenting agreements centered on their kids&apos; emotional health.¬†<br/><br/></p><p>In this podcast episode, we dig deeply into the way that the adversarial process fundamentally clashes with preserving family bonds. Litigation pits spouses against each other with dueling attorneys battling over assets. Mediation offers a paradigm shift - bringing both parties together with a neutral facilitator to find mutually agreeable resolutions to their divorce issues.<br/><br/></p><p>If you‚Äôre interested in mediating your divorce you‚Äôll discover a wealth of practical information in this episode, including:</p><p>1.¬† ¬† ¬†The average cost of mediation versus litigation;</p><p>2.¬† ¬† ¬†The opportunities afforded by digital mediation;</p><p>3.¬† ¬† ¬†The way that mediation can preserve family connections, even in a divorce;</p><p>‚Ä¶ and more.</p><p>¬†If you‚Äôre even thinking about using mediation in your divorce, this podcast episode will provide you with a wealth of information and practical tips.<br/><br/><b>About Michael</b></p><p>Michael is a former corporate executive who went through a litigated divorce and vowed to transition his career to divorce mediation as a result. He saw firsthand the impact of a litigated divorce on his own children, and he vowed to help other families get through a divorce in a more amicable way, with good co-parents, so the family could remain connected as a family, just in a different way. Michael has his CPA and is very adept at helping couples with the financial decisions they need to make during and after their divorce, but his passion is working with parents and helping them to divorce while building a strong co-parent relationship. Michael cares, is passionate about helping others, understands what they are going through, and is driven to help them divorce in a healthy way at a significantly lower cost than litigation.<br/><br/></p><p>¬†<b>Connect with Michael</b></p><p>You can connect with Michael on LinkedIn at <a href='http://www.linkedin.com/in/michaelsmediation'>Michael‚Äôs Mediation</a> at Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/MichaelsMediation/'>Michael‚Äôs Mediation</a> and follow Michael on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/michaelsmediation/'>Michaels‚Äô Mediation</a>.     <itunes:title>From Heartbreak to Triumph: Navigating Legal Abuse in Divorce with Lisa Johnson</itunes:title>
    <title>From Heartbreak to Triumph: Navigating Legal Abuse in Divorce with Lisa Johnson</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[In this episode, Lisa Johnson, co-founder of Been There Got Out, shares her story of going through a high-conflict divorce with an emotionally abusive husband who lived a secret double life. Lisa's divorce ultimately cost her over $80,000 in legal fees to resolve - and that was just the beginning of her legal journey.  Lisa then spent 10 years fighting to enforce her divorce judgment after she was divorced. Because she couldn't afford a lawyer, Lisa learned how to navigate the legal system he...]]></itunes:summary>
    <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode, Lisa Johnson, co-founder of Been There Got Out, shares her story of going through a high-conflict divorce with an emotionally abusive husband who lived a secret double life. Lisa&apos;s divorce ultimately cost her over $80,000 in legal fees to resolve - and that was just the beginning of her legal journey.<br/><br/>Lisa then spent 10 years fighting to enforce her divorce judgment after she was divorced. Because she couldn&apos;t afford a lawyer, Lisa learned how to navigate the legal system herself, while her ex fought her every step of the way. She coined the term &quot;legal abuse&quot; to describe what happens when someone weaponizes the legal system to control, harass, intimidate, and impoverish their ex-spouse. <br/><br/>Lisa now works to educate and support others who are embroiled in abusive, high-conflict legal situations so that, they too, can take control of their case, without going bankrupt in the process.<br/><br/><b>About Lisa<br/></b>Lisa is the co-founder of Been There Got Out.¬† Lisa and her partner Chris offer a weekly Legal Abuse Support Group for those dealing with narcissistic opponents in legal matters. Their book, &quot;<a href='https://www.amazon.com/Been-There-Got-Relationships-Circumstances/dp/194627495X/ref=sr_1_1?crid=13USNDKD5PKXJ&amp;dib=eyJ2IjoiMSJ9.fmA-F8u86eQvcHRVZY-ZI7B-xMWmz3ab7wWxYxgNjwagJPeWfgLHrHBRlzjwLMVqDFqXNWOnxm32Bl1cd5oM682gSAAX6SqUXxbQXKHJR6ll-d-cw7C4v54e6PTyJMC4OWWi9fY6MzMTJdVu2_SFHReq6wVdmev0ifHsioLlNdfrA5o3Cw1bj1ihhH2VjaWZgdXlDeqDevo88Jl6XmU6lbhwexRfLQ2mGUi12_v38q4.k6UeuvKBUhac1S8hgKHx1aQLYWQx-7rK0572zkdudrs&amp;dib_tag=se&amp;keywords=been+there+got+out+book&amp;qid=1708060129&amp;sprefix=been+there+got+out%2Caps%2C149&amp;sr=8-1'>Been There Got Out: Toxic Relationships, High-Conflict Divorce, and How to Stay Sane Under Insane Circumstances</a>&apos;&apos; was released in March 2023.¬† ¬†</p><p><b>Connect with Lisa</b><br/>You can connect with Lisa on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/company/been-there-got-out/'>Been There Got Out</a> or her Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/BeenThereGotOut'>Been There Got Out</a>.¬† You can also find Lisa on YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@BeenThereGotOut'>Been There Got Out</a>, listen to her Podcast <a href='https://beentheregotout.buzzsprout.com/'>Been There Got Out</a> and follow her on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/been_there_got_out/'>Been There Got Out</a>, TikTok at <a href='https://www.tiktok.com/@been_there_got_out'>@been_there_got_out</a> and Twitter at <a href='https://twitter.com/BeenThereGotOut'>BeenThereGotOut</a>.¬† To learn more about working with Lisa visit her website at <a href='https://beentheregotout.com/'>Been There Got Out</a> where you can also sign up for her newsletter to keep informed of her upcoming events and her upcoming FREE webinar on what parental alienation / coercive control / abuse by proxy / poisoning the well looks like‚Ä¶and what you can do about it.¬† The best way to contact Lisa is by email at Lisa@beentheregotout.com.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></description>
    <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this episode, Lisa Johnson, co-founder of Been There Got Out, shares her story of going through a high-conflict divorce with an emotionally abusive husband who lived a secret double life. Lisa&apos;s divorce ultimately cost her over $80,000 in legal fees to resolve - and that was just the beginning of her legal journey.<br/><br/>Lisa then spent 10 years fighting to enforce her divorce judgment after she was divorced. Because she couldn&apos;t afford a lawyer, Lisa learned how to navigate the legal system herself, while her ex fought her every step of the way. She coined the term &quot;legal abuse&quot; to describe what happens when someone weaponizes the legal system to control, harass, intimidate, and impoverish their ex-spouse. <br/><br/>Lisa now works to educate and support others who are embroiled in abusive, high-conflict legal situations so that, they too, can take control of their case, without going bankrupt in the process.<br/><br/><b>About Lisa<br/></b>Lisa is the co-founder of Been There Got Out.¬† Lisa and her partner Chris offer a weekly Legal Abuse Support Group for those dealing with narcissistic opponents in legal matters. Their book, &quot;<a href='https://www.amazon.com/Been-There-Got-Relationships-Circumstances/dp/194627495X/ref=sr_1_1?crid=13USNDKD5PKXJ&amp;dib=eyJ2IjoiMSJ9.fmA-F8u86eQvcHRVZY-ZI7B-xMWmz3ab7wWxYxgNjwagJPeWfgLHrHBRlzjwLMVqDFqXNWOnxm32Bl1cd5oM682gSAAX6SqUXxbQXKHJR6ll-d-cw7C4v54e6PTyJMC4OWWi9fY6MzMTJdVu2_SFHReq6wVdmev0ifHsioLlNdfrA5o3Cw1bj1ihhH2VjaWZgdXlDeqDevo88Jl6XmU6lbhwexRfLQ2mGUi12_v38q4.k6UeuvKBUhac1S8hgKHx1aQLYWQx-7rK0572zkdudrs&amp;dib_tag=se&amp;keywords=been+there+got+out+book&amp;qid=1708060129&amp;sprefix=been+there+got+out%2Caps%2C149&amp;sr=8-1'>Been There Got Out: Toxic Relationships, High-Conflict Divorce, and How to Stay Sane Under Insane Circumstances</a>&apos;&apos; was released in March 2023.¬† ¬†</p><p><b>Connect with Lisa</b><br/>You can connect with Lisa on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/company/been-there-got-out/'>Been There Got Out</a> or her Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/BeenThereGotOut'>Been There Got Out</a>.¬† You can also find Lisa on YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@BeenThereGotOut'>Been There Got Out</a>, listen to her Podcast <a href='https://beentheregotout.buzzsprout.com/'>Been There Got Out</a> and follow her on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/been_there_got_out/'>Been There Got Out</a>, TikTok at <a href='https://www.tiktok.com/@been_there_got_out'>@been_there_got_out</a> and Twitter at <a href='https://twitter.com/BeenThereGotOut'>BeenThereGotOut</a>.¬† To learn more about working with Lisa visit her website at <a href='https://beentheregotout.com/'>Been There Got Out</a> where you can also sign up for her newsletter to keep informed of her upcoming events and her upcoming FREE webinar on what parental alienation / coercive control / abuse by proxy / poisoning the well looks like‚Ä¶and what you can do about it.¬† The best way to contact Lisa is by email at Lisa@beentheregotout.com.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.
