    <description><![CDATA[<p>Bela Gandhi, Chicago‚Äôs most prominent dating and relationship expert, joins the Off the Fence Podcast to share her tips and tools for creating a lasting and fulfilling relationship. In this podcast episode, Bela peels back the curtain on her transition from the corporate world into the arena of love and relationships. She also reveals some of the secrets she imparts to her clients in the Smart Dating Academy ‚Ä¶ which has a zero-divorce rate among clients who marry the love they found while working with Bela and her team.</p><p>Bela describes the process her team uses to help their clients understand what they need in a relationship and to create a plan for finding the right relationship through online dating, meeting people in real life, and getting set up on dates by friends.¬† Bela talks about the way to create an online dating profile that showcases your strongest assets and gives you the best chance of attracting the love you really want.¬†</p><p>Whether you‚Äôre looking for love, or just want to jump back into the dating pool, this is a podcast episode you‚Äôre not going to want to miss <br/><br/><b>About Bela<br/></b>Bela Gandhi is a dating/relationship expert, TEDx speaker, founder of Smart Dating Academy and has been featured on most national/local media outlets including Good Morning America, Steve Harvey, the Today Show, Kelly Clarkson, Access, ABC, NBC, Fox, and more. After she graduated from the University of Illinois in Urbana/Champaign, Gandhi worked in mergers and acquisitions for a year before joining her family&apos;s chemicals manufacturing company, where she divided her time between Chicago and Europe helping to expand the business. When the Gandhi family sold its business to Fortune 500 company Akzo Nobel, she was asked to remain its leader. But even as she quickly climbed the corporate ladder, Gandhi had a feeling that her career would one day be taking a sharp turn in a different direction ‚Äì because she discovered her love of matchmaking and providing dating advice. She launched her Smart Dating Academy in 2009. Smart Dating Academy has quickly become one of the nation&apos;s top date coaching firms - and teaches busy, successful professionals to jump start their dating lives successfully.</p><p>¬†</p><p><b>Connect with Bela</b></p><p>You can connect with Bela on her LinkedIn page at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/bela-gandhi-64b88812/'>Bela Gandhi</a> or her Facebook page at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/smartdatingacademy'>Smart Dating Academy</a>.¬† You can find Bela on YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/user/smartdatingacademy'>Smart Dating Academy</a> and follow Bela on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/smartdatingacademy/'>Smart Dating Academy</a> or Twitter at <a href='https://twitter.com/i/flow/login?redirect_after_login=%2Fbelagandhilove'>Bela Gandhi Love</a>.¬† To learn more about Bela‚Äôs dating academy visit her website at <a href='https://www.smartdatingacademy.com/'>Smart Dating Academy</a>.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Bela Gandhi, Chicago‚Äôs most prominent dating and relationship expert, joins the Off the Fence Podcast to share her tips and tools for creating a lasting and fulfilling relationship. In this podcast episode, Bela peels back the curtain on her transition from the corporate world into the arena of love and relationships.     <title>Navigating Love and Entrepreneurship with Franchise Expert Meg Schmitz</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Navigating the intertwined paths of love and entrepreneurship can be as complex as a Brazilian Tango.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Navigating the intertwined paths of love and entrepreneurship can be as complex as a Brazilian Tango. But Meg Schmitz is an expert who shares the secrets to building BOTH a flourishing relationship AND a successful business.<br/><br/>In this podcast episode, Meg opens up about her own complex journey, which began when her then-husband purchased a franchise (without her consent) in an industry he knew nothing about. Six months later when his business was failing, Meg jumped in, took over, and turned the business around.<br/><br/>Unfortunately, she wasn&apos;t able to turn the marriage around and she ultimately got a divorce.¬† But the lessons she learned running this and other businesses became the foundation for her franchise consulting expertise. Today, she coaches other couples who are considering buying a franchise on how they can operate both a successful business and maintain a thriving marriage as well.<br/><br/>While we talk a lot about entrepreneurship and business, this episode is really about so much more. it&apos;s about the partnerships (both business and personal) that we choose to nurture and the lives we strive to create.<br/><br/><b>About Meg<br/></b>Meg Schmitz is a franchise consultant, business owner, employer, podcaster and author. Her background includes a counseling degree from Northwestern, where she studied relationship dynamics. As a coach who helps couples get into business, she is acutely aware of the impact of business ownership on a marriage, having been divorced because of faulty alignment and missed expectations. Her point of view is based on reality, and keeping a relationship that works... working!</p><p><b>Connect with Meg</b>¬†</p><p>You can connect with Meg on her LinkedIn page at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/megschmitz/'>Meg Schmitz</a>, her LinkedIn business page at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/company/thefranchiseguru/'>The Franchise Guru</a>, on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/meg.schmitz1/'>Meg Schmitz</a> and on her Facebook business page at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/Franchise.Guru.Meg.Schmitz'>Meg Schmitz Franchise Consultant</a>.¬† You can find Meg on YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@MegSchmitz'>Meg Schmitz Franchise Guru</a>, follow Meg on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/schmitzmeg/'>Meg Schmitz</a> and Twitter at <a href='https://twitter.com/Guru_Franchise'>Guru Franchise</a>.¬† To learn more about franchising and how to work with Meg visit her website at <a href='https://megschmitz.com/'>Meg Schmitz</a> and tune into her podcast <a href='https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/free-agent-with-meg-schmitz/id1645355533'>Free Agent with Meg Schmitz</a> where her guests share their own inspiring stories about Taking The Leap into business ownership, and discovering a sense of flexibility and freedom they don&apos;t get in their careers.<br/><br/></p><p>The best way to connect with Meg is via LinkedIn or text at 847-302-2601.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Karen McMahon understands the challenges of high-conflict divorce. After surviving her own divorce from an emotionally abusive ex-husband, Karen turned to coaching others on how to deal with the complex emotions and dynamics of high-conflict divorce and co-parenting more effectively.</p><p>In this podcast episode, Karen describes how she helps her clients build confidence, establish boundaries, and remain focused on their own healing and emotional growth. She also explains how, with proper support,¬† a parent can use the pain of a high-conflict divorce to fuel positive growth for themselves and their family. <br/><br/>Karen&apos;s insight will help anyone dealing with a high-conflict situation manage their emotions and build resilience in the process.¬† Karen&apos;s advice provides hope and perspective for anyone dealing with a high-conflict spouse or former spouse.<br/><br/><b>About Karen</b></p><p>In the realm of divorce and relationship coaching, Karen emerges as a true luminary, specializing in the complex arena of high conflict divorce. With unwavering determination and a heart full of empathy, Karen&apos;s expertise shines brightest when guiding individuals through the tumultuous storms of high conflict situations. Her signature approach addresses the internal intricacies of intense emotions, fixed mindset and unconscious behaviors along with external complexities of legal approaches, financial awareness and co-parenting hurdles, ensuring that her clients emerge both victorious and transformed.</p><p>¬†</p><p><b>Connect with Karen</b></p><p>You can connect with Karen on her LinkedIn page at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karenmcmahon/'>Karen McMahon</a> on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenMcMahon13'>Karen McMahon</a> and her Facebook business page at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/journeybeyonddivorce/'>Journey Beyond Divorce</a>.¬† You can find Karen on YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwBFif3L2M_Zn3lxl8AU8og'>Journey Beyond Divorce</a>, follow Karen on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/journey_beyond_divorce/'>Journey_Beyond_Divorce</a> and learn more about Karen‚Äôs work on her website <a href='https://www.jbddivorcesupport.com/'>Journey Beyond Divorce</a>.¬† The best way to contact Karen is through Instagram or email her at <a href='mailto:admin@journeybeyonddivorce.com'>admin@journeybeyonddivorce.com</a>.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Living with a narcissist is hard. Divorcing a narcissist is even harder.¬† Tracy Malone, the powerhouse behind NarcissistAbuseSupport.com,¬† knows firsthand how ugly divorcing a narcissist can be.¬† In this podcast episode Tracy opens up about her personal journey of divorcing a narcissist, including the manipulative behavior, gaslighting, and abusive litigation tactics that went with it.<br/><br/>Her experiences prompted her to become a divorce coach who specializes in helping the victims of narcissistic abuse all over the world.</p><p>In this episode Tracy explains what a narcissist is, and how to know whether you&apos;re divorcing one. She explores the pattern of behavior that characterizes a narcissist, from love-bombing to exhibiting a lack of empathy to acting in ways that devalue you as a person.¬† ¬†</p><p>If you suspect that your &quot;difficult divorce&quot; is being caused by a narcissistic spouse, this episode will open your eyes to the realities of narcissistic abuse and give you both the emotional empowerment and practical tools you need to get through your divorce with more confidence so that you can start your new life on the other side.</p><p><br/><b>About Tracy</b> <br/>Tracy Malone is an International     <itunes:title>Divorce Inside Out: Kathleen Brigham&#39;s Unique Bird-Nesting Life</itunes:title>
    <title>Divorce Inside Out: Kathleen Brigham&#39;s Unique Bird-Nesting Life</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[When Kathleen Brigham and her husband divorced, they did something most parents never do ‚Äì they ‚Äúbird nested.‚Äù  What‚Äôs more, not only did they bird nest during their divorce, but they continued to rotate in and out of their family home for years after their divorce, all while their children stayed put.  In this podcast episode, Kathleen Brigham walks us through her personal bird nesting journey, providing a profound insight into the practicalities and nuances of this co-parenting strateg...]]></itunes:summary>
    <description><![CDATA[<p>When Kathleen Brigham and her husband divorced, they did something most parents never do ‚Äì they ‚Äúbird nested.‚Äù¬† What‚Äôs more, not only did they bird nest during their divorce, but they continued to rotate in and out of their family home for years after their divorce, all while their children stayed put.<br/><br/>In this podcast episode, Kathleen Brigham walks us through her personal bird nesting journey, providing a profound insight into the practicalities and nuances of this co-parenting strategy. We talk about where parents stay when they&apos;re not with their kids, how to structure bird nesting for success, and how this arrangement can bring stability for kids during a challenging transition.</p><p>If you‚Äôve ever wondered whether bird nesting was a viable co-parenting option in your divorce, this podcast episode is for you. It dives deeply into what bird nesting is, what you need to do to make it work, and how to decide whether it‚Äôs truly for you ‚Ä¶ or not.<br/><br/><b>About Kathleen</b></p><p>Kathleen Brigham graduated from Middlebury College and has a Master&apos;s from Columbia Teacher&apos;s College. She completed her divorce mediation certification from The Center for Mediation and Training. Kathleen created Brigham Advising after going through her own divorce and finding it difficult to map a productive path between tough talking lawyers, well-meaning therapists and supportive but uneasy friends and family. Kathleen‚Äôs advising is designed to be a catalyst to creating a personal divorce plan, with or without nesting, and to accelerate the path to resolution and peace.</p><p>¬†</p><p><b>Connect with Kathleen</b></p><p>You can learn more about Kathleen and her work on her website <a href='https://www.brighamlearning.com/'>Brigham Learning</a>.¬† You can connect with Kathleen on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/kathleen-brigham-05526b56/'>Kathleen Brigham</a>, on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/brighamlearning/'>Brigham Learning</a> and on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/brighamlearning/'>Brigham Learning</a>.¬† Kathleen‚Äôs book, co-written with her current husband, Chris Dugan, ‚Äú<a href='https://www.amazon.com/Nesting-Experiment-Divorces-Uncomfortable-Cohabitation/dp/B0B14JLLX3'><em>The Nesting Experiment</em></a>‚Äù is available on Amazon.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></description>

    <description><![CDATA[<ul><li><b>Have you ever felt stuck in indecision and trapped in a life you no longer want to live?¬†</b></li><li><b>Have you hesitated to get a divorce because you KNOW how ugly your toxic spouse will make it?</b></li><li><b>Are you worried about getting a divorce and starting all over again &quot;at your age&quot;? ( ... i.e. when you&apos;re over 50!)</b></li><li><b>Have you suffered from trauma in your marriage and wonder if you&apos;ll ever be able to trust again?</b></li><li><b>Have you wondered whether you&apos;ll ever find love again after your divorce, or what getting a divorce will do to your relationship with your adult kids?</b></li></ul><p>Our 50th-anniversary episode addresses these issues, answers these questions, and provides insights you can trust.<br/><br/>In this episode, you&apos;ll find clips of the best advice given by our most popular guests about decision-making, divorce, and more.¬† <br/><br/><a href='https://karencovy.com/podcast-lin-schussler-williams-better-decisions/'><b>Lin Schussler-Williams</b></a> shares 9 little words that will help you break free from old patterns and make better decisions, no matter how difficult they may be.<br/><br/><a href='https://karencovy.com/podcast-holly-herzog-toxic-relationships/'><b>Holly Herzog</b></a> explains how to navigate toxic relationships and decide whether (or when!) to leave.<br/><br/><a href='https://karencovy.com/podcast-andrew-hatherley-gray-divorce/'><b>Andrew Hatherley </b></a>talks about the &quot;grey divorce&quot; phenomenon, and how you can create an amazing life after divorce - even when you&apos;re over 50.<br/><br/><a href='https://karencovy.com/podcast-bethany-dotson-heal-from-trauma/'><b>Bethany Dotson</b></a> reveals how you can heal from trauma and create positive relationships.<br/><br/><a href='https://karencovy.com/podcast-dave-moravec/'><b>Dave Moravec</b></a> rounds out the episode with a lively discussion about how you can maintain a relationship with your adult children during and after divorce, and how you can find love again no matter your age.<br/><br/>No matter what decision you&apos;re struggling with, or where you&apos;re at in your divorce journey, this special 50th episode of Off the Fence has something for you.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <itunes:title>What&#39;s Your Soul Salary? Finding Your Joy with Jessica Kaskov</itunes:title>
    <title>What&#39;s Your Soul Salary? Finding Your Joy with Jessica Kaskov</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[For 15 years Jessica Kaskov worked as an engineer in a manufacturing company. When the company announced layoffs, Jessica did some deep soul searching. She realized that, while she was good at engineering, her real passion came from working with people. Jessica‚Äôs quest ultimately led her to discover the idea of a ‚ÄúSoul Salary...]]></itunes:summary>
    <description><![CDATA[<p>For 15 years Jessica Kaskov worked as an engineer in a manufacturing company. When the company announced layoffs, Jessica did some deep soul searching. She realized that, while she was good at engineering, her real passion came from working with people. <br/><br/>Even though Jessica ultimately survived that round of layoffs, she began searching for work that would do more than just pay the bills. It would provide her with joy.<br/><br/>Jessica‚Äôs quest ultimately led her to discover the idea of a ‚ÄúSoul Salary.‚Äù Your soul salary is the value your soul receives when your time and energy are in alignment with what feels joyous to you.<br/><br/>After discovering this concept, Jessica ‚Äúturned the dimmer switch‚Äù off her engineering career as she turned it on to a new career as a life coach. Today, Jessica helps her clients do the same by aiding them in overcoming the obstacles and limiting beliefs that are holding them back so that they can create the career and life they truly want. <br/><br/>If you‚Äôre at a crossroads in your life, whether that be in your career, marriage, relationships or any other part of your life, Jessica‚Äôs system for finding your ‚ÄúSoul Salary‚Äù will help you get clear on your direction and create a life that feeds your soul.<br/><br/><b>About Jessica <br/></b>Jess Kaskov is a #1 Bestselling author, speaker, life coach, and thought leader who inspires the world to profound joy and fulfillment. She left her successful, fifteen-year engineering career at a Fortune 500 company to start her own business (Joyfulness with Jess), trading her hard hats for headbands. Today, she does what she feels called to do‚Äîmotivating and supporting others. She lives in the suburbs of Chicago with her encouraging husband, two active sons, and two lazy cats.</p><p><b>Connect with Jessica<br/></b>You can connect with Jessica on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=1930971'>Jessica Kaskov</a>, on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/jessica-kaskov-03a39950/'>Jessica Kaskov</a> and follow her on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/jkaskov/'>Jkaskov</a>.¬† You can learn more about Jessica and how to work with her on her website <a href='https://www.soulsalary.com/'>Soul Salary</a> and buy her book by the same name on <a href='https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0C9SF6JVK/'>Amazon</a>.¬† Jessica‚Äôs book identifies 4 profoundly impactful steps to aligning your time and energy with what feels joyous and fulfilling.¬† It is available in paperback or as an eBook.¬† You can also take Jessica‚Äôs free quiz to find out what your <a href='https://soulsalary.scoreapp.com/'>Soul Salary</a> is.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>For 15 years Jessica Kaskov worked as an engineer in a manufacturing company. When the company announced layoffs, Jessica did some deep soul searching. She realized that, while she was good at engineering, her real passion came from working with people. <br/><br/>Even though Jessica ultimately survived that round of layoffs, she began searching for work that would do more than just pay the bills.     <title>How to Handle Porn Addiction with Kevin White &amp; Polly Fleming</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[With over 40 million Americans regularly visiting porn sites, pornography is the "dirty little secret" that's hiding under the hood of more divorces than most people realize.  In this podcast episode, guests Kevin White and Polly Fleming (who are not married to each other!) share their deeply personal experiences with porn addiction and the crippling effects it had on their marriages.   Born from trauma, pornography addiction ultimately destroys true intimacy and makes maintaining a marriage ...]]></itunes:summary>
    <description><![CDATA[<p>With over 40 million Americans regularly visiting porn sites, pornography is the &quot;dirty little secret&quot; that&apos;s hiding under the hood of more divorces than most people realize.<br/><br/>In this podcast episode, guests Kevin White and Polly Fleming (who are not married to each other!) share their deeply personal experiences with porn addiction and the crippling effects it had on their marriages. <br/><br/>Born from trauma, pornography addiction ultimately destroys true intimacy and makes maintaining a marriage or other deep relationship extremely difficult. It&apos;s mired in guilt and shame, as well as societal judgment. <br/><br/>Yet, paradoxically, the only way to heal from porn addiction (and to heal relationships broken by porn addiction) is through self-love, empathy, understanding, and education. <br/><br/><b>LISTNER&apos;S NOTE: </b>This episode deals with pornography, sex, and relationships. While the conversation is not graphic, listener discretion is still advised.<br/><br/><b>About Polly<br/></b>Polly Fleming is an intuitive artist, writer and speaker. She&apos;s also a mother, and a woman who has lived with an addict. Her desire is to shine a light on addiction as well as the trauma that causes it, to support, encourage and educate those it affects; especially women.</p><p><b>Connect with Polly<br/></b>You can connect with Polly on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/polly-fleming/'>Polly Fleming</a>, Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/polly.s.fleming/'>Polly Fleming</a> and the best way to reach Polly is through Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/_artofyou_/'>Art Of You</a>.¬† You can find Polly‚Äôs book, <a href='https://www.amazon.com/Spouse-Addict-Journal-Polly-Fleming/dp/B0C4MQ4JTD/ref=sr_1_2?crid=4DKF2FZAP2UX&amp;keywords=journal+for+spouse+of+addict&amp;qid=1695850100&amp;s=books&amp;sprefix=jounal+for+spouse+of+addict%2Cstripbooks%2C96&amp;sr=1-2'><em>Spouse of an Addict: A Journal</em></a> on Amazon.<br/><br/><b>About Kevin<br/></b>Kevin White is an Executive Coach who works with his wife Jamie with business leaders in transition. They work together as a team with each client. Kevin specializes in healing the spiritual body and mind by working in his spiritual gifts. As a Christian, Kevin does all this work though the tools that God has given him and through the special relationship he has with God through Jesus. However, Kevin is not a religious person, just a person who believes in the gifts we&apos;ve been given and power of love.<br/><br/></p><p><b>Connect with Kevin<br/></b>You can learn more about Kevin at his website <a href='https://www.believecrew.com/'>Believe Crew. </a>You connect with Kevin on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/kevin-g-white/'>Kevin White</a>, listen to the Believe Crew Podcast on <a href='https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/business-addicts/id1606208046'>Apple Podcast</a> or <a href='https://open.spotify.com/show/4G9FYwOMDMh7ta1GgQ3Lm4'>Spotify</a> and check out the <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@believecrewcoaching'>Believe Crew YouTube Channel</a>.¬† The best way to reach Kevin is via email at kevin@believecrew.com</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <itunes:title>Creating the Amicable Divorce Network with Tracy Moore-Grant </itunes:title>
    <title>Creating the Amicable Divorce Network with Tracy Moore-Grant </title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[If given a choice, most people would prefer to divorce amicably, affordably and efficiently. Yet the divorce system isn't structured to make any of those things happen.  As a divorce lawyer who litigated divorces for decades, Tracy Moore Grant got tired of seeing people get dragged through time-consuming and expensive divorces simply because that's the way divorces "have always been done."  She also got tired of overpriced lawyers creating conflict, rather than resolving it.  That's why ...]]></itunes:summary>
    <description><![CDATA[<p>If given a choice, most people would prefer to divorce amicably, affordably and efficiently. Yet the divorce system isn&apos;t structured to make any of those things happen.<br/><br/>As a divorce lawyer who litigated divorces for decades, Tracy Moore Grant got tired of seeing people get dragged through time-consuming and expensive divorces simply because that&apos;s the way divorces &quot;have always been done.&quot;¬† She also got tired of overpriced lawyers creating conflict, rather than resolving it.<br/><br/>That&apos;s why she created the Amicable Divorce Network. It&apos;s the world&apos;s first and only organization that vets divorce professionals using 3 criteria:<br/><br/>Experience in family law;<br/>Fair billing practices; and<br/>Maintaining a resolution focus.<br/><br/>To learn more about how the Amicable Divorce process works, and how you can use the Amicable Divorce Network to lower the conflict (and the price tag!) of your own divorce, tune in now.<br/><br/><b>About Tracy</b>¬†<br/>Tracy Moore-Grant has practiced exclusively in the area of family law since 2002 and is a founding partner of the firm Patterson Moore Butler.. She focuses her practice being a non-litigation attorney helping parties resolve issues outside of the court system as an uncontested and amicable divorce attorney, mediator, arbitrator and parent coordinator. She is the founder of the Amicable Divorce Network, an international association of vetted professionals who are dedicated to helping people navigate the process of divorce in an efficient and low conflict manner. She has been the guest on many podcasts and authored many articles on issues relating to low conflict divorce. She is the recipient of both a Georgia Legal Award (2020) and a Southeastern Legal Award (2023) for the positive impact the Amicable Divorce Network has had on the legal process for divorce. She resides in Georgia and is a wife, step-mother and schnauzer lover.¬†</p><p><b>Connect with Tracy<br/></b>You can connect with Tracy on her Facebook Business Page at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/amicabledivorcenetwork'>Amicable Divorce Network</a>, on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/tracy-ann-moore-grant-9760897/'>Tracy Moore-Grant</a> and on her LinkedIn Business Page at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/company/81285690/admin/feed/posts/'>Amicable Divorce Network</a>.¬† You can also find Tracy on YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCzk3S9DfTsyCVxeBGyFkXw'>Amicable Divorce Network</a>, Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/amicabledivorcenetwork'>Amicable Divorce Network</a> and on TikTok at <a href='mailto:@amicabledivorcenetwork'>@amicabledivorcenetwork</a>.¬† To find out more about this organization and to find participating professionals please visit the website at <a href='https://www.amicabledivorcenetwork.com/'>Amicable Divorce Network</a>.¬† The best way to get in touch with Tracy is via email at info@amicabledivorcenetwork.com. <br/><br/><a href='https://www.divorceamicably.com/2023/12/11/your-divorce-consultation-checklist/'>Your Divorce Consultation Checklist</a></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></description>
    <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>If given a choice, most people would prefer to divorce amicably, affordably and efficiently. Yet the divorce system isn&apos;t structured to make any of those things happen.<br/><br/>As a divorce lawyer who litigated divorces for decades, Tracy Moore Grant got tired of seeing people get dragged through time-consuming and expensive divorces simply because that&apos;s the way divorces &quot;have always been done.&quot;¬† She also got tired of overpriced lawyers creating conflict, rather than resolving it.<br/><br/>That&apos;s why she created the Amicable Divorce Network. It&apos;s the world&apos;s first and only organization that vets divorce professionals using 3 criteria:<br/><br/>Experience in family law;<br/>Fair billing practices; and<br/>Maintaining a resolution focus.<br/><br/>To learn more about how the Amicable Divorce process works, and how you can use the Amicable Divorce Network to lower the conflict (and the price tag!) of your own divorce, tune in now.<br/><br/><b>About Tracy</b>¬†<br/>Tracy Moore-Grant has practiced exclusively in the area of family law since 2002 and is a founding partner of the firm Patterson Moore Butler.. She focuses her practice being a non-litigation attorney helping parties resolve issues outside of the court system as an uncontested and amicable divorce attorney, mediator, arbitrator and parent coordinator. She is the founder of the Amicable Divorce Network, an international association of vetted professionals who are dedicated to helping people navigate the process of divorce in an efficient and low conflict manner. She has been the guest on many podcasts and authored many articles on issues relating to low conflict divorce. She is the recipient of both a Georgia Legal Award (2020) and a Southeastern Legal Award (2023) for the positive impact the Amicable Divorce Network has had on the legal process for divorce. She resides in Georgia and is a wife, step-mother and schnauzer lover.¬†</p><p><b>Connect with Tracy<br/></b>You can connect with Tracy on her Facebook Business Page at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/amicabledivorcenetwork'>Amicable Divorce Network</a>, on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/tracy-ann-moore-grant-9760897/'>Tracy Moore-Grant</a> and on her LinkedIn Business Page at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/company/81285690/admin/feed/posts/'>Amicable Divorce Network</a>.¬† You can also find Tracy on YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCzk3S9DfTsyCVxeBGyFkXw'>Amicable Divorce Network</a>, Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/amicabledivorcenetwork'>Amicable Divorce Network</a> and on TikTok at <a href='mailto:@amicabledivorcenetwork'>@amicabledivorcenetwork</a>.¬† To find out more about this organization and to find participating professionals please visit the website at <a href='https://www.amicabledivorcenetwork.com/'>Amicable Divorce Network</a>.¬† The best way to get in touch with Tracy is via email at info@amicabledivorcenetwork.com. <br/><br/><a href='https://www.divorceamicably.com/2023/12/11/your-divorce-consultation-checklist/'>Your Divorce Consultation Checklist</a></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <itunes:title>How to Create a Child-Centered Divorce with Rosalind Sedacca</itunes:title>
    <title>How to Create a Child-Centered Divorce with Rosalind Sedacca</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Ever wished for a comprehensive guide to navigating divorce with your child's best interests at heart?    Rosalind Sedacca, divorce and co-parenting coach, as well as the founder of the Child-Centered Divorce Network, helps her clients view divorce from their children's eyes.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Ever wished for a comprehensive guide to navigating divorce with your child&apos;s best interests at heart?¬† <br/><br/>Rosalind Sedacca, divorce and co-parenting coach, as well as the founder of the Child-Centered Divorce Network, helps her clients view divorce from their children&apos;s eyes. Drawing from her own life experiences as well as her expertise in working with divorcing parents for over 15 years, Rosalind reveals the secret to creating a nurturing environment for children both during and after a divorce.<br/><br/>In this episode, Rosalind explains why it&apos;s crucial to shield children from adult information, as well as why parents should never use their children as messengers or ask them to pick sides. <br/><br/>Listen in to discover practical tips for co-parenting during the holidays as well as insightful ways to protect your children in a high-conflict divorce. This episode will give you insight into parallel parenting, the complex dynamics of parental alienation, and much, much more. <br/><br/><b>About Rosalind<br/></b>Rosalind Sedacca, CDC is a Divorce &amp; Co-Parenting Coach, recognized as The Voice of Child-Centered Divorce. She is the founder of the Child-Centered Divorce Network which provides valuable resources for parents who are facing, moving through or transitioning after a divorce. She is also the author of How Do I Tell the Kids about the Divorce? A Create-a-Storybook Guide to Preparing Your Children ‚Äì with Love! and co-host of Divorce, Dating &amp; Empowered Living Radio Show &amp; Podcast.</p><p><b>Connect with Rosalind<br/></b>You can connect with Rosalind on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/RosalindSedacca'>Rosalind Sedacca</a> or her business Facebook page at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/ChildCenteredDivorce'>Child Centered Divorce</a>.¬† You can also find Rosalind on LinkedIn at <a href='http://www.linkedin.com/in/rosalindsedacca'>Rosalind Sedacca</a>, Twitter at <a href='https://twitter.com/RosalindSedacca'>Rosalind Sedacca</a> and on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/rosalindsedacca/'>Rosalind Sedacca</a>. You can listen to Rosalind‚Äôs podcast <a href='https://bit.ly/2QThQW2'>Divorce, Dating &amp; Empowered Living Radio Show &amp; Podcast</a>, check out <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@RosalindSedacca'>Rosalind‚Äôs YouTube Channel</a> and find out more about her work at <a href='https://www.childcentereddivorce.com/'>Child Centered Divorce</a>.<br/><br/></p><p>During the month of January, Rosalind will be promoting <a href='file:///C:/Users/linda/Downloads/https/www.divorcedparentsupport.comary'>International Child-Centered Divorce Month</a>.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></description>
    <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Ever wished for a comprehensive guide to navigating divorce with your child&apos;s best interests at heart?¬† <br/><br/>Rosalind Sedacca, divorce and co-parenting coach, as well as the founder of the Child-Centered Divorce Network, helps her clients view divorce from their children&apos;s eyes. Drawing from her own life experiences as well as her expertise in working with divorcing parents for over 15 years, Rosalind reveals the secret to creating a nurturing environment for children both during and after a divorce.<br/><br/>In this episode, Rosalind explains why it&apos;s crucial to shield children from adult information, as well as why parents should never use their children as messengers or ask them to pick sides. <br/><br/>Listen in to discover practical tips for co-parenting during the holidays as well as insightful ways to protect your children in a high-conflict divorce. This episode will give you insight into parallel parenting, the complex dynamics of parental alienation, and much, much more. <br/><br/><b>About Rosalind<br/></b>Rosalind Sedacca, CDC is a Divorce &amp; Co-Parenting Coach, recognized as The Voice of Child-Centered Divorce. She is the founder of the Child-Centered Divorce Network which provides valuable resources for parents who are facing, moving through or transitioning after a divorce. She is also the author of How Do I Tell the Kids about the Divorce? A Create-a-Storybook Guide to Preparing Your Children ‚Äì with Love! and co-host of Divorce, Dating &amp; Empowered Living Radio Show &amp; Podcast.</p><p><b>Connect with Rosalind<br/></b>You can connect with Rosalind on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/RosalindSedacca'>Rosalind Sedacca</a> or her business Facebook page at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/ChildCenteredDivorce'>Child Centered Divorce</a>.¬† You can also find Rosalind on LinkedIn at <a href='http://www.linkedin.com/in/rosalindsedacca'>Rosalind Sedacca</a>, Twitter at <a href='https://twitter.com/RosalindSedacca'>Rosalind Sedacca</a> and on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/rosalindsedacca/'>Rosalind Sedacca</a>.     <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Jason Sposeep has helped his clients get divorced in every way there is to do it.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Jason Sposeep has helped his clients get divorced in every way there is to do it. As an experienced litigator, mediator, negotiator, and Collaborative Divorce professional he has guided his clients through almost every divorce process during the course of his career..<br/><br/>In this episode, Jason explains what each different divorce process is, how it works, and (most importantly) the factors to consider when choosing one divorce process over another. [<b>HINT:</b> Not every divorce process will work well for every divorcing client.] He also dives deeply into which divorce process will (or won&apos;t) work for which kind of divorcing client.<br/><br/>We also talk a lot about divorce lawyers, and how you can find a divorce lawyer who specializes in the type of divorce process you&apos;re interested in using. <br/><br/>If you&apos;ve thought about mediating your divorce, doing a Collaborative Divorce, or going through your divorce in any way that DOESN&apos;T involve fighting in court, this podcast episode can help you make better decisions about the divorce process that will work the best for you and your family.<br/><br/><b>About Jason</b>¬†<br/>Jason Sposeep is a dedicated advocate for high net-worth professionals and their spouses, who prioritizes fair and equitable outcomes in divorce cases. His extensive background in business and finance, coupled with his compassion, allows him to sensibly resolve complex divorce and custody disputes, with an emphasis on always placing the well-being of children at the forefront.¬†</p><p>While Jason has substantial experience in litigating such matters, he strives to reach amicable solutions outside the courtroom.¬†<br/><br/></p><p>Jason is a skilled negotiator, trained in mediation and collaborative divorce, and holds a 40-hour mediation certification. Additionally, Jason&apos;s involvement in Collaborative Divorce Illinois and his role in shaping Illinois Supreme Court Rule 294 showcase his commitment to improving the collaborative divorce practice. He frequently lectures on various family law topics and is actively engaged in alumni and educational initiatives within the legal community.¬†<br/><br/></p><p><b>Connect with Jason</b>¬†</p><p>You can connect with Jason on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/collaborativelawyer'>Jason N. Sposeep Esq.</a>, on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/jsposeep/'>Jason Sposeep</a> and on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/jsposeep/'>Jason Sposeep</a>.¬† You can find out more about Jason and the law firm where he is a senior partner at the website <a href='https://www.sdflaw.com/team/detail/jason-sposeep/bio'>Schiller DuCanto &amp; Fleck</a>.¬† The best way to get in touch with Jason is via email at <a href='mailto:jsposeep@sdflaw.com'>jsposeep@sdflaw.com</a> or via phone at 312-609-5551.<br/><br/>To find Collaborative Divorce Professionals in Illinois, including attorneys, child specialist, financial specialist and divorce coaches, please visit <a href='https://collaborativedivorceillinois.org/directory/'>Collaborative Divorce Illinois</a>.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Jason Sposeep has helped his clients get divorced in every way there is to do it. For example, Alison describes how she turned a simple stick into a tool that transformed a dead-end into an open path.<br/><br/>Alison&apos;s unique approach to making decisions helps broaden our understanding of the way we can use nature and language to transform obstacles into opportunities.¬†</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>What happens when you bring together financial expertise and personal experience with divorce? You get Mandy Walker, our guest for this episode of Off the Fence. After going through her own difficult divorce Mandy switched careers from finance to divorce mediation. She now helps divorcing couples who want to end their divorce amicably through mediation do exactly that.<br/><br/>In this episode, Mandy explores the different types of mediation, the different types of mediators, and the way mediation really works. [HINT: It may not work the way you think it does!] <br/><br/>Mandy discusses the various ways you can work with an attorney in mediation and explains why mediation might not be the ideal choice for everyone.<br/><br/>This episode is a goldmine of information for anyone trying to navigate the murky waters of divorce and considering mediation. <br/><br/><b>About Mandy<br/></b>Mandy Walker is a divorce mediator and Certified Divorce Financial Analyst¬Æ based in Boulder, Colorado. She works with individuals and couples helping them to end their relationships with dignity and respect, creating an understanding of the process and their options so they can feel confident in the decisions they‚Äôre making.</p><p>Mandy‚Äôs first career was 20+ years working in financial services in customer service and operations. Of the many hats Mandy wore during that time, she was responsible for handling formal customer complaints and major service resolution issues giving her a solid foundation in dispute resolution.<br/><br/></p><p>With a change of career in mind, Mandy graduated in 2008 with a Masters in Journalism from the University of Colorado at Boulder. While pursuing her journalism studies, Mandy and her husband of seventeen years divorced, and it was that experience that led to Mandy‚Äôs new career as a divorce professional.<br/><br/></p><p><b>Connect with Mandy<br/></b>You can connect with Mandy on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/mandywalkerco/'>Mandy Walker</a> or email Mandy at <a href='mailto:Mandy@mandywalker.com'>Mandy@mandywalker.com</a>.¬† You can find out more about the work Mandy offers on her website at <a href='https://mandywalker.com/'>Mandy Walker</a>.<br/><br/></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <title>Bigger, Better, Braver: How to Create Better Relationships With Nancy Pickard</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Do you feel like you and your spouse have been having the same fight - and engaging in the same destructive behavior - for years (maybe decades!) and you can't seem to change?     <description><![CDATA[<p>Do you feel like you and your spouse have been having the same fight - and engaging in the same destructive behavior - for years (maybe decades!) and you can&apos;t seem to change?¬† Nancy Pickard, a certified integrative coach, is a master at helping couples see the patterns they have subconsciously created in their marriages that are getting in the way of them building a true connection.<br/><br/>Nancy gives her clients tools to help them break free of their outdated and destructive relationship patterns so that they can create a better, healthier relationship moving forward.<br/><br/>Nancy also shares insights on relational reckoning and examines the powerful influences that focus plays in relationships.¬† Finally, Nancy guides listeners to reflect on whether the good in a particular relationship outweighs the bad, and provides tips on how to tip the scales toward positivity in your own significant relationship by being bigger, better, and braver.<br/><br/><b>About Nancy<br/></b>Nancy is a Certified Integrative Coach through The Ford Institute for Transformational Training and the Levin Life Coach Academy. She is certified as a Breakthrough Shadow Coach, Empowered Parent Coach, Courage Coach, Healing Your Heart Coach, Leadership Coach, Holistic Lifestyle Coach and Bigger Better Braver Coaching. She is the author of the international best seller, <a href='https://www.amazon.com/dp/197010712X'>Bigger Better Braver: Conquer your Fears, Embrace your Courage, Transform your Life</a>.<br/><br/>Prior to her work as a coach, she owned a personal gym called Tight Ends Inc. She knows what it takes to help people achieve big goals. She holds multiple personal training certifications and has focused on health and wellness for almost 20 years. Her path towards coaching was a natural evolution‚Äîshe has a BS in Psychology and an MS in Education.<br/><br/>In 2017, she traveled alone in Thailand and Vietnam and undertook her biggest challenge, climbing Kilimanjaro at the age of 61. Coaching others to step out of fear and into bigger versions of themselves is her passion. <br/><br/>She is the mother of two grown sons and an active grandmother to three beautiful granddaughters and a one-year old grandson.<br/><br/><b>Connect with Nancy<br/></b>The best way to connect with Nancy is via email at nancy@nancypickardlifecoach.com.¬† You can follow Nancy on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/nancypickardlifecoach/'>Nancy Pickard Life Coach</a> and on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/Nancypickardlifecoach'>Nancy Pickard Life Coach</a>.¬† You can find out more about Nancy&apos;s work and her Self-Study Course, on her website at <a href='https://nancypickardlifecoach.com/'>Nancy Pickard Life Coach</a>.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <title>Dave Moravec: Finding Love &amp; Maintaining Relationships with Your Adult Children After Divorce</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Dave Moravec had been married for 33 years when he decided to divorce.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Dave Moravec had been married for 33 years when he decided to divorce. His children were adults at that time, but they each had very distinct opinions about - and reactions to - his divorce from their mother.<br/><br/>Dave describes how he came to his decision through therapy, separation, and intense introspection. He also explains the challenges he faced in navigating a divorce with adult children - two of whom lived at a distance and one who lived in the family home. <br/><br/>Dave described how he navigated &quot;being the bad guy who broke up the family.&quot; He also explained the steps he took to try to repair and maintain relationships with each of his children throughout the divorce process - even when his kids wouldn&apos;t talk to him.<br/><br/>If you or anyone you know is afraid to get a divorce because you&apos;re worried about what will happen to your relationships with your adult children, this episode should absolutely be on your &quot;must listen to&quot; list!<br/><br/>(If you&apos;d like to learn more about how to navigate relationships with your adult children after divorce, check out <a href='https://karencovy.com/adult-children-of-divorce/'><b><em>Adult Children of Divorce: 10 Surprising Facts Parents Might Not Know.</em></b></a><em> )<br/><br/></em><b>About Dave<br/></b>Dave Moravec serves as President of the Colerain Chamber of Commerce in Cincinnati, Ohio and is a native of the Chicago area. He has been a business owner and in leadership across multiple companies &amp; industries over his 40-year career. Dave graduated with a degree in business administration from Illinois Wesleyan University (Bloomington, IL) where he met his wife; they were married for 33 years until their separation/divorce in 2017. Dave has three married children and two grandchildren. He and his wife Patti just celebrated their second wedding anniversary; Patti has 2 married children with 5 grandkids.</p><p>¬†</p><p><b>Connect with Dave</b>¬†</p><p>The best way to connect with Dave is through Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/dave.moravec.7/'>Dave Moravec</a> or by emailing Dave directly at <a href='mailto:ddmoravec5@gmail.com'>ddmoravec5@gmail.com</a>.¬† You can also find Dave on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/davemoravec2018/'>Dave Moravec</a>.<br/><br/></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>What if you had everything you ever wanted in life and found out it wasn&apos;t enough?<br/><br/>Jeanell Greene was a high-achieving corporate sales rep with a 6 figure income and a 20-year career.¬† Yet in her heart, she knew she was being called to do more.<br/><br/>Ultimately, she decided to confront her darkest fears, leave her corporate career, and open herself up to pursuing a more fulfilling career - even though at that time, she didn&apos;t know what that career would be. <br/><br/>Jeanell explains how she was able to get clear about what she truly wanted, open herself up to new possibilities, and learn to listen to the small voice buried within her. (Jeanell also used this same process to amicably divorce her first husband and eventually manifest the husband of her dreams, to whom she is happily married today.)<br/><br/>Now, as a marriage and relationship coach Jeanell uses her experience and expertise to guide her clients to create new possibilities in their lives, both personally and professionally. Her direct and honest coaching method (which she calls &quot;No B.S. Coaching&quot;) helps her clients get real with themselves and create deep, fulfilling relationships and lives that are in alignment with their true desires.<br/><br/><b>About Jeanell</b>¬†<br/>Jeanell¬† is a Marriage and Life Coach helping couples on the brink of divorce save their marriage and heal from generational trauma. Jeanell is on a mission to bring more love and healing to the world and loves sharing her touching stories of love and loss and is proof that having the relationship of your dreams is possible when we take full responsibility for our own emotional wounds and conquer our fears.¬†</p><p><br/><b>¬†Connect with Jeanell<br/></b>You can connect with Jeanell on Facebook at <a href='http://www.facebook.com/wingwomanhero'>WingWoman Hero</a>, LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/jeanellgreene/'>Jeanell Greene</a>¬†and on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/saveourmarriage/'>Save our Marriage</a>.     <itunes:title>Beverly Price: When Divorce Helps You Face the Truth and Own Your Own Stuff</itunes:title>
    <title>Beverly Price: When Divorce Helps You Face the Truth and Own Your Own Stuff</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Beverly Price is one of those rare humans who has navigated not one, not two, but multiple divorces in her life. Through that process and all of the pain it caused her and those she loved,  she recognized that the key to having the relationship she dreamed of lay within her.  After her last divorce, Beverly embarked on a journey of radical self-awareness. She came "face-to-face" with herself and committed to becoming the person she truly wanted to be.  With a lot of hard work and a ...]]></itunes:summary>
    <description><![CDATA[<p>Beverly Price is one of those rare humans who has navigated not one, not two, but multiple divorces in her life. Through that process and all of the pain it caused her and those she loved,¬† she recognized that the key to having the relationship she dreamed of lay within her.<br/><br/>After her last divorce, Beverly embarked on a journey of radical self-awareness. She came &quot;face-to-face&quot; with herself and committed to becoming the person she truly wanted to be.¬† With a lot of hard work and a commitment to change, she transformed herself and her life and is now in a happy, healthy marriage.<br/><br/>Today, Beverly coaches other women who are going through a divorce to change themselves. That in turn helps them change the process of their divorces and their lives after divorce. Beverly guides her clients to let go of their anger and bitterness so that they can find happiness and create the life they truly want both during their divorce and beyond.<br/><br/>In this podcast episode, she shares her guidance so that you, too, can let go of negative emotions and live a better life after your divorce.<br/><br/><b>About Beverly </b>¬†</p><p>Beverly Price, MBA, has 25+ years‚Äô experience as a CDC Certified Divorce¬Æ, Women‚Äôs Empowerment, Pre-mediation coach and podcast host, providing knowledge, support, and insight to empower women going through the divorce process before, during and after. She guides them through with all of its emotional, legal, financial, educational, organizational and logistical challenges. She provides one-on-one coaching across the US, to address a woman‚Äôs unique desire for a fulfilling life designed just the way she wants it.<br/><br/></p><p>Her passion is to help women through their divorce process and recovery journey with its ups and downs to grow from self-doubt to self-love quicker, with less pain, and more support than she had. She wants women to feel confident, intelligent, and beautiful so they can live the fabulous lives they were meant to.¬†<br/><br/></p><p><b>Where to Connect with Beverly<br/></b><br/></p><p>You can follow Beverly on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/herempowereddivorce'>Her Empowered Divorce</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/groups/divorcerecovery'>Divorce Recovery</a> and her personal page at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/beverlyprice365'>Beverly Price</a>.¬† You can also connect with Beverly on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/beverly-price/'>Beverly Price</a> and find her on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/her_empowered_divorce/'>Her Empowered Divorce</a>.¬† The best way to reach Beverly is via email at <a href='mailto:beverly@herempowereddivorce.com'>beverly@herempowereddivorce.com</a> or by phone at 843-315-8659.¬† You can also sign up for Beverly‚Äôs newsletter and find blogs and resources on her website at <a href='https://herempowereddivorce.com/'>Her Empowered Divorce</a>.<br/><br/></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <title>Gasping for Air: Dana Diaz on How to Break Free from Narcissistic Abuse</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[For decades Dana Diaz lived in the grips of an abusive relationship. Like many others in similar situations, Dana stayed for two reasons.     <description><![CDATA[<p>For decades Dana Diaz lived in the grips of an abusive relationship. Like many others in similar situations, Dana stayed for two reasons.¬†</p><p>First, she worried about what would happen to her son if she left. Second, she stayed because she didn‚Äôt feel like she deserved better. But when she found herself in a doctor&apos;s office because she only weighed 90 pounds and her organs were shutting down, Dana knew something had to change.<br/><br/></p><p>In this podcast episode, we dive deeply into the world of fear, violence, and abuse. With unflinching honesty, Dana shares her journey through an abusive childhood, an abusive marriage, and the life of resilience and recovery she‚Äôs finally created since her divorce.<br/><br/></p><p>Dana chronicles how she finally broke free from the violence and abuse. (Spoiler alert: Just getting a divorce didn‚Äôt change that!) Her story of courage reminds us all about the power resilience and self-love have to change lives.<br/><br/></p><p><b>WARNING: This episode might be triggering for anyone who has experienced or is trying to heal from domestic violence, sexual abuse, financial abuse, or any type of intimate partner abuse. Listener discretion is advised.<br/><br/><br/>National Domestic Violence Hotline<br/>800-799-7233<br/><br/></b><br/><b>About Dana<br/>‚Äã</b>Dana studied journalism and psychology at DePaul University. She has also had life-long experiences with narcissistic abuse. Thankfully her education gave her the ability to accurately express how narcissistic abuse creates confusion and conflict within victims.¬†<br/><br/></p><p>Today, Dana is a proud voice for fellow victims who are unable, afraid, or too ashamed to share their experiences. She strives to create awareness and understanding to ensure victims are given the support they need to both understand their situation and heal from it.<br/><br/></p><p>Dana‚Äôs first book<em>, Gasping For Air: The Stranglehold Of Narcissistic Abuse.</em> chronicles her experiences in a 25-year-long abusive marriage, as well as the healing and empowerment she‚Äôs experienced since then.<br/><br/></p><p><b>Where to Connect with Dana<br/></b>You can learn more about Dana and her story on her website <a href='https://danasdiaz.com/'>Dana S Diaz.</a>¬† ¬†Dana also has a quiz to help you determine if you are in a relationship involving narcissistic abuse. <br/> <br/>You can follow Dana on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/DanaSDiazAuthor/'>Dana S Diaz</a> and on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/danas.diaz/'>Dana S Diaz</a>.¬† You can get your copy of Dana&apos;s best-selling book, &quot;<a href='https://amzn.to/3PXFC2O'><em>Gasping for Air:¬† The Stranglehold of Narcissistic Abuse</em></a><em>&quot;</em>¬† on her <a href='https://danasdiaz.com/books/'>website</a> or wherever books are sold.<br/><br/></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Mark Bradford wears many hats. He&apos;s an author, pilot, speaker, coach, and web developer. Above all, he&apos;s a master of life&apos;s game of time, energy, and resources. <br/><br/>In a revelation born out of the dark depths of his divorce, Mark discovered that life isn&apos;t just about clocking hours. He also reveals how you can recalibrate the &apos;gauges&apos; of your love dashboard to create more fulfilling relationships.<br/><br/>Whether you&apos;re in a relationship or hope to be in a relationship, this podcast episode promises to open your eyes to a new way of living. <br/><br/><b>About Mark<br/></b>Mark is an author of both fiction and nonfiction books, host of a top 5% global podcast, licensed UAV pilot, speaker and full stack web developer.¬† He created the Alchemy for Life‚Ñ¢ coaching system and won best new author in 2019 for his epic <em>The Sword and the Sunflower</em> trilogy.</p><p>¬†</p><p><b>Where to Connect with Mark<br/></b>You can learn more about Mark‚Äôs coaching program and podcast at <a href='https://alchemyfor.life/'>Alchemy For Life</a>.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Are your finances a cluttered mess? You&apos;re not alone!¬† Nancy Doyle, an experienced financial professional and author,¬† shares her knowledge and expertise to help you organize and understand your finances so you can regain control of your financial life.<br/><br/>Nancy talks about how to get your financial house in order, create an &quot;ICE&quot; file, and take inventory of all your financial documents. She also discusses the simple things you can do to empower yourself when it comes to your finances so that you&apos;re ready for whatever life might throw your way.<br/><br/>Nancy also breaks down the basics of investing.¬† She shares her framework for investing and discusses the challenges of choosing a financial advisor who aligns with your needs and aspirations. <br/><br/>Finally, Nancy shares some valuable resources and words of wisdom that will help you stay on top of your financial game. Join us on this journey to financial clarity and control. Nancy&apos;s insights are not to be missed!<br/><br/><b>About Nancy<br/></b>Nancy is an experienced family office investment professional and author of <em>Manage Your Financial Life - A Thoughtful, Organized Approach for Women</em> and <em>Manage Your Financial Life - Just Starting Out</em>. In her consulting practice, she focuses on financial wellness and engagement for women and millennials, as well as family wealth topics. Nancy is an impactful speaker covering a variety of financial literacy topics in a relatable, easy-to-understand fashion and has been a guest on TV, podcasts, and radio programs. A graduate of Georgetown University, Nancy received her MBA from the University of Michigan Ross School of Business. She holds the Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) designation, is a Certified Financial Therapist-Level I‚Ñ¢ Practitioner (CFT-I‚Ñ¢), and a Professional Member of NAPO (National Association of Productivity &amp; Organizing.)</p><p><b>Where to Connect with Nancy</b></p><p>You can learn more about Nancy on her website at <a href='https://nancydoyle.com/'>Nancy Doyle</a>¬† and find helpful financial resources on her blog, <a href='https://manageyourfinanciallife.com/'>Manage Your Financial Life.</a>¬† ¬†You can find Nancy on X (formerly Twitter) at <a href='https://twitter.com/nancyfinance?lang=en'>Nancy Doyle</a> and on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/nancyfinance/?hl=en'>Nancy Doyle</a>.¬† The best way to reach Nancy is via email at <a href='mailto:nancy@nancydoyle.com'>nancy@nancydoyle.com</a>.¬† You can also purchase Nancy‚Äôs book,¬† <a href='https://www.amazon.com/Manage-Your-Financial-Life-Starting/dp/0997609729/'><em>Manage Your Financial Life</em></a>.<br/><br/></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Imagine discovering how you could heal the trauma from your past and create a healthier, happier relationship with yourself and others. That&apos;s what we explore in this podcast episode with trauma-informed yoga therapist and relationship coach, Bethany Dotson. <br/><br/>Bethany brings over a decade of experience helping midlife career women recover from anxiety, PTSD, and more. She helps her clients rebuild their self-worth after they&apos;ve been in toxic relationships or gone through a high-conflict divorce. <br/><br/>Drawing from her own experiences in toxic relationships as well as her extensive training, Bethany offers insight into how individuals can rewire their brains, release the physical symptoms that come from their trauma, and finally create the healthy relationships they crave.<br/><br/>Bethany reveals how she guides her clients to find and emotionally connect with their ideal partner, encouraging them to take risks and open themselves to love again. <br/><br/>If you&apos;re trying to overcome your past traumas, this is definitely the episode for you.<br/><br/><b>About Bethany</b>¬†<br/>Bethany is trauma-informed yoga therapist and relationship coach with over a decade of experience helping mid-life career-women heal anxiety, C/PTSD,¬† find their power and skyrocket their confidence after divorce or toxic relationships, communicate better, navigate conflict and most importantly, co-create healthy relationships.¬†</p><p><br/>She is a domestic violence survivor and thriver who helps women triumph over trauma, break their cycle of emotionally unavailable partners and attract the love they deeply desire.¬† ¬†</p><p><br/><b>Connect with Bethany</b>¬†</p><p>You can find Bethany on social media on Facebook at <a     <itunes:title>Children&#39;s Whispers in Divorce: A Heartfelt Dialogue with Despina Mavridou</itunes:title>
    <title>Children&#39;s Whispers in Divorce: A Heartfelt Dialogue with Despina Mavridou</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Can you imagine going through a divorce and having to feel your parents' anger and watch their tears, but NOT be able to tell anyone how YOU really felt or what YOU really wanted?  That's exactly what Despina Mavridou experienced as a child going through her parents' divorce.  She was constantly caught in the crossfire of her parents' fights.   "Tell your father this."  "Don't tell your mother that."  "Your father is bad."  "Your mother is wrong."  Despina heard it all.   What's most sur...]]></itunes:summary>
    <description><![CDATA[<p>Can you imagine going through a divorce and having to feel your parents&apos; anger and watch their tears, but NOT be able to tell anyone how YOU really felt or what YOU really wanted?<br/><br/>That&apos;s exactly what Despina Mavridou experienced as a child going through her parents&apos; divorce.¬† She was constantly caught in the crossfire of her parents&apos; fights. <br/><br/>&quot;Tell your father this.&quot; <br/>&quot;Don&apos;t tell your mother that.&quot; <br/>&quot;Your father is bad.&quot; <br/>&quot;Your mother is wrong.&quot;<br/><br/>Despina heard it all. <br/><br/>What&apos;s most surprising, though,¬† is that Despina&apos;s parents had an &quot;amicable&quot; divorce (... at least on the surface!)¬† <br/><br/>Yet the way they treated each other behind the scenes, both during their divorce and for years afterward, was anything but amicable.<br/><br/>Her parents&apos; relationship was so bad that at 16 years old Despina cut off all contact with her father - only to then be chastised by her mother for not wanting to spend time with her dad.<br/><br/>Despina&apos;s story is heartbreaking ... but also all too common. <br/><br/>If you&apos;re going through a divorce and you have children, this podcast episode will open your eyes to what&apos;s really happening with your kids both as you go through your divorce and as you interact with your former spouse afterward.<br/><br/><b>About Despina</b></p><p>Despina is an author, mediator, and lawyer based in Greece. She has authored the book <em>&quot;Mum, Dad Can You Hear Me?&quot;</em> which explores the topic of divorce through the perspective of a child, drawing from her own personal experience. The book is available in English on all Amazon stores, in Greek by 24grammata Editorial and in Portuguese by Gaudi Editorial. Additionally, Despina has created a diary that can be purchased alongside the book, allowing children to express their thoughts and emotions during this challenging time. The diary is also available on Amazon.</p><p>¬†¬†</p><p><b>Where to connect with Despina </b>¬†<br/><br/></p><p>You can find Despina on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/AuthorDespinaMavridou'>Despina Mavridou</a> and on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/author_despina_mavridou/'>Despina Mavridou</a>.¬† You can find Despina‚Äôs book, &quot;<em>Mum, Dad can you hear me?&quot;</em> on Amazon by <a href='https://amzn.to/3sDVPAU'>clicking here</a>.¬† ¬†<br/><br/></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></description>
    <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Can you imagine going through a divorce and having to feel your parents&apos; anger and watch their tears, but NOT be able to tell anyone how YOU really felt or what YOU really wanted?<br/><br/>That&apos;s exactly what Despina Mavridou experienced as a child going through her parents&apos; divorce.¬† She was constantly caught in the crossfire of her parents&apos; fights. <br/><br/>&quot;Tell your father this.&quot; <br/>&quot;Don&apos;t tell your mother that.&quot; <br/>&quot;Your father is bad.&quot; <br/>&quot;Your mother is wrong.&quot;<br/><br/>Despina heard it all. <br/><br/>What&apos;s most surprising, though,¬† is that Despina&apos;s parents had an &quot;amicable&quot; divorce (... at least on the surface!)¬† <br/><br/>Yet the way they treated each other behind the scenes, both during their divorce and for years afterward, was anything but amicable.<br/><br/>Her parents&apos; relationship was so bad that at 16 years old Despina cut off all contact with her father - only to then be chastised by her mother for not wanting to spend time with her dad.<br/><br/>Despina&apos;s story is heartbreaking ... but also all too common. <br/><br/>If you&apos;re going through a divorce and you have children, this podcast episode will open your eyes to what&apos;s really happening with your kids both as you go through your divorce and as you interact with your former spouse afterward.<br/><br/><b>About Despina</b></p><p>Despina is an author, mediator, and lawyer based in Greece.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Are you and your spouse struggling to keep your marriage together after one of you cheated? Do you wonder if it‚Äôs even possible for a marriage to survive an affair?</p><p>If so, you‚Äôre not alone. Dr. Juan Santos has spent a decade helping couples process their emotions and harness the skills they need to repair their marriage after one of them has had an affair.¬†</p><p>In this podcast episode, Dr. Santos shares valuable insights and actionable tips on how couples can heal the hurt that threatens to destroy their relationship.¬†</p><p>We also delve into the complexities of recovery, the disruptive role of shame, and how to bridge the disconnect that an affair creates between partners. By the end of this episode, you&apos;ll gain a deep understanding of how couples can not only recover but also thrive after an affair, and how to effectively communicate with each other to rebuild your relationship.¬†</p><p><br/><b>About Dr. Santos</b></p><p>With over ten years of experience in the field of helping others make transformations in life, Dr. Juan Santos is listed in the ranks of the top 3 marriage counselors in his local area. He brings new perspectives for mental health and wellness, for helping individuals and couples build empowerment and take charge of their relationships and their lives. He is a first-generation immigrant, originally born in the Dominican Republic and raised in North Carolina.¬†<br/><br/>Dr. Santos utilizes a unique mind and body-approach to teach individuals how to go from surviving to thriving in life.¬†<br/><br/></p><p>His work on improving your mental health and quality of life has been featured on radio, tv, magazine, and podcast.     <itunes:title>Jennifer Ramirez: Tips to Help Any Woman Overcome Abuse and Empower Themselves</itunes:title>
    <title>Jennifer Ramirez: Tips to Help Any Woman Overcome Abuse and Empower Themselves</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Domestic violence doesn't happen the way most people assume it does. Relationships don't start out being abusive. They start out with one person showering the other with love and affection.  It's not until later - sometimes years later  - that the relationship takes an abusive turn.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Domestic violence doesn&apos;t happen the way most people assume it does. Relationships don&apos;t start out being abusive. They start out with one person showering the other with love and affection.¬† It&apos;s not until later - sometimes years later¬† - that the relationship takes an abusive turn.<br/><br/>What&apos;s more, domestic violence doesn&apos;t only happen among the poor and uneducated. Women from all walks of life, all races, creeds, socioeconomic and educational levels fall prey to domestic violence.<br/><br/>Because of the sexual, physical, and financial abuse she suffered during her lifetime Jennifer Ramirez started <em>&amp;Rise</em>, a non-profit organization to empower women to rise above their adversities and embrace their authentic selves.<br/><br/>In this podcast episode Jennifer shares her personal journey and provides insightful advice on navigating relationships, spotting the red flags, and finding a safe way to leave an abusive relationship.<br/><br/><b>WARNING: This episode might be triggering for anyone who has experienced or is trying to heal from domestic violence, sexual abuse, financial abuse or any type of intimate partner abuse. Listener discretion is advised.<br/><br/>National Domestic Violence Hotline<br/>800-799-7233<br/><br/>About Jennifer</b></p><p>Jennifer Ramirez is an author, entrepreneur, trauma life coach, reiki practitioner, and speaker that is passionate about helping women live their best lives. She is the Founder of the nonprofit organization, <em>&amp;Rise</em>, whose mission is to empower women to be the ultimate versions of themselves no matter their adversities.¬† Jennifer has years of experience working with survivors and provides trauma-informed care to those she works with. Jennifer is a passionate advocate for all women and offers prevention education to help empower and educate women on healthy relationships, red flags, and healthy coping skills.<br/><br/><b>Connect with Jennifer</b></p><p>You can find Jennifer on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/womenrisechicago'>Women Rise Chicago</a>, on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/company/andrise/'>&amp;Rise</a>, on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/and_rise__/'>&amp;Rise</a>, and on TikTok at <a href='https://www.tiktok.com/@and_rise_'>&amp;Rise</a>.¬† You can also find out more about Jennifer and <em>&amp;Rise</em> at <a href='https://www.womenrisechicago.org/'>Women Rise Chicago</a> and the best way to contact Jennifer is at jennifer@womenrisechicago.org.</p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.
