    <description><![CDATA[<p>Buying and selling real estate can be nerve-wracking - especially when you&apos;re facing a life cycle event like retirement, divorce, or having a child.¬† What&apos;s more, even when we <em>think</em> we know what we want, we often discover (after months of going down the wrong path) that what we really want is totally different than what we thought we wanted.<br/><br/> Leslie Glazier has been using her background in psychology and her passion for real estate, to help buyers and sellers navigate the often tumultuous waters of buying and selling property for over 20 years. <br/><br/>In this podcast episode, Leslie shares valuable insights into the way that understanding mindset, lifecycles, and psychology can influence critical real estate decisions. <br/><br/>Leslie reveals how she helps her clients - especially her divorcing clients - to explore their options, understand their desires, and negotiate real estate deals with confidence. <br/><br/>She explains the importance of creating timelines, maintaining transparency, and understanding the details of a real estate deal so that you can make the best choices possible when it comes to buying and/or selling your home.<br/><br/><b>About Leslie<br/><br/></b>Leslie is a Divorce Real Estate Specialist with over 20 years‚Äô experience in residential real estate serving the Chicago area. She is one of a select group of Realtors who has been designated a Certified Divorce Real Estate Expert (CDRE) and a Certified Divorce Specialist (CDS). She is a founding member of Amicable Divorce Network (ADN), Leslie is a top 1% residential broker with @properies Christie‚Äôs International Real Estate.<br/><br/><b>Connect with Leslie</b><br/><br/>You can find Leslie on Facebook at her business page <a href='https://www.facebook.com/LeslieGlazierGroup'>Leslie Glazier Group</a> or at her personal page at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/leslie.glazier'>Leslie Glazier</a>.¬† Leslie can also be found on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/leslieglaziergroup/'>Leslie Glazier Group</a>, LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/leslieglazierrealtor'>Leslie Glazier Realtor</a>, and Twitter at <a href='https://twitter.com/lesliechihomes?lang=en '>Leslie Chi Homes</a>.¬† For more¬† information about Leslie and her business, visit Leslie at her website <a href='https://leslieglaziergroup.com/'>Leslie Glazier Group</a> and to get in touch with Leslie email her at leslie@leslieglazier.com.<br/><br/></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <itunes:title>Linda Kooper on How to Deal with Divorce, Death, and Career Change</itunes:title>
    <title>Linda Kooper on How to Deal with Divorce, Death, and Career Change</title>

    <description><![CDATA[<p>After her kids were born, Linda Kooper left her career as a corporate software developer to focus on raising her kids. But as her kids got older she realized two things.<br/><br/>1. Her kids didn&apos;t need her as much so it was time for her to get back into the workforce; and<br/>2. She wanted a divorce.<br/><br/>Her journey through two simultaneous major life transitions wasn&apos;t an easy one. Her divorce became contentious and expensive.¬† Then, during the middle of it, her mother died.<br/><br/>In this podcast episode, Linda offers a candid account of how she dealt with all the challenges that life threw at her her way at the same time. She opens up about the lack of guidance she received from her divorce lawyer and the multitude of decisions she had to make in order to get through her divorce.<br/><br/>Amidst the chaos, Linda learned to harness the power of modern technology as well as to rely on her own spirituality to get her through the hardest times. As Linda puts it, she got through her divorce by using prayer, faith, and Google.<br/><br/>If you or someone you know is struggling through a difficult divorce, a major life change, or both, this episode will inspire and uplift you, and help you see the light at the end of the tunnel.<br/><br/><b>About Linda<br/><br/></b>Linda Kooper is an online business manager and executive virtual assistant who works with established small businesses and entrepreneurs. She helps them grow their businesses by allowing them time to work on revenue generating tasks while she manages their administrative tasks. As a former software developer, Linda knows how to pay excellent attention to detail and she has amazing strategic ability.¬† Linda specializes in newsletters, expensive invoice, tracking, as well as email and calendar management. <br/><br/><b>Connect with Linda</b><br/><br/>You can find Linda on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/lindakooper/'>Linda Kooper</a> or on her website at <a href='https://premierexecutiveadmin.com/'>Premier Executive Admin.</a>¬† She can also be reached via email at Linda@premierexecutiveadmin.com.<br/><br/><br/></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>How do you leave an abusive marriage when you have no job, no credit score, and no safety net? That&apos;s exactly what Kari Petruch did.¬†</p><p>After living with a spouse who was verbally, emotionally, and financially abusive for 28 years, Kari Petruch had enough. For years as her kids were growing up she quietly saved some cash.¬† Once her youngest turned 18, she moved out of the house and filed for divorce.</p><p>She used the money she had saved to get through her divorce and create a new life for herself and her kids.<br/><br/></p><p>Kari is now happily remarried and living the life of her dreams. She is a master relationship coach, bestselling author, and a beacon of resilience. She now works with couples to deepen their intimacy, improve their communication, and strengthen their commitment to each other.</p><p>In this podcast episode Kari shares her inspiring story of survival and reinvention, proving that it&apos;s possible to take control of your life, and start again, no matter how dire the circumstances. <br/><br/><b>About Kari<br/></b><br/></p><p>Master Relationship Coach, Strategic Interventionist, Best Selling Author of Get Out of the Box and Into Play: The Secret to a Lasting Relationship and Owner of Highest Intent Life Coaching, Kari Petruch has been helping people all over the world for a lifetime. She is a mother of three, a grandmother of eight, and married to the man of her dreams. Kari helps couples to find even more joy and excitement in their relationships using her amazing Relationship Reignition Program.     <itunes:title>Terry Gaspard: Rules for a Successful Remarriage and the Sleeper Effect of Divorce</itunes:title>
    <title>Terry Gaspard: Rules for a Successful Remarriage and the Sleeper Effect of Divorce</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Statistics show that second marriages fail even more often than first marriages do. Yet some second marriages thrive, in spite of the odds.   If you're already divorced, and you want to remarry, how can you make your second marriage work?    World-renowned therapist and coach Terry Gaspard knows divorce inside and out. A child of divorced parents, Terry herself is divorced (... and now happily remarried!). She has spent her career working with individuals and couples to create stronger, ...]]></itunes:summary>
    <description><![CDATA[<p>Statistics show that second marriages fail even more often than first marriages do. Yet some second marriages thrive, in spite of the odds. <br/><br/>If you&apos;re already divorced, and you want to remarry, how can you make your second marriage work?¬† <br/><br/>World-renowned therapist and coach Terry Gaspard knows divorce inside and out. A child of divorced parents, Terry herself is divorced (... and now happily remarried!). She has spent her career working with individuals and couples to create stronger, more lasting relationships, and to ease the pain divorce has on children when a marriage ends.<br/><br/>In this episode, Terry talks about a variety of topics, including the &quot;sleeper effect&quot; of divorce on children and what makes a second marriage different from a first marriage. She spotlights the indispensable role of communication, trust, and understanding in fusing blended families. She also gets into the pivotal role finance plays in marriages and reveals her 10 rules for a successful re-marriage.<br/><br/>Whether you&apos;re going through a divorce and trying to protect your children or you&apos;re¬† already divorced and are considering remarriage this is the episode for you.<br/><br/><b>About Terry</b></p><p>Terry Gaspard, MSW, LICSW, is a licensed therapist with over thirty years of clinical experience specializing in individuals, couples, and families, divorce, remarriage, as well as an author, nonfiction writer, and college instructor. She is a contributor to <em>Huffington Post</em>, <em>The Good Men Project</em>, <em>The Gottman Institute Blog</em>, and <a href='https://www.marriage.com/'>Marriage.com</a>.¬† Two of her research studies on adult children of divorce have been published in the <em>Journal of Divorce and Remarriage.<br/></em><br/></p><p>In her latest book <a href='https://www.amazon.com/Remarriage-Manual-Everything-Better-Second/dp/1683644077/ref=sr_1_1?keywords=remarriage+manual&amp;qid=1562944867&amp;s=gateway&amp;sr=8-1'>THE REMARRIAGE MANUEL; HOW TO MAKE EVERYTHING WORK BETTER THE SECOND TIME AROUND</a> (Sounds Ture, February, 2020), Terry shares the expert advice, practical tools, hope, and inspiration that remarrying couples (and already remarried) couples need to make sure their 2nd or (or 3rd) marriages will finally be their happily ever after.<br/><br/></p><p>You can find Terry on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/terry-gaspard-28738b4a/'>Terry Gaspard</a>, Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/movingpastdivorce/'>Moving Past Divorce</a>, Twitter at <a href='https://twitter.com/MovePastDivorce'>Moving Past Divorce</a> and on her website at <a href='https://movingpastdivorce.com/'>Moving Past Divorce.</a><br/><br/></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></description>

    <itunes:title>How to Transition from Corporate Employee to Franchise Owner with Dawn Hershik</itunes:title>
    <title>How to Transition from Corporate Employee to Franchise Owner with Dawn Hershik</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Have you ever gone to your corporate job and thought, "There's got to be more than this?" If so, you're not alone.  When Dawn Hershik was downsized after a 30-year corporate career, she opted for an unusual fresh start by going into business with her husband, Elliott. Dawn shares how difficult it was to decide to leave her corporate career behind. She also share...]]></itunes:summary>
    <description><![CDATA[<p>Have you ever gone to your corporate job and thought, &quot;There&apos;s got to be more than this?&quot; If so, you&apos;re not alone.<br/><br/>When Dawn Hershik was downsized after a 30-year corporate career, she opted for an unusual fresh start by going into business with her husband, Elliott. Together, they launched a Supporting Strategies franchise, which has grown to a company with over 30 employees in just eight years.<br/><br/>Dawn shares how difficult it was to decide to leave her corporate career behind. She also shares her experiences of creating a business from the ground up - with her husband! <br/><br/>From navigating tight financial constraints to making tough hiring decisions to living and working together through COVID - Dawn and Elliott have been through it all. In this episode, Dawn gives you a behind-the-scenes perspective on boundary setting, task delegation, and fostering a culture of communication and trust within their team. <br/><br/>If you&apos;ve ever thought of venturing out on your own, buying a franchise, or working with your spouse, this is an episode you&apos;re not going to want to miss!<br/><br/><b>About Dawn</b></p><p>Dawn Hershik broke free from the corporate world in 2014. Faced with a pivotal moment, during a reorganization at the company she had been with for almost 30 years, together with her husband, she made the decision to leave and pursue the dream of owning a business.¬† ¬†<br/><br/></p><p>In 2015, they bought a Supporting Strategies franchise. Working side by side with her husband, Elliot, they‚Äôve built a successful business, with over 30 employees, to date. At the heart of their company is a team of skilled, seasoned accounting professionals who provide efficient and effective bookkeeping and controller services to businesses and nonprofits. They bring order to chaos in the Accounting Department.¬†<br/><br/></p><p>Dawn is also enthusiastic about connecting like-minded individuals who have similar objectives and can benefit from quality introductions.¬†<br/><br/></p><p><b>Where to Connect with Dawn</b></p><p>You can connect with Dawn on LinkedIn at <a href='linkedin.com/in/dawnhershik'>Dawn Hershik</a> and Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/supportingstrategieschicagofarwestsuburbs/'>Supporting Strategies</a>.¬† You can also find Dawn at her website at <a href='https://www.supportingstrategies.com/locations/chicago-far-west-suburbs/'>Supporting Strategies | Chicago Far West Suburbs</a>.¬†<br/><br/></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>What if you had the power to navigate change, recognize and seize opportunities, and find unexpected joy in the midst of chaos? Susan Guthrie, a nationally recognized family law attorney, mediator, and mediation trainer has done all of that and more.¬† <br/><br/>Susan went from being a litigator and a partner in a leading Connecticut law firm, to launching her own practice, to embracing mediation over litigation, to eventually becoming a mediation trainer. Along the way she learned to embrace change, see opportunities that others don&apos;t see, and adopt an abundance mindset that brings her joy.<br/><br/>In this podcast episode, Susan reveals how the global pandemic provided her with an unexpected opportunity to grow her online mediation training program.¬† During CoVid Susaan helped lawyers and mediators adapt to the &quot;new normal&quot;¬† of online¬† mediation and litigation.¬† <br/><br/>Susan also explored how the career changes she&apos;s navigated in her life have brought her optimism, joy, and an unwavering belief in the power of decision-making to embrace change.<br/><br/><b>About Susan</b></p><p>Nationally recognized as one of the <b>Top Family Law Attorneys and Mediators</b> in the United States, <b>Susan Guthrie</b> has been at the forefront of divorce practice for more than 30 years. ¬† After more than 20 years as a name partner in a leading law firm in Connecticut followed by establishing her own boutique Family Law and Mediation practice in 2012, Susan has in the past two years transitioned into one of the leading family, collaborative and mediation trainers in the world and regularly works with and consults with divorce professionals and attorneys in growing and marketing their practice for a happier and healthier life.</p><p>As<b> an internationally well-regarded expert in online mediation</b> Susan has been training colleagues and other professionals in the practical and ethical considerations of conducting their mediations online with her innovative programs and webinars for more than two years. ¬†</p><p>¬†Susan has been featured in and on media outlets such as <b>CNBC, Market Watch, Forbes, Eye on Chicago, WGN, KROQ, the ABA‚Äôs Just Resolutions Magazine, New York Lawyer Magazine, Thrive Global, The Independent, Medium, Authority Magazine and She Knows</b> among others.¬† Susan is the creator and host of the award-winning <a href='https://divorceandbeyondpod.com/'><b>The Divorce &amp; Beyond Podcast with Susan Guthrie, Esq.</b></a> AND <a href='https://makemoneymediating.podbean.com/'><b>The Make Money Mediating Podcast</b></a><b>.</b></p><p>¬†</p><p><b>Where to Connect with Susan</b></p><p>You can connect with Susan on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/susaneguthrie/'>Susan Guthrie</a>¬† and on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/susanguthrieesq/'>Susan Guthrie</a> and <a href='https://www.instagram.com/divorceandbeyond/'>Divorce and Beyond</a>.<br/><br/></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. Susan Guthrie, a nationally recognized family law attorney, mediator, and mediation trainer has done all of that and more.¬† <br/><br/>Susan went from being a litigator and a partner in a leading Connecticut law firm, to launching her own practice, to embracing mediation over litigation, to eventually becoming a mediation trainer.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Ever wondered if your spouse might be hiding assets in your divorce? <br/><br/>For over 25 years, forensic accountant and Fraud Coach Tracy Coenan has been working in corporate America and high net-worth divorces to help her clients discover financial misbehavior. <br/><br/>In this episode, she identifies the most common red flags anyone can use to spot potential financial fraud.¬† She also breaks down the steps you can take to discover whether your spouse is hiding money, or has been using marital assets to fund an extra-marital affair. <br/><br/>Tracy has also created the Fraud Coach Assessment - a quick and simple tool for determining whether there may be potential financial shenanigans in your marriage or divorce. <br/><br/>If you&apos;re concerned that your spouse may be hiding money, diverting income, or playing financial games in your divorce, this episode can be a total eye-opener.<br/><br/>Go to <a href='https://www.fraudcoach.com/karen'>fraudcoach.com/karen</a> to take Tracy&apos;s 3 minute fraud assessment and find out whether you should be concerned that your spouse is hiding assets from you in your marriage and/or divorce. (Plus you&apos;ll find a special $100 coupon code for the Divorce Money Guide there as well!)<br/><br/><b>About Tracy</b></p><p>Tracy has been investigating fraud for more than 25 years, but she didn‚Äôt always want to be a forensic accountant. With a dream of one day being a prison warden, Tracy went to Marquette University in Milwaukee, WI to get a criminology degree. A class on financial crime investigations reminded her how much she loved Encyclopedia Brown books as a kid. She continued her criminology degree, but added accounting and economics courses so she could sit for the CPA exam‚Ä¶ and here Tracy is, finding money in cases of corporate fraud, high net worth divorce, and other financial shenanigans.</p><p><b>Where to Connect with Tracy</b></p><p><br/>You can find Tracy on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/tracycoenen/'>Tracy Coenen</a>, on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/tracy.coenen'>Tracy Coenen</a>, on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/divorcemoneyguide/'>Divorce Money Guide</a>, and on YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@divorcemoneyguide'>Divorce Money Guide</a>.¬† Special Bonus exclusively for listeners of Off The Fence Podcast:¬† you can take Tracy‚Äôs Red Flag Assessment for free and find a special $100 coupon code for the Divorce Money Guide at Tracy‚Äôs website <a href='https://www.fraudcoach.com/karen'>Fraud Coach</a>.<br/><br/></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <itunes:title>How a CPA Can Help You Manage Unforeseen Tax Consequences of Divorce With Sylwia Nazar</itunes:title>
    <title>How a CPA Can Help You Manage Unforeseen Tax Consequences of Divorce With Sylwia Nazar</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[CPA Sylwia Nazar is a perfect example of the American Dream in action. She came to the United States from Poland when she was 19 years old. Since then, she has risen to partnership in a major accounting firm and is committed to helping other women climb the ladder of success as well.  In this episode of Off the Fence, Sylwia demystifies the complex world of divorce and taxes. She explains the essential role a CPA plays in advising clients about the often-overlooked tax consequences of a divor...]]></itunes:summary>
    <description><![CDATA[<p>CPA Sylwia Nazar is a perfect example of the American Dream in action. She came to the United States from Poland when she was 19 years old. Since then, she has risen to partnership in a major accounting firm and is committed to helping other women climb the ladder of success as well.<br/><br/>In this episode of <em>Off the Fence</em>, Sylwia demystifies the complex world of divorce and taxes. She explains the essential role a CPA plays in advising clients about the often-overlooked tax consequences of a divorce asset allocation.¬† She also describes how a CPA¬† works with the other members of a divorce professional team to provide clients with the advice and expertise they need to safeguard their interests both in and out of divorce.<br/><br/>Making good financial decisions requires a solid understanding of the tax implications of those decisions.¬† Having a CPA on your divorce team can be just as critical - especially in divorces that involve complicated investments and tax issues.<br/><br/>If you&apos;re debating whether you need - or should use - a¬† Certified Public Accountant in your divorce, this is a &quot;must listen to&quot; episode!<br/><br/><b>About Sylwia</b></p><p>Sylwia is a CPA, a CDFA and partner with Friedman Huey &amp; Associates. She works with individuals, families, and businesses to deliver customized tax and wealth planning solutions.</p><p>She provides her clients with insights and integrity to their accounting matters and focuses on forming lasting relationships with her clients. She collaborates with financial advisors, attorneys and insurance agents to help her clients achieve their business and personal goals, get the best solutions for them.</p><p>Sylwia believes that the teamwork she uses is critical to providing her clients with the peace of mind they deserve.</p><p><b>Where to Connect with Sylwia</b></p><p><br/>You can find Sylwia on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/sylwia-nazar/'>Sylwia Nazar</a>, at <a href='https://fhassoc.com/sylwia-nazar'>Friedman &amp; Huey Associates LLP</a> or by email at <a href='mailto:snazar@fhassoc.com'>snazar@fhassoc.com</a>.<br/><br/></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></description>

    <description><![CDATA[<p>How can small businesses cope when their employees are distracted by divorce? <br/><br/>In this episode, certified HR professional Traci Austin shares her insights about how understanding the unique needs of each employee contributes to business success. <br/><br/>Traci explores how the seasons of life (marriage, divorce, the birth of a child, or dealing with an aging parent) can affect an employee&apos;s performance. She also explains that by providing grace and empathy to employees during these difficult moments an employer can foster trust and gratitude that will ultimately lead to a more successful and fulfilled workforce. <br/><br/>In this far-ranging conversation, we dive deeply into talent optimization, trust, personal responsibility, and more.<br/><br/>Don&apos;t miss this informative and engaging episode with HR expert Traci Austin!<br/><br/><b>About Traci</b></p><p>Traci Austin is a certified HR professional with two decades of experience building HR departments from the ground up for small businesses. Her mission is to create the container for every employee, if they choose, to be fulfilled in their work while meeting business outcomes. She does this through employee development and engagement, performance consulting, training facilitation and coaching HR professionals.</p><p>¬†</p><p>Traci uses her consulting expertise to serve clients in applying behavioral concepts to hiring and selection, designing and implementing talent pathways, coaching, motivation, and leadership.¬† She is a highly sought after expert on these topics.¬† She hosts a weekly podcast titled, Talent Optimization with Traci Scherck and has been distributed to thousands of HR professionals and business leaders across the globe. ¬†</p><p>¬†</p><p>She is the Chief Strategy Consultant and owner of Elevated Talent Consulting, a certified women owned business, that impacts small business and HR professionals in exceeding performance expectations while being fulfilled in their work.¬†</p><p>¬†</p><p><b>Where to Connect with Traci</b></p><p><b>¬†</b></p><p>Traci is the Chief Talent Officer at <a href='https://elevatedtalentconsulting.com/'>Elevated Talent Consulting</a> and the host of <a href='https://elevatedtalentconsulting.com/podcast-2/'>Talent Optimization Podcast</a>.¬† You also find Traci on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/HRinnovates'>Talent Optimization Podcast</a>, Twitter at <a href='https://twitter.com/TraciLScherck'>Traci L Scherck</a>, at LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/traci-scherck/'>Traci Scherck</a> and via email at <a href='Traci@elevatedtalentconsulting.com'>Traci@elevatedtalentconsulting.com</a><br/><br/></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Do you ever feel like connecting with your kids is an uphill battle? Today&apos;s episode features an enlightening conversation with Rita Morris, a parent coach and psychotherapist, who sheds light on how we can strengthen our relationships with our children by meeting them where they&apos;re at and teaching them decision-making skills from a young age. <br/><br/>Rita discusses how to navigate differing parenting styles. Rita shares examples of how simple adjustments can create a healthier, more connected relationship between parents and children. <br/><br/>If you&apos;re looking to enhance communication, set boundaries, and understand your children better, buckle up for a game-changing episode with Rita Morris!<br/><br/><b>About Rita</b></p><p>Rita has a Master&apos;s Degree in Education, is a Certified Life Coach, a Parent Coach, and a Licensed Mental Health Counselor. She‚Äôs a Pilates lover, audiobook junkie, an avid crafter, and I an even more avid shopper.</p><p>¬†</p><p><b>Where to Connect with Rita</b></p><p>You can find Rita on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/aparentspath/'>A Parents Path</a> and at her website <a href='https://www.aparentspath.com/'>A Parents Path</a><br/><br/></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <itunes:title>Andrew Hatherley: Rising from the Ashes of Gray Divorce to Create an Amazing Life</itunes:title>
    <title>Andrew Hatherley: Rising from the Ashes of Gray Divorce to Create an Amazing Life</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Are you prepared to navigate the complexities of Gray Divorce and uncover the potential for personal growth that comes with it?   Join this conversation with Andrew Hatherley, founder and CEO of Wiser Divorce Solutions, Transcend Retirement, and host of the Gray Divorce podcast.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Are you prepared to navigate the complexities of Gray Divorce and uncover the potential for personal growth that comes with it? <br/><br/>Join this conversation with Andrew Hatherley, founder and CEO of Wiser Divorce Solutions, Transcend Retirement, and host of the Gray Divorce podcast.¬† <br/><br/>Andrew dives deeply into the concept of post-traumatic growth and how it can help those going through a divorce develop resilience and strength in spite of the challenges they face.¬† Andrew shares how committing to a healthier lifestyle, opening a new business, and even writing a novel, helped him bounce back from his own gray divorce.<br/><br/>Andrew explores the idea of how divorce can help us get to know ourselves on a deeper level. He also examines the concept of &quot;Helper&apos;s Eye&quot; and its potential to help break negative cycles.<br/><br/>Don&apos;t miss out on this inspiring and insightful conversation with Andrew Hatherley as we explore the opportunities for growth and self-discovery that can arise from Gray Divorce.<br/><br/><b>About Andrew</b></p><p>After going through his own gray divorce, Andrew decided to help others avoid the financial and emotional stress so common to the process. Andrew earned the designation Certified Divorce Financial Analyst¬Æ and is trained in both divorce mediation and Collaborative Divorce. In 2022, Andrew started <a href='https://www.transcendretirement.net/podcast'>The Gray Divorce Podcast</a>, which is focused on mid-late life divorcees.</p><p>Andrew has over 25 years‚Äô experience in investment management and financial planning. He has also studied with leaders in the field of humanistic and positive psychology and is a strong advocate for the role creativity can play in personal growth after trauma.</p><p>Andrew has a Master of Business Administration from McGill University and ESADE. He has lived and worked in five countries and speaks Spanish. Andrew loves to write, travel, play pickleball and tennis and discuss classic movies with fellow film buffs.</p><p>¬†</p><p><b>Where to Connect with Andrew</b></p><p>Andrew Hatherley is the founder and CEO of <a href='http://www.wiserdivorcesolutions.com/'>Wiser Divorce Solutions, LLC</a> and <a href='http://www.transcendretirement.net/'>Transcend Retirement, LLC</a> and the host of <a href='https://www.transcendretirement.net/podcast'>The Gray Divorce Podcast</a>. You can find Andrew on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/WiserDivorceSolutions'>Wiser Divorce Solutions</a> and LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/andrewhatherley/'>Andrew Hatherley</a>.¬† You can also watch his videos on his YouTube channel at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCDHWXjb3r8GmlWrRTb46cOw'>Wiser Divorce Solutions</a>. ¬†<br/><br/></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>When Kathryn Hoffman had to sell her home in her divorce in late 2009 she quickly discovered that her realtor didn‚Äôt have the divorce expertise required to answer her questions or help her make the best decisions.¬†</p><p>Fast forward to today and as a Certified Divorce Real Estate Expert Kathryn now helps her divorcing clients get the information and support they need to sell their homes for the best price possible. Kathryn likes to say that in a divorce, she represents the house, not one particular spouse. She helps her clients deal with court orders regarding the house, and navigate the difficulties involved when one spouse wants to sell in the house, and the other spouse does not.<br/><br/><b>About Kathryn</b></p><p>Kathryn holds the designation of an Accredited Buyers Representative (A.B.R.) as well as a Graduate of the Real Estate Institute (G.R.I.) and the prestigious designation of a Certified Residential Specialist (C.R.S.). Only 2% of Realtors across the country have earned the C.R.S. designation.¬†</p><p>Graduating from Ilumni Institute‚Äôs master level training, led by family law attorneys, judges, Certified Divorce Lending Professional‚Äôs (CDLP) and divorce real estate experts, Kathryn ‚Äúrepresents the house‚Äù as a neutral third party. Her extensive skills, training and education ensure the process is streamlined, fair and amicable for everyone involved by balancing neutrality and professionalism. She is also an affiliate with Collaborative Divorce Illinois (CDI), The DuPage County Bar Association (DCBA) as well as the International Academy of Collaborative Professionals (IACP).<br/><br/></p><p>Kathryn has earned the S.R.E.S. designation - Senior Real Estate Specialist- to assist with the needs of homeowners who may need extra care to prepare for the sale and move from their home.¬† Other qualifications include C.N.E., Certified Negotiation Expert and P.S.A., Pricing Strategy Advisor designations.<br/><br/></p><p><b>Where to Connect with Kathryn</b></p><p>You can learn more about Kathryn on her website <a href='https://www.realtordivorceexpert.com/'>Realtor Divorce Expert</a> and email her at <a href='mailto:khoffman@realtordivorceexpert.com'>khoffman@realtordivorceexpert.com</a>.¬† You can also find Kathryn on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KathrynHoffmanRealtor'>Kathryn Hoffman, Century 21 Circle</a>, on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/kathryn-hoffman-27642827/'>Kathryn Hoffman</a>, Twitter at <a href='https://twitter.com/kdh6572'>Kathryn Hoffman</a> and her YouTube channel at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@kathrynhoffman'>Kathryn Hoffman</a>.<br/><br/></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Taking control of your finances doesn&apos;t have to be complicated or difficult. But if you want to be financially secure, it&apos;s necessary. That&apos;s true no matter who you are or what the state of your finances may be. It&apos;s especially true when you&apos;re navigating a challenging lifecycle event, like divorce or the death of a spouse.<br/><br/>Cris Kalivas has been guiding her clients at every stage of life to make better financial decisions for decades. With her down-to-earth attitude and step-by-step approach, Cris makes personal finance understandable and manageable.<br/><br/>If you&apos;ve ever wanted to get a handle on your personal finances, this is the podcast episode for you. <br/><br/><b>About Cris</b></p><p>‚ÄúCris‚Äù Kalivas has been in the financial industry since 1987.¬† She started out in the municipal bond business, underwriting new bond issues and participating in investment banking. Cris was the Head National Underwriter bidding on national syndicates underwriting hundreds of millions of dollars of debt for municipalities across the country.¬†</p><p>While working as an underwriter Cris noticed a large population of friends, family, neighbors and acquaintances who appeared lost at the slightest mention of financial terms.¬† That gave birth to her desire to bring financial literacy to everyone. Cris quickly changed careers and achieved her CFP¬Æ designation to begin serving others through financial planning.¬†</p><p>Cris holds a BA in Public Administration from Drake University and in addition to the professional designation of a CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER¬† (CFP¬Æ) she also has a CDFA¬Æ (CERTIFIED DIVORCE FINANCIAL ANALYST) designation. ¬†</p><p>Cris is married to her high school sweetheart, Nick.     <title>How to Design Your Relationship So It Lasts</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Show Notes Relationship success starts with choosing the right person to be your spouse or partner, and then making sure that you and your spouse/partner are on the same page about the issues that matter.     <description><![CDATA[<p><b>Show Notes<br/></b>Relationship success starts with choosing the right person to be your spouse or partner, and then making sure that you and your spouse/partner are on the same page about the issues that matter. That includes talking about your values, how you feel about children, and your visions and ideas about money.<br/><br/>Theresa Kulat is a lawyer, mediator, Collaborative Divorce Professional, and energy worker who helps her clients create intentional relationships with those they love. Whether a couple is just contemplating marriage, or is trying to reconfigure a marriage or relationship that isn&apos;t working, Theresa uses a process of intentional relationship design to help that couple create the marriage or relationship they both want.<br/>¬†<br/><b>About Theresa</b></p><p><b>Theresa Beran Kulat</b> stands for healthy relationships. For over 20 years, she has been helping families heal through her working as a divorce mediator and Collaborative lawyer.¬† She is a Fellow of Collaborative Divorce Illinois, having held many leadership positions including President in 2016 and 2017. She also belongs to the International Academy of Collaborative Professionals and the Illinois State Bar Association. Her writing credits include: ‚Äú<em>Holistic Divorce: An Opportunity for Transformation</em>‚Äù, published in Stress-Free Divorce and the ‚Äú<em>Collaborative Process Act Chapter</em>‚Äù in Gitlin on Divorce. Her law firm, Trinity Family Law, provides holistic divorce services.¬† Theresa also has mastery level training from TantraNova Institute and Quantum Healing training in The Rowley Method and has been an astrologer since the 1980s.</p><p>¬†</p><p><b>Where to Connect with Theresa</b></p><p>You can find Theresa on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/t_b_kulat/'>T. B.     <itunes:title>How Parenting Co-Ordination Works in High Conflict Divorce</itunes:title>
    <title>How Parenting Co-Ordination Works in High Conflict Divorce</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Episode Description High-conflict parents often fight over their kids throughout their divorce, and for years afterward.  They become "frequent flyers" in the court system, embroiling their kids in ongoing legal battles that drain both parents' resources and cause enormous anxiety for their children.  Parenting coordinators are specially-trained divorce professionals who work with parents to resolve their conflicts quickly, efficiently, and OUTSIDE of the court system.  Yet, be...]]></itunes:summary>
    <description><![CDATA[<p><b>Episode Description</b></p><p>High-conflict parents often fight over their kids throughout their divorce, and for years afterward.¬† They become &quot;frequent flyers&quot; in the court system, embroiling their kids in ongoing legal battles that drain both parents&apos; resources and cause enormous anxiety for their children.¬†</p><p>Parenting coordinators are specially-trained divorce professionals who work with parents to resolve their conflicts quickly, efficiently, and OUTSIDE of the court system.¬† Yet, because parenting coordination is so new in the world of family law, people often misunderstand what parenting coordination is, and who it can help.</p><p>In this episode, Dr. Jennifer Lavin, and Dr. Gail Petrich both discuss their roles as parenting coordinators and how they work with high-conflict parents to decide their parenting issues and keep them out of court.</p><p><br/><b>Show Notes</b></p><p><b>About Jennifer<br/></b>Dr. Jennifer Lavin is the principal attorney of <a href='https://lavinfamilylaw.com/'>Jennifer L. Lavin, P.C.</a> Jennifer focuses her practice exclusively on divorce and family law matters. Jennifer is a divorce and family law mediator in Cook County, and a fellow with the Collaborative Law Institute of Illinois. She&apos;s also a court-appointed child representative guardian ad litem and parenting coordinator in Cook County. As a child of divorced parents, a former college professor, and a litigant in her own divorce, Jennifer has a unique understanding of, and approach to, the divorce process that provides a comprehensive education for her clients regarding how their family law matters stand to impact themselves and their children.¬†</p><p>¬†</p><p><b>Where to Connect with Jennifer<br/></b>You can find Dr. Lavin on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/jenniferllavinpc/'>Jennifer L. Lavin, PC</a>, on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/dr-jennifer-rexroat-lavin-41851a/'>Dr. Jennifer Rexroat Lavin</a>,¬† or on her website <a href='https://lavinfamilylaw.com/'>Lavin Family Law</a>¬†</p><p>¬†</p><p><b>About Gail<br/></b>Dr. Gail Petrich has been an attorney and a psychologist for over 25 years. She focuses her practice exclusively on divorce and family law matters. She has many years of experience as a litigator and guardian ad litem, a parenting coordinator, a mediator, a co-parenting coach, a custody evaluator, and a divorce coach in litigation, mediation and collaborative divorce. Dr. Petrich is also a Collaborative Law attorney and Collaborative child specialist, a co-parenting group class leader, and a family, individual, child and adolescent therapist. Dr. Petrich helps families stay out of court whenever possible. For families already embroiled in the court process, she helps reduce the conflict so there&apos;s less harm to children. Families, even those who are in litigation, can learn as much about communication and negotiation as possible to take their conflict out of court.¬†</p><p>¬†</p><p><b>Where to Connect with Gail<br/></b>You can find Dr. Petrich on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/drgailpetrich/'>Dr. Gail Petrich</a> and on her website <a href='https://gailpetrich.com/'>Gail Petrich</a></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></description>
    <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p><b>Episode Description</b></p><p>High-conflict parents often fight over their kids throughout their divorce, and for years afterward.¬† They become &quot;frequent flyers&quot; in the court system, embroiling their kids in ongoing legal battles that drain both parents&apos; resources and cause enormous anxiety for their children.¬†</p><p>Parenting coordinators are specially-trained divorce professionals who work with parents to resolve their conflicts quickly, efficiently, and OUTSIDE of the court system.¬† Yet, because parenting coordination is so new in the world of family law, people often misunderstand what parenting coordination is, and who it can help.</p><p>In this episode, Dr. Jennifer Lavin, and Dr. Gail Petrich both discuss their roles as parenting coordinators and how they work with high-conflict parents to decide their parenting issues and keep them out of court.</p><p><br/><b>Show Notes</b></p><p><b>About Jennifer<br/></b>Dr. Jennifer Lavin is the principal attorney of <a href='https://lavinfamilylaw.com/'>Jennifer L. Lavin, P.C.</a> Jennifer focuses her practice exclusively on divorce and family law matters. Jennifer is a divorce and family law mediator in Cook County, and a fellow with the Collaborative Law Institute of Illinois. She&apos;s also a court-appointed child representative guardian ad litem and parenting coordinator in Cook County. As a child of divorced parents, a former college professor, and a litigant in her own divorce, Jennifer has a unique understanding of, and approach to, the divorce process that provides a comprehensive education for her clients regarding how their family law matters stand to impact themselves and their children.¬†</p><p>¬†</p><p><b>Where to Connect with Jennifer<br/></b>You can find Dr. Lavin on Facebook at <a href='https://www.facebook.com/jenniferllavinpc/'>Jennifer L. Lavin, PC</a>, on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/dr-jennifer-rexroat-lavin-41851a/'>Dr. Jennifer Rexroat Lavin</a>,¬† or on her website <a href='https://lavinfamilylaw.com/'>Lavin Family Law</a>¬†</p><p>¬†</p><p><b>About Gail<br/></b>Dr. Gail Petrich has been an attorney and a psychologist for over 25 years. She focuses her practice exclusively on divorce and family law matters. She has many years of experience as a litigator and guardian ad litem, a parenting coordinator, a mediator, a co-parenting coach, a custody evaluator, and a divorce coach in litigation, mediation and collaborative divorce. Dr. Petrich is also a Collaborative Law attorney and Collaborative child specialist, a co-parenting group class leader, and a family, individual, child and adolescent therapist. Dr. Petrich helps families stay out of court whenever possible. For families already embroiled in the court process, she helps reduce the conflict so there&apos;s less harm to children. Families, even those who are in litigation, can learn as much about communication and negotiation as possible to take their conflict out of court.¬†</p><p>¬†</p><p><b>Where to Connect with Gail<br/></b>You can find Dr. Petrich on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/drgailpetrich/'>Dr. Gail Petrich</a> and on her website <a href='https://gailpetrich.com/'>Gail Petrich</a></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times. You can check out Karen&apos;s videos on <a href='https://www.youtube.com/@karencovy95'>YouTube</a>.<br/><br/>You can connect with Karen on <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/karencovy/'>LinkedIn</a>, <a href='https://www.facebook.com/KarenCovy'>Facebook</a>, <a href='https://www.instagram.com/karencovylawyer/'>Instagram</a>, <a href='https://twitter.com/KarenCovy'>Twitter</a>, and on her own website at <a href='https://karencovy.com/'>karencovy.com</a>.<br/><br/><br/></p>]]></content:encoded>

    <description><![CDATA[<p>If you&apos;ve ever thought you might want to litigate your divorce, this podcast episode is one you MUST listen to.</p><p>Divorcing a man from a powerful family meant that Paulette Gloria Rigo was embroiled in litigation for 8 1/2 years. She had to deal with all the typical litigation games, including going all the way up to the state Supreme Court.</p><p>Paulette&apos;s experience has given her a unique perspective and a drive to help others avoid the divorce pitfalls that she fell into in her divorce. Now she works as a divorce coach, helping others navigate through divorce with the knowledge and insight she wished she had had when she litigated her own divorce.</p><p>Listen as Paulette explains how she fought her way through her divorce, learned how to stand up for herself, and came out the other side stronger, calmer and wiser.<br/><br/><b>About Paulette<br/>Paulette Rigo</b> is an experienced ADR mediator, Certified Divorce Coach, Certified Divorce Specialist, Certified Amicable Divorce Professional who has served as a neutral in all types of conflict surrounding family court and divorce. She trained for two years with experienced trial attorney and nationally prominent mediator, arbitrator, ADR trainer Patricia A. Siuta.¬†</p><p><br/></p><p>It is Paulette‚Äôs personal 8.5 year litigated and appellant experience and expertise that makes her so skilled in allowing her clients to stay in control, try to stay out of court, maintain their dignity, create the right team of professionals from the early stage of contemplation to the necessary final steps of healing using practical tools, inspiration and proven models.</p><p><br/></p><p>She personally supports, expertly guides, fiercely coaches clients from the very early stages of contemplation, planning, approaching, researching, managing, surviving, thriving and healing during and after the entire divorce process. ¬† She didn&apos;t find this work... it found her.¬†</p><p><br/>Paulette also hosts private and small group retreats in Belize for women in all stages of the divorce process.¬†</p><p><b><br/>Where to Connect with Paulette</b></p><p><b>You can find Paulette on Facebook at </b><a href='https://www.facebook.com/betterdivorceacademy/'><b>Better Divorce Academy</b></a>, on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/paulettegloriarigo/'>Paulette Gloria Rigo</a>, on Twitter at <a href='https://twitter.com/paulettegloria'>Better Divorce Academy</a>, on YouTube at <a href='https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC6xmhF1sMo-nQaNhgSRfrfQ'>Better Divorce Academy</a>, and¬† on LinkedIn at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/betterdivorceacademy/'>Paulette Rigo</a>.¬† <b>You can also connect with Paulette at her website, at </b><a href='http://www.betterdivorceacademy.com/'><b>Better Divorce Academy</b></a><b> or email her at Paulette@betterdivorceacademy.com<br/></b><br/></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p>Deciding whether to keep the house is one of the biggest, and often thorniest, issues in divorce.¬† After having worked in the mortgage industry for decades, and having navigated her own divorce, Tami Wollensack understands the potential pitfalls involved in making that decision better than most people.</p><p>As a Certified Divorce Lending Professional (CDLP¬Æ) Tami helps you understand how to decide whether to keep your house or sell it based on the facts of your situation.¬† Tami explains how refinancing works and helps you understand whether you can qualify for a new loan on your own post-divorce. Tami also helps you understand how to figure out whether refinancing your home will make sense for you based on current interest rates, your new¬† post-refinance payments, the maintenance costs of your home, and the support income you will either receive or have to pay once your divorce is over.</p><p><br/><br/></p><p><b>About Tami</b><br/><b>Tami Wollensak</b> is a Certified Divorce Lending Professional (CDLP¬Æ)¬† and senior mortgage loan originator for Wintrust Mortgage . Tami is a 25+ year veteran of the mortgage industry and is licensed to lend in 46 states. Specializing in Divorce Mortgage Planning, Tami takes a holistic approach to the process of evaluating mortgage options in the context of the overall financial objectives as they relate to divorcing situations prior to settlement for the best outcome.<br/> <br/>Wintrust Mortgage is a division of Barrington Bank &amp; Trust Company, N.A., a Wintrust Community Bank NMLS #449042, Tami Wollensak, CDLP, Senior Mortgage Consultant, NMLS #1963450<br/><br/><b>Where to Connect with Tami<br/><br/></b><a href='mailto:tami@tamiwollensak.com'>tami@tamiwollensak.com</a><br/><a href='https://www.tamiwollensak.com/'>https://www.tamiwollensak.com/</a><br/> <a href='http://www.TakeOrLeaveTheHouse.com'>www.TakeOrLeaveTheHouse.com</a><br/><br/><br/></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <description><![CDATA[<p><b>Leighann Lovely</b> is an independent HR Consultant who got tired of keeping her bi-polar disorder under wraps. In this episode Leighann talks about her diagnosis and the reasons behind her decision to start openly talking about her mental health issues, even though she knew that by doing so it would cost her business and could affect her career.</p><p>Leighann talks about the way that she makes decisions and the way she keeps herself from letting the &quot;parade of horribles&quot; from stopping her from making real progress in her life. Leighann&apos;s story is full of courage and is a testimony to the value of being true to yourself.<br/><br/><b>About Leighann</b></p><p><b>Leighann Lovely </b>is an independent HR and Business Development Consultant. She has a a BA in Business and nearly 20 years of combined experience in Human Resources and Staffing. Leighann puts a huge emphasis on the Human side of human resources and advocates supporting the needs of people. She believes that if you are not learning something new everyday you are missing out on an opportunity to be great.</p><p>Leighann is also the host of the podcast <a href='https://lets-talk-hr.com/'>Let‚Äôs Talk HR ‚Äì Humanizing the Conversation</a>.</p><p><b>Where to Connect with Leighann</b></p><p>You can find¬† Leighann on Linked in at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/leighannl/'>Leighann Lovely</a> and on Twitter at<a href='https://twitter.com/Leighann_lovely'> Leighann_lovely</a>.     <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p><b>Leighann Lovely</b> is an independent HR Consultant who got tired of keeping her bi-polar disorder under wraps.     <itunes:title>Getting out of Victim Consciousness and Follow Your Desire</itunes:title>
    <title>Getting out of Victim Consciousness and Follow Your Desire</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Jenny Glick was a successful couples therapist who ran a clinic in Colorado and got great results for her clients.     <description><![CDATA[<p><b>Jenny Glick</b> was a successful couples therapist who ran a clinic in Colorado and got great results for her clients. But after awhile, Jenny realized that owning and operating a therapy center was no longer what she wanted to do. So when she was 45 years old, she and her husband sold everything and, with their son, moved to Mexico.</p><p>Jenny talks about how making this decision terrified her. Yet she followed her inner knowing, listened to her desire, and made the huge leap of faith involved in leaving the life she knew to create the life she wanted. Jenny now coaches and mentors people all over the world and guides them to listen to their own desire and create a life that fulfills them.<br/><br/><b>Show Notes<br/></b><br/></p><p><b>About Jenny Glick<br/></b><br/></p><p><b>Jenny Glick </b>has been working with couples, families, and women for over 25 years. Her work has included owning and running a successful counseling center in Denver, CO serving couples struggling with connection, intimacy, and stuck in the do-I-stay-or-go hamster wheel.<br/><br/></p><p>In 2018, Jenny, sold her brick-and-mortar practice in order to go rogue and build a company online where she now mentors women and men ready to live in alignment with their deepest desires. In 2019, Jenny and her family moved to the beaches of Mexico for a two-year sojourn which further fueled her commitment to support others in following their own longings in life.<br/><br/></p><p>Today, Jenny and her husband of 23 years live (and love) in Tubac, Arizona where they enjoy hiking in the desert, tending to their organic garden and continuing to follow the impulses of their hearts.<br/><br/></p><p><b>Where to Connect with Jenny<br/></b><br/>You can find Jenny on <a href='https://www.facebook.com/JennyGlickMentor'>Facebook </a>and Linked in at <a href='https://www.linkedin.com/in/jennyglick-relationshipmentor/'>Jenny Glick</a> and on Instagram at <a href='https://www.instagram.com/jenny_glick/'>Jenny_glick</a>.     <itunes:title>Jeanne Gallagher - Taking Control of Your Finances at Every Stage of Life</itunes:title>
    <title>Jeanne Gallagher - Taking Control of Your Finances at Every Stage of Life</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[Jeanne Gallagher is a financial adviser who leads with financial education.     <description><![CDATA[<p><b>Jeanne Gallagher</b> is a financial adviser who leads with financial education. Jeanne works to empower her clients with the knowledge they need to make financial decisions that align with their values and will helo them achieve their goals.</p><p>Jeanne dives deeply into the psychology of fear, which - left unchecked - will derail your financial goals and keep you stuck in indecision about money. She explains what you can do to take control of your finances, no matter who you are, or what stage of life you&apos;re in.</p><p>Jeanne also talks about some of the major life decisions she has had to make in her business and her life, and how you can face the big decisions in your own life with confidence.</p><p>If taking control of your finances (or even just looking at your finances!) scares you, this podcast episode will give you a vital first step in changing your financial future.<br/><br/><b>Show Notes<br/></b><br/></p><p><b>Jeanne Gallagher</b> is an Investment Adviser Representative and Registered Representative with GWN Securities Inc and founder of Discover Rising Tides Podcast : How the outside makes the inside better<br/><br/></p><p><b>Where to Connect with Jeanne</b><br/>You can find Jeanne on her website, <a href='http://jgallagher@seasidesolutions.net/'><b>Seaside Solutions</b></a>. To contact Jeanne you can email her at <a href='mailto:hello@discoverrisingtides.com'>hello@discoverrisingtides.com</a>¬† or call her at (530) 401-5009. She explains what you can do to take control of your finances, no matter who you are, or what stage of life you&apos;re in.</p><p>Jeanne also talks about some of the major life decisions she has had to make in her business and her life, and how you can face the big decisions in your own life with confidence.</p><p>If taking control of your finances (or even just looking at your finances!) scares you, this podcast episode will give you a vital first step in changing your financial future.<br/><br/><b>Show Notes<br/></b><br/></p><p><b>Jeanne Gallagher</b> is an Investment Adviser Representative and Registered Representative with GWN Securities Inc and founder of Discover Rising Tides Podcast : How the outside makes the inside better<br/><br/></p><p><b>Where to Connect with Jeanne</b><br/>You can find Jeanne on her website, <a href='http://jgallagher@seasidesolutions.net/'><b>Seaside Solutions</b></a>.     <description><![CDATA[<p><b>Hirsch Serman</b> is an <b>MBA, CPA, CDFA</b>, certified divorce financial analyst, and trained mediator. On the show, he discussed his values-based approach to help clients prioritize, organize, and simplify their financial life during and beyond the divorce process. He is committed to helping each client understand the more complex tax and financial implications of their situation. He suggested that clients need to step back and identify their values in order to decide on their priorities and create an approach to manage their finances. He also discussed talking to a spouse to understand their financial situation and having discussions to create a strategy that works for both parties. Finally, he emphasized the importance of understanding the financial implications of their decisions and spending wisely.<br/><br/><b>About Hirsch Serman:<br/>Hirsch Serman, MBA, CPA, CDFA</b> specializes in the financial and tax aspects of divorce.¬† His values-based approach is to <em>Prioritize ~ Organize ~ Simplify</em> your financial life during and beyond the divorce process.¬† Hirsch is committed to helping each client understand the more complex tax and financial implications of his or her specific situation. ¬†</p><p>Find Hirsch at hirsch@lifecycle.financial or <a href='http://www.lifecycle.financial'>www.lifecycle.financial</a><br/><br/></p><p><b>Special Offer:</b>¬† Free Consultation<br/><br/></p><p><br/><b>Karen Covy</b> is a Divorce Coach and Consultant, Lawyer, Author, and Speaker who is dedicated to helping people make the best decisions possible for themselves, their families, and their future - especially in stressful times.     <itunes:title>Navigating toxic relationships and deciding whether to leave</itunes:title>
    <title>Navigating toxic relationships and deciding whether to leave</title>
    <itunes:summary><![CDATA[In this episode, Holly Herzog and Karen Covy dive deeply into setting boundaries, developing confidence, and understanding the dynamics of a toxic relationship.     <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode, Holly Herzog and Karen Covy dive deeply into setting boundaries, developing confidence, and understanding the dynamics of a toxic relationship. We also explore the issues involved in deciding whether to get a divorce when your marriage is toxic.<br/><br/>Holly explains how she uses her therapy skills to help people who are in the early or post-divorce stages process their emotions. She provides advice on how to deal with grief, anger, and difficult exes so that you can get through your divorce with integrity, grace, and compassion.</p><p><b>Holly Herzog</b> is a therapist, coach, and writer who has been offering her services for over 20 years.     <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this episode, Holly Herzog and Karen Covy dive deeply into setting boundaries, developing confidence, and understanding the dynamics of a toxic relationship. We also explore the issues involved in deciding whether to get a divorce when your marriage is toxic.<br/><br/>Holly explains how she uses her therapy skills to help people who are in the early or post-divorce stages process their emotions.
